SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c119:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

Sipping my warm caffe latte, I thought to myself.
What should I do, I have nothing to do.
I’ve cleaned, washed the dishes, restocked, paid the bills, and even organised my phone’s photo album. I guess I’ve been working too hard all this time. The long-awaited free time feels awkward.
“Ash, there are no customers, let’s take a break.”

“…Okay.”
I made cafe mocha and some snacks for Ash, then I tried to find a game to play on my phone.
“Everyone went too far….”
Ju Noeul, who was sitting at a table by the window and drinking her coffee, spoke in a low voice.
“How can you leave this place and support that fake….”
Ju Noeul was extremely angry about <Super Buff Coffee>, claiming that it was a fake. She got into a fight while criticising the cafe on the Hunter Channel. As a result, she got banned from the Hunter Channel for a month. Seeing her suffer from Internet community withdrawal, I felt both grateful and sorry for her.
I hope she gets unbanned soon…
“I don’t get it either.”
These were the words of Ki Yoohyun, who had just arrived at the cafe and ordered a coffee.
“It goes without saying that Rieul-ssi’s coffee tastes much better. A lot of people have problems with their sense of taste.”
Since there were only two customers in the cafe, I naturally heard their voices. Ju Noeul nodded her head and said, “You must be a customer with great taste.”
“Ah. We met at Christmas.” 
Although that Christmas party ended early due to the confusion over the news about <Super Buff Coffee>, which is sad.
“Hunter Ju Noeul also has a fine taste.”
“I admit it….”
A dramatic consensus was formed between the two.
“Haha, thank you both.”
It is inevitable that the number of customers has decreased. Cafes are about location, location, and location. A large chain with uniform services in front of the exit of the downtown subway station versus a private cafe with delicious coffee in the remote residential area? It’s obvious which one will get the most customers.
In addition, it is a large four-story cafe in the downtown area where large guilds are concentrated while my cafe is in front of the Dungeon Gate. Given the same buff, people would probably prefer the more accessible one.
However, a few regulars kept coming back to Cafe Rieul and were upset about the current situation.
One of them is Kim Jina….
“I’m sorry. I went through all the relevant regulations yesterday, but the legal basis for punishing Super Buff Coffee is ambiguous.”“Huck, you looked it all up?!”“I’m shocked that there’s a loophole in the regulations like this!”“Ahahaha … it can’t be helped. Thank you for your concern.”“If I had more power, I could make a regulation to punish those cowardly fake bastards right away! I’m furious!”“Your kind intention is already making me happy enough.”“Hmph, now is not the time for this. I need to pass the promotion test and get my hands on the power!”“….Jina-ssi?”“For the betterment of the Hunter world….!”
This incident burned her enthusiasm for promotion.
I packed her a set of Iced americano and butter cookies to relieve her stress. With that kind of enthusiasm, I’m sure she’ll be promoted soon. I just hope she doesn’t overwork herself.
Also, Kwon Jiwoon and Choi Yichan stopped by the cafe together. They said they were on their way to the Dungeon to organise a party to celebrate Choi Yichan’s joining the White Silver Guild.
“I see. If you’re going to the dungeon, you might as well take out some coffees. What do you want?”“From the beginning to the end of the menu….”“……Kwon Jiwoon?”“Ten cups each.”“Oppa, if you drink that much, you’ll get addicted to caffeine?”“It’s okay. I’ll drink them all and then use the Status Abnormalities Potion.”“What? What the hell does that mean … Yichan-ah, stop Kwon Jiwoon.”“Hahaha! Is your brother overdoing it? I’ll keep it moderate. Just five drinks each from the beginning to the end of the menu.”“……no.”
Do you think I’m going to sleep on the street right now?
I packed both of them with just enough coffee so they wouldn’t get addicted to caffeine.
In addition, Lee Chorok sent me a box of Shine Muscat, and … I worried excessively about this.
Things turned out this way, but I was fine. I’m not pretending to be okay, I’m really okay. I thought I wanted to help the world with my coffee, but being a popular celebrity cafe owner is not fit for me. I don’t like the fact that every little thing I say on social media gets turned into an article. It’s embarrassing when you go to the supermarket and someone recognises you.
‘I don’t want anyone to know me….’
Can’t you just think of me as an NPC that sells coffee?
While I was in this burdensome situation, another buff coffee vendor appeared.
Now that Super Buff Coffee has opened, I should go back to my original plan and aim for the ‘Hidden Cafe in front of a Secluded Dungeon Gate‘.
It would be a win-win for me to have a large chain cafe do the hard work for the Hunters. I’ll leave the passionate business to Super Buff Coffee and stick to my role as a quiet F-class cafe owner.
I came to this conclusion. However, I had one question.
I ate the leftover rice cakes from yesterday as a snack and stared at Mieum, whose stomach had bulged.
“…Waeoong?”
Mieum felt my gaze and raised her ears.
“Waeung, waeooong (I, it wasn’t just me, Lime ate too)!”
“Kkyuuuuu!”
Yeah, I know. Not that.
“Didn’t you say that I’m the only one who can use the coffee making skill?”
“Waeuuung….”
“Oh, my. Did Mieum lie to me? You said it’s amazing that I’m the only one who can use it … did you just randomly say that?”
“Waeooolg (That’s not true).”
“Mieum, I trusted you, but … I shouldn’t trust a cat.”
“Waeoong, waeooolg (I always tell you the truth, human, on the honor of the Great System)!”
“Hmm….”
“Kyagyagyagyag! Gahh (You don’t believe me! That skill is truly unique to you, no other Hunter has the same skill)!”
I looked at Mieum. Her fur stands on end and she stands on her front paws. In that state, she jumped up and down and punched the air wildly She looks really frustrated.
Judging from this cat’s frenzied behaviour, Mieum’s words seem to be true. This cat is so bad at acting.
“Kkyuuu! Kkyuu!”
Beside her, Lime also sided with Mieum. showing off its support with bouncing its body.
“Okay, I’ll trust you. Then what is Super Buff Coffee? How do they sell buff coffee?”
Mieum, who had put her front paws down again and was sitting on her belly on the floor, shook her head sideways.
“Waeung, waeoong (I don’t know about that, it’s definitely not a skill, they must be using a different method).”
“Okay, I get it for now.”
I stroked Mieum’s rounded chin. She purred, as if she’s happy the suspicions had been resolved.
If not a skill, what is it?
Is there some sort of substance that buffs the coffee? However, mixing a potion wouldn’t mask the bitterness of the potion and it would make it more expensive.
“Hmmm….”
“Rieul-ssi, what’s wrong?”
Ki Yoohyun, who was drinking coffee next to me, spoke to me. The cat meowed all of a sudden and I was lost in thought with complicated expression, so it seems to have bothered him.
Well, whatever method they use, it’s none of my business. I decided not to think about Super Buff Coffee.
Ju Noeul has just left after throwing up her anger, and Ki Yoohyun is the only other customer in the store now. The timing is good. I talked about what I was originally going to say to Ki Yoohyun.
“Did you get rid of the rifts in Gyeongju?”
“Ah, yes. Cheongna is doing a follow-up investigation, but I think it will be over without any major issues.”
“The reason why you suddenly went to Gyeongju, is it because a rift broke there before the regression?”
“Yes, that’s right.”
Ki Yoohyun nodded lightly, “A lot of things are already different than they were before the regression, but there are some things that haven’t changed, so I’m glad we were able to stop it with less damage.”
“Even the Munchkin regressor has a lot of trouble.”
“Hahaha … Munchkin, I’m not that great.”
If anyone else had heard this comment from Ki Yoohyun, they would have called him a deceiver. If he’s not a Munchkin, then who?
“There was also a video on the news, is that okay? I mean … your identity.”
Isn’t it a secret that Ki Yoohyun is Muwon? He smiled at my concern.
“It’s okay. I knew I was being filmed. I knew that my face wasn’t captured, so I left it alone. I was wearing glasses anyway.”
“Glasses? What’s with the glasses?”
Ki Yoohyun was still wearing the glasses he sometimes wore. They didn’t hide his sharp features in the slightest.
“I don’t think they wouldn’t recognize you just with one pair of glasses.”
“I thought it was weird, but … this is a very rare item, even if it looks like this.”
Ki Yoohyun explained with a bitter smile. Those ordinary-looking glasses were an item that he specially ordered. They were said to have the effect of making the wearer unrecognisable to others, meaning that even if they saw Ki Yoohyun’s face, they would quickly forget about him.
“Didn’t Noeul-ssi recognise Yoohyun-ssi earlier?”
“She didn’t recognise me until I spoke to her.”
“Aha.”
Wait, why didn’t it work for me?
Tiling. As soon as I thought so, I got a system notification.
[*system: the skill that intervenes in your consciousness is currently being invalidated.]
“Aha….”
“It is not omnipotent. It just disrupts someone’s consciousness a bit,. Still, it helps when I want to move quietly.”
Clack, the door opened and a new guest came in.
“Hello….”
He was a regular customer who often came to Cafe Rieul. I had a chat with him the other day. His Hunter Channel nickname, ‘HingHangHong‘, which was named after his real name, Kim Hyunghong, was memorable.
For your information, he also had a fight over Super Buff Coffee to defend our cafe on the Hunter Channel and his account got banned … I’m grateful and sorry for that.
Anyway, HingHangHong came to the counter, oblivious to Ki Yoohyun’s presence, and ordered a drink. The effect of the glasses must have been real, because normally there’s no way people wouldn’t have spotted a man that stands out like that.
Huh … but what’s going on? HingHangHong looked very depressed.

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c118:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

I checked the architectural miniature making set box next to it. On the outside it said, “Easy to Make DIY Miniature Sets. Create a Pretty Flower Shop – Great for Children’s Emotional Development“.
How do you remodel a flower shop to become a Demon Castle? 
“Waeolg! This boy, he’s quite talented!”
“Kkyuu! Kkyuuu!”
The animals in my house jumped up and down in front of the Demon Castle, admiring it. I had just created a mental distance between me and my family.
A look of anticipation fell on me, expecting praise. I chose my words as best I could.

“That’s … well, Ash is great.”
“Hmph, this is nothing!”
He added another words with an expectant look on his face, “I can make you another one if you want.”
“Noooooo, I appreciate the thought.”
I’m sorry I couldn’t live up to your expectations. I’m pretty sure I’d have wild dreams if I had one of those in my room.
“….Cheesh.” Sighing, Ash placed the Demon Castle next to the Christmas tree.
In order to cultivate healthy emotions, I have done not only dungeon detox but also labor detox … I don’t know what else I can detox from to get rid of the darkness in Ash….
I have no idea…….
He has very unique tastes, but as long as he’s healthy, I’m good. Huh.
Anyway.
We decorated the cafe for Christmas using the Christmas decorations set. When we finished, this notification window appeared.
[You have completed the Christmas decoration. The effect of the Christmas decoration set is activated].[Effect: The customer who came into the cafe feels like Christmas. Mood: +20]
After all, everyone was already immersed in the Christmas spirit, so we couldn’t feel the effect. Still, it was nice to see the decorations. 
By the time everything was ready, it was a little past noon. It was almost time for the guests to arrive.
Come to think of it, it’s been quite a while since I met Ki Yoohyun. I had heard that he was back from Gyeongju, but I couldn’t meet him. The twins too….
Is it because of the Christmas decoration effect? I’m starting to get excited too. I feel like I’m going to hum the carols.
“Rieul-ssi, hello.”
“Excuse me.”
The first guests who arrived were a duo of government employees, team leader Kang Hyunwoo and Kim Jina. It’s a shame that they’re still in uniform even though today is a public holiday. Kim Jina explained that they couldn’t make it to the party because of work, but they took a moment to stop by.
“You’ve come all the way here, so have some hot chocolate.”
With a heavy heart, I made them both a cup of Christmas hot chocolate. After taking a sip of the hot chocolate, Kim Jina said with a slightly softer expression, “Drinking this somehow makes me feel like I’m on holiday.”
“Hmm, me too, I’ve never felt like this before.” Team leader Kang Hyunwoo agreed with Kim Jina.
“The agenda, don’t you think it’s okay if we don’t finish it today?”
“We finished the urgent stuff last week, so there’s room in the schedule.”
The officials stare at each other’s faces for a moment before coming to a dramatic agreement.
“Then why don’t we just call it a day and enjoy Christmas?”
“That’s a good idea.”
Oh. This ‘It feels like Christmas‘ effect really worked.
Kwon Jiwoon and Choi Yichan came next. While Choi Yichan juggled the animals to the carol beat, I asked Kwon Jiwoon quietly.
“Have you not been able to get in touch with Uncle yet?”
“Yeah. But don’t worry too much. He’s probably off somewhere else getting some fresh air again.”
In fact, when Kwon Jiwoon said that, his face was full of worry. It was understandable, as his father, who had just returned from missing, disappeared again. I handed him a cup of hot chocolate. He went to the corner and started putting ornaments on the fir tree. Yes, I heard that moving your hands is a good stress reliever.
“Eonni, Merry Christmas!”
“You idiot! I was going to say it first!”
“You idiot! Whoever speaks first wins!”
The next guests were the twins, Ki Yoohyun, and Grandma Kim Deokyi. The twins wore cute Santa costumes, and they also brought Ash’s shares of costumes.
“Ugh, are you asking me to wear the clothes of a Saint? This is an insult!”
“Wow, you guys are so cute in those outfits. You look great in them!”
“…Heu-heumm. I could wear it for you at least once.”
I took several photos of the twins and Ash in their Santa costumes. They are really cute.
Grandma Kim Deokyi had a heated discussion with the public officials about transaction fees for crafted items.
Umh … rather than a Christmas party, it seems like everyone is having fun on their own.
Oh well, it’s good if they’re having fun.
Choi Cedric said he couldn’t come because he spent Christmas with his sister every year. That means now there is only one guest left. When all the guests arrive, I can cut the cake then.
Thinking so, I talked to Ki Yoohyun, “Yoohyun-ssi, would you like some hot chocolate?”
“Sure. But why are you looking at me like that?”
“What? What did I look like?”
“You look very curious.”
I was curious about Ki Yoohyun’s reaction when he was in a Christmas mood. So far, he has a calm appearance, not blending in with the Christmas atmosphere around him, but wouldn’t it be different if he drank this hot chocolate?
I’m so curious. What it looks like when this man, who always feels like he’s taking a step back, gets excited?
I was about to hand him the hot chocolate while hiding my ulterior motives.
Boom!
“Big deal…!”
A pale-faced Ju Noeul appeared.
“Noeul-ssi, what’s wrong?”
She was the last person scheduled to attend today’s party. Judging by the red Santa hat on her head, she was on her way to the party.
But what does she mean with ‘big deal‘?
“Big … big deal … heufh….”
“Here, have some cold water first.”
“Heuk, heuuh … thanks, hu, haa….”
Ju Noeul took a one-shot of a cup of ice water and caught her breath. She looked like she’d run a long way.
“What’s the big deal?”
“Look at this……!”
Ju Noeul handed me her tablet and displayed a certain screen. When I checked the screen at her urging, it was an ordinary blog post.

[New Cafe] HIP NEW HOT SPOT ‘SUPER BUFF COFFEE’ in Guild Jungangdong Branch
Writer: Starry
Hello! This is Starry 🙂Guild Jungang-dong, where many famous Hunter Guilds are located, is a hot spot these days, right?There’s a new emotional cafe on Guild Street!Let me introduce “Super Buff Coffee,” a new cafe that’s expected to be a hit. ♬#GuildJungangdongNewCafe #NewCafe #GuildStreetCafe #SuperBuffCoffee #BuffCoffee

It was an introduction post of a cafe, with several photos and a detailed description. The sparkling four-storey building along the boulevard was recently opened. The inside of the cafe was also stylish and colourful with a trendy interior.
They have a great selection of drinks … ah, and the desserts and bakery are good too. The cakes look delicious. It was a cafe with a good location, so it was sure to attract a lot of customers.
“By the way, what’s wrong with this cafe?”
It’s a very nice and colourful cafe, but I didn’t feel a sense of crisis or competition.
Absolutely. How many cafes are there in downtown Seoul, no, all over the country? There is no reason to be surprised by other cafe with a different location, size, and target customer base.
However, Ju Noeul beat her chest in frustration.
“That’s not it…!”
“What?”
“This cafe is promoting that drinking their coffee will give you a buff effect…!”
“……what?”
Only then did I notice the phrase at the bottom of the blog post.

The surprising thing is that the coffee of ‘Super Buff Coffee’ gives a buff effect to Hunters!From restoring your health to increasing your status to removing abnormal conditions♬You can get various and powerful buffs 🙂There are many more types of coffee than the menus in Cafe Rieul, which is famous for its buff coffee, so you can freely choose your favourite.It’s located in the downtown area, so it’s great for busy Hunters ^0^Recommended for Hunters who had a hard time queuing up at Cafe Rieul!Super Buff Coffee is planning to open the Hunter Market, Dungeon Management Office, Guild Crossing, and Yeouido Hunter TV branches soon 🙂Starry’s recommended menu is Einspanner!You should try it.♬

……………….
“At this rate, you’re going to lose your customers….!”
“Oh my…..”
It was a shocking Christmas.

***
The age of glory is over.
To sum up what happened to me in the week leading up to the New Year, I could only say this: a large number of cafe chains called <Super Buff Coffee>, which sell buff coffee like our cafe, have opened.
At first, some people were skeptical of the effectiveness, but that didn’t last long, as all the Hunters who tried their coffee said the effect was real. The stores are all located in downtown Seoul with easy access for Hunters. In addition, large stores with parking lots, stylish interiors, long business hours, and active SNS with their viral marketing, etc … in an instant, Super Buff Coffee became a hit.
Therefore, it was natural that the number of customers in Cafe Rieul was decreasing.
January 2nd. The first business day after the Lunar New Year holiday, the year when I turned 24 years old. Outside the window is a dungeon view with only a cold wind blowing. There’s no shadow of a customer in sight.
This is how my celebrity life, where even the smallest photo on Instagram could be turned into an article, came to an end.

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c117:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

“I heard you don’t go home these days.”
Lee Sein spoke to Choi Cedric. Her gaze was soft, as if she was worried about him.
“Yeah, well. I just don’t.”
Choi Cedric replied, trying to shake off the frightening image that had just flashed through his mind.
“You don’t like where you live? Do you want me to find you somewhere else?”

“It’s not like that. The house is nice.”
Choi Cedric lived alone in a luxury apartment along the Han River owned by C&L Corporation. It is known for its panoramic view from the living room window, lavish interiors, and tight security optimised for celebrities.
It’s a house anyone would envy, but there’s a simple reason why Choi Cedric hasn’t been home much lately: it’s a place where Lee Sein’s eyes can reach. Since it is owned by C&L Corporation and that place is his residence, it is natural for Lee Sein to manage it. However, from some point on, her intervention has been unwelcome and unbearable.
Since when was it? Ah, it was after her secretary disappeared. The uncomfortable feeling has grown to the point where he feels more comfortable in a dungeon with an Eternal Flame than at home.
So no matter where he moves, the situation is the same.
“Really? Then, should we remodel it? While the CEO’s office is also under construction, it would be refreshing to freshen everything completely.”
“Maybe another time. It’s still a bit of a mess.”
“…All right.”
With a bright smile, Lee Sein gave some instructions to the employees. As if to prove the absurdity of the reluctance he’d felt earlier, that figure was exactly Lee Sein whom Choi Cedric knew.
An ambitious yet sensible person who was willing to be a family of Choi Cedric and Choi Rona.
“We only have one family. You should try what you can so that you won’t regret it.”
Again, the conversation he had with Kwon Rieul came to mind. It was something Choi Cedric had once said to her. He said that in such a smug way, but he himself had forgotten that words.
He can’t rely on others. He has to figure out what’s going on around him on his own.
“…Cedric?”
“I just stopped by while passing by. I know CEO-nim is busy, so I’m going to go now.”
“Okay. You’re going to see Rona, right?”
“Yes.”
Despite his words, when Choi Cedric left the representative’s office, it wasn’t to visit Rona’s hospital room.
One floor down from the top floor, around the corner, in the innermost room. It was the office used by the secretary, Aeon, before he disappeared. They had already retrieved anything that might be evidence, but he was still hoping to obtain some information.
In Aeon’s office, two employees were tearing down a partition.
“What’s that?”
“Ah! Oh, Hunter Choi Cedric-nim.”
The employees dropped the partition on the floor and turned around. A brief moment of embarrassment flashed across their faces. However, Choi Cedric didn’t seem to care, and asked again what they were doing.
“CEO Lee Sein-nim said that this office is being demolished, so we were in the process of cleaning it up.”
“Really? It’s different from what she told me.”
“What?”
The employees looked surprised.
“She told me to keep it as it is in case there is evidence that we haven’t found yet.”
“……”
Confused glances met in the air. Lee Sein is a strict about rewards and punishments. If there is confusion in the instructions and it is known that they tampered with the office, they will be greatly reprimanded.
Choi Cedric, who had lied so casually, jerked his head and pointed out the door.
“Leave it.”
“Yes, yes!”
“That’s right. Wait a second. About this.”
Now we’re in trouble. Who said the wrong thing? Choi Cedric called back the employees who were trying to rush out while muttering such complaints.
“It’s better not to report this to the CEO for now. She’s a little sensitive about the construction today.”
There’s a look of hesitation on their faces. According to the ethics, it was necessary to report the confusion of the instructions immediately and reconfirm the contents. However, it would have been a pain in the arse to go report to her while she was in a sensitive state.
Choi Cedric eased their worries with a refreshing smile.
“I’ll put in a good word for you later.”
“….! If you do, we’ll be grateful.”
“Thank you.”
“Go.”
Only when they were completely gone and he couldn’t hear their footsteps did he enter the office. He closed the door behind him and looked around.
The office was empty, however, as all incriminating items had been removed.
“……?”
While looking around, something got stuck in his foot. Looking down, it was a small star-shaped ornament. Is it a keyring?
Choi Cedric moved his gaze towards the direction it had rolled. It’s nothing but a blank wall. No, when he looked closely, there were fine lines drawn on the wall.
“……!”
He tapped on it and there was a sound from the inside. It was obviously hollow.
Choi Cedric drew his sword and thrust it into the gap in the wall. He gave it a good twist and the outer panel came off without difficulty. Beyond the wall was a tiny space, barely big enough for a child to squeeze through. There was nothing to indicate that Aeon had touched it just before he disappeared.
All that remained was a photograph.
It looked like it had been taken a long time ago. It must have been not long after the founding of C&L. Lee Sein was smiling awkwardly at the camera. Beside her was her secretary, Aeon…..
“Ugh…!”
Suddenly, his head hurt. Choi Cedric stumbled and groaned, holding his head. The photo fell out of his hand and onto the floor.
The headache quickly subsided. Choi Cedric wiped the sweat from his brow with his hand and picked up the photo.
It looked like it had been taken a long time ago. It must have been not long after the founding of C&L. Lee Sein was smiling awkwardly at the camera. It’s a self-portrait of Lee Sein.
He felt like he forgot something. What is it? He couldn’t remember.
A small note was written on the back of the photo. The content is….
“Grimoire….?”
***
Cafe sales were booming every day, and unintentionally I became quite famous.
I’m embarrassed to say it, but to my surprise, yesterday I was approached by someone who wanted to make a biography for children with me as a model.
“Thank you for the offer, but I refuse.”“Hunter Kwon Rieul-nim, please reconsider. So that children growing up can look up to you, Hunter-nim….!”“….don’t say such scary things.”
Why do children need to look up to me? I understand you’re looking for fresh items, but isn’t that too much?
The next regularly scheduled holiday, which had finally arrived, happened to be Christmas Day. I decided to throw a Christmas party since it’s been a while. Even if it’s called a party, all I planned was to do was invite acquaintances and have some snacks. I’m tired of the unintentional celebrity life, so I should spend time like this sometimes.
Most of the people I invited said they’d be there, but I didn’t hear back from my Uncle. Not only that, but he didn’t even read the message on KakaoTalk.
I thought he’d be happy because he was dressed as Santa and handing out gifts….
I asked Kwon Jiwoon, but he said he hadn’t even met his father. He said he would search his whereabouts just in case. Judging by the lack of updates on YouTube, I don’t think he went to the mountains again. 
I left him a message asking him to come to the party, even if it was late, and started preparing for the party.
[Dimensional Shop ☆★☆★ Christmas Special Sale ★☆★☆§Loyal Customers§ Exclusive ☞Special/Star/Ser/Vi/Ce ☜This is a special sale only for The Eligible customers who have been loyal to us.Christmas Party Set (including Christmas decoration set and Christmas recipe): ☆★Special Discount Price★☆ 50 Rubies※ Note: If you turn off this window now, you will never be able to purchase it again.]
Ack, my eyes hurt….
The Dimensional Shop was tactfully displaying such items. I could feel their intent to take my hard-earned rubies back from me, but I bought it with great enthusiasm anyway. I’ve worked hard to earn them, so I should feel good about spending them like this.
“Nyaaa, nyaaa (Jingle Bells, Jingle Bells)!”
“Kkyu, kkyu, kkyu!”
“…Bells.”
It’s okay because my family is enjoying it too.
[You have acquired a new recipe ‘Christmas Hot Chocolate’.][You have acquired a new recipe ‘Christmas Cake’.][You have received the purchased Christmas Party Set in your inventory.]
First, I decided to make hot chocolate.
In the mug, I put plenty of Chocolate Sauce from Hell. I poured in the heated milk, let it melt, and then topped it with soft milk foam. In the end, I decorated it with marshmallows and finely chopped chocolate, and it looked pretty good.
[Item: Christmas Hot Chocolate (★★★★☆)Status: Good (Time Remaining: 01:00:00)Effect: It makes you feel like Christmas.]
Uh….?
Indeed, after the Christmas season passed, it would be a meaningless effect.
Next, we made a Christmas cake together. The sponge cake was topped with whipped cream strawberries to make it look delicious.
[The condition has been met.Combo bonus will be generated.Combo: Christmas Party Set (Christmas Hot Chocolate, Christmas Cake)Effect: It makes you incredibly feel like Christmas.]
The cake was kept in the fridge, and we all enjoyed some hot chocolate as a tasting before the guests arrived.
“……?”
However, I didn’t notice any special effects. The hot chocolate, with its savoury milk and rich, sweet chocolate flavour, is very delicious, but that’s all.
“Nyaa, nyaaa, nya (Look out the window, look out the window)!”
“Kkyu, kkyu, kkyu!”
“……….”
Aha. I was already in the Christmas spirit before I even drank my hot chocolate, so I didn’t feel the effect.
The final step was to decorate the cafe for Christmas. I took out a little light bulb from the decoration set I bought at the Dimensional Shop earlier. I thought it would be pretty if I put it on the wall of the store.
But then Ash looked in my direction as if he had something to say.
“Hey, you know.”
He doesn’t call me ‘Noona‘ these days. He was cute back then.
“Ash, what’s wrong? What’s the matter?”
“I have one of those too. Something to decorate the cafe.”
“Is that so? Ah, the miniature one?”
“….Yeah.”
He put on a sulky face to hide his shyness, but I could tell he was proud.
“Then let’s decorate the cafe with the ones Ash made. Hurry up and bring it.”
“….! Okay.”
He ran off to his room. When he returned, he held a … demon castle in his hand.
“……?”
Am I not fully awake? I saw something weird.
I rubbed my eyes and looked again, but there was still an unbelievable sight in front of me.
The part-timer of my house placed a miniature of a castle with a proud expression on his face.
“Ash … what is this?”
“The palace where the Primordial Chaos dwells, the Throne of Darkness.”
It even had a Gothic spires and a miniature dog with three heads on the wall. Ugh, it’s a perfect miniature of a demonic castle that feels too realistic.
As I averted my gaze to avoid eye contact with the three-headed dog miniature, I had a sudden realisation.
Wait, I think I’ve seen this before. The Throne of Darkness?
‘Ether-Wiki.’
[Checking your eligibilities … Completed.][The Eligible: Verifying Kwon Rieul…..]
‘Skip.’
I skipped down the string of entries, and opened the most recent one.
《Throne of Darkness》Type: Place>ArchitectureDescription: A palace inhabited by the Primordial Chaos.Photo: [More]
………………………..
I alternated between the photo attached to the Ether-Wiki and the miniature made by Ash.
It’s perfectly identical. How could they be so identical? This child’s talent, it’s terrifying me….

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c116:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

Then the only problem left is deciding what a reasonable menu price is….
“Eh, but isn’t this too expensive?”
“No, this is still considered cheap.”
“That’s right. Considering the buff, it should be about this price.”
“But I can’t raise it ten times the previous price. I’ll lower it a little bit.”
“Hmm, then like this…….”

I sat down with the healer and the pharmacist and worked out a price list for the drinks. It took quite a while as we took into account a number of factors.
“What are you doing there?”
Ash, who returned from the warehouse, asked me. In his arms were hardboards, stationery supplies, and various craft materials tall as he was.
I was concerned about what he’s trying to make with such a large amount. Well, I suppose it’ll be okay because it’s only architectural miniatures.
“Oh, I have something to do. Ash, sleep first.”
“….Okay.”
Ash went into his room, and after a long conversation with the healer and the pharmacist, I made a reasonable new price list.
But then I had a sudden suspicion.
“Wait a minute. I’m not going to be punished for collusion or something like that, am I?”
“That’s not going to happen. Don’t worry.”
The healer declared confidently.
“There are only two ways a Production Hunter can be punished for collusion: if they use their superior position to force abnormally high prices, or if they charge more than twenty percent above the standard price. There’s no legal problem, and this is still cheap.”
The pharmacist handed out the data.
There was such a thing as a standard price list. The law was quite well established.
As soon as I set the new menu prices, a system notification popped up.
[Congratulations! You have completed ‘Sub Quest: Decorate the Menu Board’.Please collect the rewards.][The entry for ‘Throne of Darkness’ has been added to the Ether-Wiki].
For some reason, just looking at the name of the updated item gave off an ominous feeling.
I read it with an uneasy feeling, but it seemed to have nothing to do with me right away as it was a description of a place. 
Was I too suspicious of the system?
[The system always puts your safety first.]
I don’t believe it more if you say that, but … I just turned off the Ether-Wiki.
“Then, I’m sorry to bother you at such a late hour.”
“Next time, I’ll visit you as a guest.”
Satisfied with the arrangement, the two left.
It was a decision I was happy with, but I wondered if anyone would complain if I suddenly raised the price of coffee?
Surprisingly, none complained.
***
The next morning.
It was time to change the television channel over breakfast. I turned on the channel of the drama that Mieum wanted to watch, but suddenly a breaking news came out.
“Kyaaaaolg! What is this all of sudden? Where is the next episode of Hunter’s Temptation!”
Even if you complain, there’s nothing we can do with breaking news. Soon, a news video appeared with large caption.
0 Deaths from Gyeongju Rift … Safely Closed Confirmed
The news screen showed a street with completely collapsed buildings. However, everyone have bright faces. It must be thanks to the good news that there were zero deaths.
A reporter came closer to interview a Hunter, who participated in disposing of the rift.
Since he just returned, the Hunter was still lightly wounded, but he exclaimed in an excited tone as if his wounds were nothing.
— Muwon! Muwon showed up!— …….!
The scene erupts in excitement.
After a while, the screen turned into a news studio, and the announcer said with a flushed look.
— Right now, we have a video sent by a viewer that the No. 1 Ranker, Muwon, has appeared at the scene of the rift in Gyeongju. We obtained it exclusively from Hunter TV. It’s an exclusive report, viewers. We’ll show you the footage right away.
The picture quality was low, with the screen jiggled as if it was covered with sand. It seemed to be filmed inside a rift. Although it was blurry, it was enough to know what the situation was.
As the rift broke out, there was a lot of debris from the building that was sucked in. Beyond that, you can see a group of monsters aiming for the Hunters. The dispatched party fought well, but the sheer number of monsters meant that the formation would soon be broken.
Then, a black shadow appeared.
The face is not visible.
It was blurry, but I recognised him immediately. That long body, that distinctive gait.
Ki Yoohyun.
— Who is that? It can’t be…..!
Stepping forward, he stretched out his hand. Soon, a dense net of light seemed to surround the area, and an explosion roared with a flash.
The claws that were about to tear into the Hunter of the vanguard shattered.
One by one, the monsters that had been pouring out fell, literally fading into the light. It took only a few minutes for all monsters to completely die.
It’s an overwhelming power.
Why does the video, where you can’t see his face and only the blurred figure, feels both wondrous and lonely?
Is it just an afterimage caused by Ki Yoohyun’s past video I saw last time?
— Whoooaaaaaaa!
Along with the cheers of the videographer, the screen shook greatly.
— We’re alive!— Thank you!
He turned his head towards the camera, as if he’d just spotted it.
Just before the shadow cast by the rubble of the building is lifted and the light shines on his face, the hem of his long coat flutters in the wind.
The next moment, he disappeared and the video ended. The news again led to an on-the-spot interviews.
— Without Muwon, it wouldn’t have ended without any harm. Keuheuk….! ‘d like to take this opportunity to thank him!
He told me that I won’t be able to contact him for a few days, so he must have known in advance that a rift would burst in Gyeongju. Did he change the future by blocking the rift alone?
In his own way, he’s working hard as a Munchkin Regressor.
I’ll have to do my part too.
Thinking so, I tried to turn off the television, but on-site interviews continued.
— Ah! And thank you for Cafe Rieul!
Huh? Suddenly?
— The first Healer that we deployed was caught in an abnormal condition and we almost died. They  actively helped in such a crisis situation. If it wasn’t for their coffee, we wouldn’t have lasted until the Healer recovered.
Ah. When I heard that, I remembered what happened.
Yesterday, group of people who seemed to be in a hurry appeared through the ConnectAnywhere☆MysteriousDoor.
It wasn’t a normal situation even at first glance, so I stopped the business for a while and made them coffee until they were ready to go.
— I see, Hunter-nim, you’ve done a great job. If you have any last words, I’d like to hear them.— I’m worried about the low price of the coffee. I’m hoping that such a good place will raise their prices!
Pardon?
Eh, that far?
As I live, I see consumers worrying about the low price.
Perhaps because it was said in a live breaking news, the price increase was warmly welcomed rather than resisted.
Well, regardless of the price increase.
‘You were determined to benefit the world with coffee‘.
It feels a bit grandiose, but … does the coffee I make help the world in this way? If so, I’m glad.
I’m glad no one died in the rift.
Truly.
***
One more thing happened.
A few days after the price-changed menu was settled without difficulty, the healer and the pharmacist visited as guests as they promised.
Judging from the fact that both of them ordered cafe latte without hesitation, it seems that they wanted to drink it that day…….
“Keheum, ahem. Owner-nim.”
“Ah, yes.”
It was after the two drank all the cafe latte, filling the satisfaction bar to the end. The healer who had been watching me from earlier, as if he had something to say, opened his mouth.
“Look at this.”
The healer held out his phone. The phone screen showed a white rabbit chewing on cabbage leaves. It’s pretty cute.
“That’s my rabbit. She eats well, healthy, and really cute.”
Aha. Back then this person actually wanted to brag about his pet too….
“Waeooong (Post my picture too)!”
“Kkyuu, kkyu!”
The animals on my house, who recently dreaming of becoming social media stars, interfered at my feet. I calmed the animals down and immediately followed the healer’s Instagram. The number of Instagram followings with such cute animal photos has increased.
And while seeing off the healer and the pharmacist, I suddenly remembered.
“Ah!”
“What’s wrong?”
Beside me, Ash tilted his head.
“Oh, it was him!”
“What?”
I remembered where I met that healer. He’s the healer who had accused Choi Cedric of power abuse before the regression!
Due to that incident, The Garden of Blessings had boycotted the C&L Corporation, leading to their subsequent merger.
I hadn’t remembered it because it had nothing to do with me, but now I know for sure.
‘Choi Cedric, is he okay?’
Of course, it is not for me to intervene if Choi Cedric actually abused his power or acted inappropriately. It would be best if he apologised and made amends, but it’s his own responsibility anyway.
‘Personally, I wish Choi Cedric would apologize.….’
I remembered him looking depressed and troubled when I met him in the Dungeon where Cthugha lived. 
Hmm. I wonder what happened to him. Is he doing well?
***
Choi Cedric recalled what had happened so far.
The allegations of various illegal acts at C&L Corporation had been revealed to be the doings of the CEO’s secretary, Aeon. Lee Sein issued an apology for failing to properly manage and supervise the secretary’s behavior. She also added that she would actively cooperate with the arrest of her secretary.
However, the secretary disappeared as if he had never existed in the first place.
In the end, the case was closed with the C&L Corporation paying considerable compensation.
The headquarters must have calculated that C&L, the largest of The Big Three, could not be pressured blindly. The decision was made in consideration of the gap in the dungeon raids, the conflict between each guild, and other variables. 
Anyway, C&L is back to normal.
The elevator stopped at the top floor, and Choi Cedric strode inward.
“What’s all this?”
“Ah, Cedric.”
Lee Sein spotted him and smiled brightly.
“We’re renovating the representative office. It’s been a mess for a while after what Aeon did, and I thought we should freshen things up a bit.”
“…I see.”
The person in front of him is definitely the Lee Sein he knows.
C&L is back to normal. He, too, should be back to his usual self…..
But why does he feel so out of place?
“Then, isn’t it like being possessed?”
All of sudden, Kwon Rieul’s flashed through his mind.
What nonsense is that? There’s no way such a ridiculous thing would happen.
……It can’t happen, it won’t happen.

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c115:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

“Here’s the drink you ordered.”
As I handed the take-out cup to the customer and turned my head, I got startled.
‘WE CONDEMN CAFE RIEUL’
A large banner stole my attention.
“……”
There’s a banner like that right across from the cafe, in a good view from the counter, so what can I say?
It makes me look back at my life.
‘Have I been living in the wrong way?’

I’ve been living a good life, without even jaywalking once.
I was a little lazy after the regression, but anyone would do the same if they’re walking on my shoes. Only people who work full-time and overtime during the weekdays, and still able to go to the gym at 5 a.m. on Saturday, can blame me, shit.
“Waeuung (You speak so proudly).”
“……”
I did recycling yesterday, washed my hands, and renewed my certificate. What’s the problem?
Heck, I almost looked back in the past, fruitlessly searching for something to reflect on.
“Ash, wait a minute.”
Unable to withstand the banner’s self-reflection-inducing effect, I approached the banner. I need to know why they’re condemning Cafe Rieul here.
However, there was no group name or reason written on the banner. All it said was, ‘We condemn Cafe Rieul‘.
Shashashak.
As I approached, there was a sign of someone running from behind the banner. He hid in the corner of the alley and looked this way, but said nothing.
“Hey, if you have something to say, go ahead.”
“…….”
“Why did you put this up?”
“…….”
There was no answer. I guess I have no choice.
I calmly turned on my phone and reported the illegal banner. Before long, a person from the district office collected the banners.
Phew, I think I’ll live.

Later that evening, after the cafe was closed.
“Can I see the warehouse?”
As soon as I took off my apron, Ash asked.
“Sure, but why? What do you need?”
“I’m running low on building materials.”
“Okay, just go.”
Ash has been obsessed with making architectural miniatures these days. However, he was not satisfied with making it according to the instructions of the miniature set and started to remodel the building himself.
I don’t know what on earth he’s making because he haven’t shown it to me yet.
In any case, a proper hobby is welcome as it helps prevent the terrible workaholic disease. Labour detox is important.
After sending Ash to the warehouse, I cleaned the hall with ‘The Floor is Shiny‘ skill.
When I switched off the light at the entrance and was ready to rest, suddenly there was a knock and the door opened.
“I’m sorry. We’re already closed for today.”
“I want to meet the owner of Cafe Rieul.”
A strange man and woman stood at the door. They looked serious as if they knocked on the door with great determination.
I could easily guess who they were. Under their coats, they wore T-shirts with ‘We condemn Cafe Rieul‘ written on it.
Aha, they’re the ones who set up the illegal banner.
I hesitated for a moment, but then offered them a seat, figuring I’d at least hear their story about why they’d put up such a banner.
“Anyway, since you’ve come all the way here … can I get you something to drink?”
“……!”
I said so out of courtesy, but the two looked surprised. There is a clear sense of wariness on their faces.
“No, you can’t take what the enemy gives you.”
“Enemy?”
The woman calmed the man down and answered in his stead.
“It’s nothing. Just give us, uh, some cold water please.”
If you say so….
I gave them two glasses of ice water and made my own hot caffe latte.
The savory smell spread through the air. The soft and savory taste of coffee restored the energy that had been drained throughout the day.
Their eyes focused on my coffee cup.
They looked like they wanted to drink it…….
“Would you like some?”
“A-ahem! No.”
“……it’s all right.”
Well, if you refuse….
I took another sip of my caffe latte and asked.
“So, what is the reason for setting up such a banner in front of someone else’s store?”
“That….”
After exchanging a quick glance, the two introduced themselves. 
The man was a healer from the Garden of Blessings, a guild specialising in Healers. He had circles under his eyes and looked tired. Meanwhile, the woman was a potion pharmacist and the head of the Central Pharmacy Guild, which belonged to the Potion Making Alliance. She had a long, flowing hair and an air of intelligence around her.
As for the man, I feel like I’ve seen him before. Hmm … I don’t know. Since I can’t remember him, it’s probably nothing.
“What kind of bussiness a healer and a pharmacist might have with my cafe?”
“Ugh! Aren’t you going too far?!”
The healer snapped.
“What?”
“Don’t pretend like you don’t know. The drinks here at Cafe Rieul!”
“The drinks?”
I blinked in confusion. The healer pounded on his chest and exclaimed.
“It’s too cheap!”
“……what?”
After calming the angry healer, the pharmacist added a calm explanation.
In short, the drinks at Cafe Rieul were so much cheaper than healers’ fees and potion prices that they were driving customers away.
“That Cafe Latte has the effect of restoring 50% of your energy. How much are you selling it for?”
“Two rubies.”
“……!”
“Oh my God, this is…..”
They both sighed and put their hands on their foreheads. I spoke up, hoping to comfort them.
“Well, it’s coffee, after all. It’s not like we can drink it indefinitely … aren’t there a lot of Hunters looking for healers and potions?”
“It’s not that simple. Look at this. There’s stuff like this circulating in Hunchan.”
The grim-faced pharmacist pulled a piece of paper from her coat pocket and held it out. It was a printed copy of the writings from Hunter Channel.
At her urging, I looked at the paper.

[Humor] Potion vs Cafe Rieul Comparison (233)
Upvotes: 227 / Downvotes: 2

Writer: RubyCopyBug
Debate closed.A landslide victory for CF.

— Pink Jely Granny: agree agree— app***: agree agree— OO: agreeee

……………………………
Similar comments followed below.
In this post, they are talking about this. 
Potion is much more versatile and storable than coffee. Coffee has to be consumed within a certain amount of time, and there are fewer recipes than potions. There’s also a need to mention the importance of healers who directly participating in a dungeon raids.
It’s just an internet meme, so they’re exaggerating. I don’t think anyone really means it….
“Ha…..”
Although I said so, the pharmacist still had a serious expression on her face. She sighed deeply and drank the cold water.
Trying to cheer her up, I pointed to the last item on the table and said.
“Then, hey, why don’t you try raising a cute animal?”
Even if the rest didn’t work out, she could still get an animal like I did.
“Waeoong?”
“Kkyuu?”
The animals of my house, which were stretched in a liquid state in front of the heater, raised their heads quickly, thinking we were talking about them.
I didn’t call you, guys. Just stay there and play.
“I’m raising one! But my dog doesn’t like the smell of potions, so I can’t take him with me.”
“Wow, do you have a dog? If you have any pictures, please show me.”
“Here, it’s this puppy.”
The pharmacist took out her phone and showed me an Instagram picture of a dog. It was a yellow puppy that looked like Injeolmi.
“Wow, he’s so cute. Can I follow you on Instagram?”
“He’s really smart. He’s still young, but he already understands ‘hand!'”
“Amazing! What’s your puppy’s name?”
“His name is….”
“Keuheum, Ahem! Pharmacist-nim, ahem!”
The tired-looking healer coughed and tapped the pharmacist on the shoulder. The pharmacist regained her senses and shoved her phone back into her pocket with an embarrassed expression.
Ooops. The puppy was so cute that we got sidetracked. Still, the atmosphere has softened a little. I put aside my disappointment and returned to the main topic.
“For now, I understand the situation. But even if you condemn this cafe for that reason … that’s right, why did you run away earlier?”
“Well, I was waiting for the right time to tell you our request in private.”
The healer scratched the back of his head awkwardly.
“And what is this secret request you have for me?”
“…..! That’s right, we have one favor to ask.”
Two people with desperate expressions lowered their heads at the same time and shouted.
“Please raise the price of the drinks!”
“…yes?”
“We’d like you to raise the price at least twice, no, five times what it is now.”
“For something like that?”
I asked in surprise, but their expressions were serious.
“It’s not just like that.”
The pharmacist added an explanation, her face devoid of humor.
“Even with the menu called Irish Coffee, that is the case. In order to make a freezing nullification potion, I must use my skill for a long time in a sub-zero freezer. Still, I can’t do anything with the bitter taste.”
“….”
“But how can you defend against freezing damage with just a cup of coffee! Really, ah … I was shocked.”
“On the Healer side, things are similar. Some novice healers are denied joining the party because they already have coffee.”
As I listened to them, I was lost in thought.
My idea that the current price of coffee is reasonable remains unchanged. Considering the low price of raw materials, the current price is just right. I never thought I would hear that the price range of 1 ruby to 5 ruby is too cheap.
However, these two people have a point.
Hmm, how do I do it?
If I’m trying to be humble here….
‘My coffee isn’t that big of a deal.’
I couldn’t say it that way. After all, it would sound like I’m diminishing the hard work that goes into healing people or making potions, not just my own work. If I say it’s not a big deal, these people will become people who put their heart and soul into the trivial things.
Too much humility is also a form of arrogance.
Besides installing the banner that gave me useless worry, they have done me no harm.
Well … I can’t help it.
I didn’t want to hurt other Hunters who were doing similar things to enforce my views on coffee prices. I also have a Healer in my family.
….even though it is irrelevant because Kwon Jiwoon is the best healer in Korea.
“All right. Let’s discuss it.”
“……!”
Two people rejoiced at my words.
[Sub Quest: Decorate the Menu Board]It is time to make a decision for sustainable cafe management.Let’s adjust the price of the menu accordingly.Reset Menu Prices Reasonably: (Incomplete)Reward: Ether-Wiki Update]
Tiling!
As soon as I made my intentions known, a quest appeared in the system window. The fact that it popped up means that my decision was not a bad one.
The only reward was the update of Ether-Wiki, which I had forgotten existed.
[Ether-Wiki is always waiting for your visit. Forever, always….]
A wistful phrase popped up, as if trying to stir up guilt.
Uh, yeah, sorry.
I answered half-heartedly and turned off the notification window.

Translator’s Corner:
jaywalk: Ignore the traffic light or cross the street at a non-crosswalk.landslide victory (압승): a term used to indicate that a particular candidate or party won an election by an overwhelming majority.Injeolmi (인절미): a variety of tteok, or Korean traditional rice cake coated with yellowish bean flour. It’s made by steaming and pounding glutinous rice flour, which is shaped into small pieces and usually covered with steamed powdered dried beans or other ingredients. It’s also used as a nickname for a cute golden retriever puppy.

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c114:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

Moreover, young Ki Yoohyun.
It was cute because he had a different personality from the present Ki Yoohyun, but if he’s that young, I’m in trouble ….. aaaaaaaah, I shouldn’t think about this.
Let’s calm down. If there’s a problem, there’s a solution. I looked around with the mindset of finding the answer sheet for a maths workbook.
“What are you mumbling all by yourself, waeooong!”

“……”
Pass. She looks like she doesn’t know anything.
“Are you ignoring me!”
You’re getting quick-witted day by day, Meeum-ah.
I opened my grandmother’s diary again, but I can’t see the visions anymore. There was nothing written on it, just blank pages.
Ki Yoohyun told me that he won’t be able to be contacted for a few days. Even if it was possible, it would be awkward to suddenly ask about his childhood. It was difficult to explain how I knew about the past he had not told me about. It might arouse his suspicions.
Most of all, his painful appearance, the explicit sight.
Can I arbitrarily bring up the pain he didn’t talk about just to get to the bottom of my question? Wouldn’t my question dig up useless memories? Do I have the right to ask about his past?
Then all that’s left is…….
I got up and came out of the cabin.
Keeping my distance from the flammable plants, I found a suitable clearing and opened the system window.
[Skill: Eternal Flame (S) is used.][You summon Cthugha.]
Hwuuur.
Cthugha appeared with a blazing flame. The flames slowly transformed into a human with red hair.
However, the system notification did not end.
[Attack the area in 10-meter radius with Eternal Flame.][If you do not cancel within 10 seconds, it will be automatically executed. 10, 9, 8….]
“Eek, cancel! Cancel!”
[The attack has been canceled.]
Gosh, I was surprised. What a scary ring.
If it burn everything in a radius of 10 meter, won’t I die too?!
I took a closer look at the skill window. There was a small option selection window under the ‘Eternal Flame (S)’.
[Automatic Attack: On ☜ / Off]
To set the default setting of such a scary option to ‘On‘ … I really couldn’t be careless with this sytem. I quickly changed the option to ‘Off’.
“My granddaughter!”
Cthugha, whose appearance became completely human, called me.
“Why have you never called me before? Do you know how bored … ahem, no, do you know how lonely I’ve been?”
Cthugha tried to hug me, but he stopped his action. He widened his eyes in surprise when he noticed the cabin on the border of the forest.
“Don’t tell me, this place….!”
Dak dak. Cthugha ran towards the cabin. After passing through the empty living room, he spotted the fireplace in the kitchen and dropped to his knees. His sobs are muffled by the wind.
“Ooh….”
The answer is obvious from his reaction, but I still asked just to be sure.
“Is this where my grandmother used to live?”
“Yes, it is. I never thought I’d be able to come back here…..”
His head tilted at an angle. I watched him for a moment, then opened my mouth.
“I found this notebook here.”
I briefly described the vision I saw when I opened the notebook, then Cthugha spoke.
“That looks like a fragment of causality left behind by Miss Heesun. To put it simply, a fragment of a broken link.”
“I’m sorry, I have no idea what you’re talking about….”
What is a fragment of a broken link? I don’t think it’s something real like a hair tie.
“Huh, Goodness! This is why mortals are doomed. I can’t believe you can’t understand this simple explanation. What should I call it … it is like a VR experience. Yes,a VR game that takes you into the past!”
“Aha…..”
I finally nodded at the customized explanation.
In other words, it was Ki Yoohyun’s past.
The image of the boy in pain flashed in my eyes. What did the Church do to him?
Also, why did my grandmother leave a record of Ki Yoohyun and nothing else? She must not have known him in her lifetime.
“…….”
“…….”
We were both lost in thought, me being me and Cthugha being Cthugha.
I finally broke the heavy silence by bringing up the words that I hesitated to say.
“You told me before that my grandmother left you without a word.”
“…….”
“My grandmother left this place because my parents died. The sudden loss of contact must have been unintentional, so…..”
I trailed off, unable to find the right words.
In the earliest years I can remember, my parents had already passed away. With no memory, there is no sorrow. It’s just a vague sense of loss.
The first rift.
It refers to a large-scale rift that occurred simultaneously in various parts of the world shortly after the occurrence of the Great Dungeon Abyss.
My parents were caught in the first rift and died. They said that I was the only one lucky enough to be rescued. All I have left is a photograph.
“I see … was it something like that?”
Cthugha, who rose in front of the fireplace, left the cabin.
This time, he stood on the cliff and crossed, lost in his own thought while looking down at the cabin. He looks wistful, as if he’s searching for a time that no longer exists.
The problem was that whenever his emotions fluctuated, flames erupted around him.
This was a dangerous environment for him to set himself on fire.
“Aaah, be careful!”
“……!”
Cthugha, who almost burned all the dungeon sugarcanes after a sigh, winced.
“Hmm, Sorry. It wasn’t intentional.”
“I’m sorry, but over there, go over there.”
Cthugha went to the place I pointed out and sat cross-legged. He sighed with a dreamy expression again. This time, however, the branch of the World Tree, Yggdrasil, was almost turned into firewood.
“My granddaughter, somehow there’s so much combustible material here.”
“That’s because this is a field…….”
Cthugha, who wandered around in this space, eventually settled in front of a box containing green coffee beans. Coffee was the only thing here that he could set fire at will.
Apparently, Cthugha is used to being a gas burner himself. The fire roared to life, and soon there was a sound of beans being roasted.
Smelling the strong coffee, I sank on the grass.
Just as one question is solved, another arises.
I said I wanted to be a cafe owner, not a detective. I’m a person who reads mystery novels after checking the culprit spoiler first.
“Waeong…..”
Then Mieum approached me. Lime wasn’t with her, having gone to the Golden Triangular Rhino barn.
“Mieum-ah, what’s wrong?”
“Don’t forget. You can do what you want to do.”
“What do I want to do?”
“What you wished for them in the first place. It’s your job to do what you want to do. Waeuung….”
“Hmm……”
I looked at Mieum quietly.
Her expression was unusually serious. She looked desperate, as if she wanted to convey something.
“Our Mieum, for some reason, is saying the right thing.”
“I always say the right thing, waeoong!”
“Yes, yes.”
I reached out my hand and stroked Mieum. Mieum ducked her head as if she was being bothered, but soon she purred.
Yes, this cat is right.
Phew, I almost got carried away. I was on the verge of becoming a person who agonized over the secrets of the world.
Neither Ki Yoohyun’s past nor the identity of the causality in my grandmother’s vision could be known at this time.
I opened the system window and checked the achievement list. Starting with the first ‘Became a Beginner Cafe Owner‘ achievement, the latest achievement was written like this.
‘You were determined to benefit the world with coffee‘.
What a clear and good statement.
Let’s save the question to another regressor for later, and let’s do what we can before then. I’m talking about cafe management.
Just as I was organizing my thoughts, Cthugha approached me.
“Granddaughter, I roasted all the coffee here.”
All that much already?
Not only that, but the color was perfect. The fire had been carefully controlled to achieve the optimal roast.
“Hahahaha! I can do this for you as much as you want, so call me again.”
Feeling proud of his actions, Cthugha went back on his own.
I’m glad he’s feeling better….
There is an immortal who enjoy roasting coffee, so I should work hard too.
After making such a simple yet progressive conclusion, I went back to the store in good spirits.
“Why now?”
Ash, who should have been deeply engrossed in the architectural miniatures, grabbed my sleeve and pulled me along.
“Ash, what’s wrong with you all of a sudden? Is something wrong?”
“Look at that!”
“Huh?”
Ash pointed out the window. As I turned my head to follow his fingers, I was startled. A large banner was hung in a prominent location.
“We condemn Cafe Rieul….?”
It’s really a cafe management with no windy day.
***
Santa Claus, no, Kwon Seokmin hurried his steps.
The streets were buzzing with the anticipation of Christmas. He doesn’t feels out of place in a red Santa costume. Even those who give him a glance don’t take him seriously, thinking it’s a part of promotional event.
There wasn’t much time.
This happened because it took longer than expected to retrieve the Tikkoun Elixir from the hidden altar on Jirisan Cheonwangbong Peak. The entrance to the altar is guarded by a watcher. However, Kwon Seokmin, who was disconnected from the system, was able to avoid the eyes of the watcher. After he escaped the Maze dungeon, this is a blessing in disguise.
“Tsk tsk, they said there could be a little time difference, but throwing away six years … it’s a scam, a scam.”
Kwon Seokmin grumbled to himself.
The experience at the Maze dungeon was terrible enough for him not to want to recall. However, there are some things that he learned from this experience.
‘It’s amazing. This world is actually…….’
“Long time no see. Where are you going that makes you so busy, Hunter Kwon Seokmin?”
A cold voice cut off Kwon Seokmin’s thoughts. Surprised, Kwon Seokmin turned to the direction where the sound came from.
At the end of the narrow alley, a woman stood in front of him.
She was dressed in a suit, her hair neatly combed. Her arms are crossed, the posture gives a feeling of composure unique to a successful person.
“I’m just a passing Santa.”
“Don’t you remember? It’s already been six years, but I’ve met you at the guild leader’s meeting.”
“I’m getting older these days, so my memory is a little blurry….”
“At that time, I was still just a representative of the new guild, but I shook hands with Hunter Kwon Seokmin.”
Smile. Lee Sein smiled.
“…Heh.”
After staring at her wordlessly for a moment, Kwon Seokmin clicked his tongue.
“Let’s stop playing jokes that aren’t funny. You’ve already devoured that body, Aeon.”
“Uh-oh. Did you notice? Then this conversation will be fast.”
The eyes shone coldly.
“How did you get out of it alive?”
“Tsk tsk, putting people in labyrinths. You’re so mean to someone with a bad sense of direction, really.”
“The Infinite Labyrinth. It’s a place that a mere mortal can never get out of, so what did you do?”
“Hahahaha! Hahahaha!”
Kwon Seokmin burst into laughter. He leaned his back against the wall of the alley and laughed.
At the same time, he scanned the surroundings.
Three behind him, three in front. He’s already surrounded. It’s impossible for him to escape on his own.
“The incarnation of the Mad God Chaos. Seeing that you came looking for me, it seems you haven’t found it yet, right?”
The expression, who had Lee Sein’s body, hardened fiercely.
“Where is the Grimoire?”
“Well, I’m getting older these days, so my memory is a little blurry. Where did I put it…….”
“If you tell me the location of the Grimoire, I might be able to save you.”
“The children will resent you for interrupting Santa Claus as he delivers happiness to children.”
Lee Sein smiled as if she had heard a funny joke. With a light gesture, the attackers surrounded Kwon Seokmin in a circle.
“As expected. It seems you have no intention of telling me the location.”
“……Ugh!”
From behind, a mysterious man attacked Kwon Seokmin.
Puck! 
His vision went black. Kwon Seokmin was dragged away.

Translator’s Corner:
It’s really a cafe management with no windy day: the expression used in this sentence comes from the proverb 가지 많은 나무에[나무가] 바람 잘 날이 없다, a tree with many branches doesn’t have a peaceful day with the blowing wind. I used “with no windy day” because the wind does not stop blowing that’s why there’s no windy day (since everyday has wind). Well, it means that a tree with many branches will always noisy because the branches will rustle and make noise even with a breeze/weak wind. It usually used to express that parents with many children will be under constant worries and concerns every day.

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c113:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

“Waeoong….”
“Mieum-ah, what’s wrong?”
“Waeuung, The Great System, they cannot act against your will.”
“Really?”
She must have been bothered by what my uncle said a while ago. Mieum rolled her eyes and added after staring at me for a long time.

“This much is true. Believe me, waeooong!”
My uncle had a point about the system. The system, or rather, the Saintess, had given me abilities with a certain intention, Still, now it is also true that the skills and quests the system gave me are helping me.
So….
I smiled and poked Mieum’s soft cheek.
“Really? Mieum-ah, whose side are you on? Is it me or the system?”
“Waeong, waeooooong! That question is frivolous!”
Like a child who was asked, ‘Do you like your mom or dad?’, Mieum was torn. She glanced at me for a while before she replied in a small voice.
“Of course … Human, I like you better….”
“Out! Your answer timed out. I’m not giving you snacks today.”
“I, I’m trying to answer seriously … did you make fun of me, waeoong!”
“Oh, I got caught.”
“Kyayakyakyaoo!”
Pak. A meow punch flew in.
In the meantime, I must have gotten very attached to this cat. Teasing her gave me so much fun.
No matter how the system works.
‘I wish you’d continue to be my cat….’
I went into the space with Lime and Mieum. The cat was glaringly sulky.
“Mmoooo!”
Cornelia Longinus, who had spotted Lime, came running from the barn. She licked Lime with her tongue.
For your information, Cornelia Longinus is the name of this Golden Triangular Rhinoceros.
… in my defence, I didn’t make up the name. Seriously.
I couldn’t think of a good name for the Golden Triangular Rhino, so I decided to ask everyone in the house for suggestions. We were going to have a vote and choose democratically.
But….

“How about Bieup?”
Candidate No. 1, this is my opinion.
“Isn’t it okay to call it Spot, waeoong!”
Candidate No. 2, Mieum’s opinion.
“Kkyuuu! Kkyuuu!”
Candidate No. 3, when translated, means Pythagoras. I guess it’s Pythagoras because it’s a triangular rhinoceros.
“Belial. Hoho, I named it, but it’s a nice name.”
Candidate No. 4, Ash’s opinion. I looked it up and it was the name of a demon.
There were four candidates, but everyone insisted that their name was the best, so there was no consensus at all. The vote ended in a tie, and after much debate, we decided to let the Golden Triangular Rhinoceros decide for herself.
“Mmmeh! Mmmoo!”
But this cow snorted and got furious.
[Summon: The Golden Triangular Rhinoceros in love reveals her name.][Name: Cornelia Longinus]
That’s, umh, an elegant and wonderful name.
[Cornelia Longinus angrily asks why you’re trying to pick someone else’s name.]
Uh, I’m sorry….
“Mooo!”
As if accepting the apology, the Golden Triangular Rhino nodded.

That’s how I learned this cow’s name.
I put a new bucket in Cornelia’s barn. I thought I should give this cow a Christmas present, so I prepared it. I also replaced the full milk jug with a new one.
It was just when I finished my work, and I was going out with a bucket of milk.
“…..?”
Suddenly, out of the corner of my eye, I saw a slate roof. It was the roof of the cabin at the bottom of the cliff.
That’s right, over there. That’s the place where I found the hand mirror at Grandma Kim Deokyi’s request. There were traces of my grandmother there.
How had I forgotten?
Wait, no way.
No, that’s nonsense. It’s unbelievable, but … perhaps that cabin was the place where my grandmother lived, the one that Cthugha spoke of.
I put the milk jug back on the floor.
“Waeong, where are you going?”
“Kkyuuuu?”
Leaving behind the call of the animals, I went down the cliff.
After passing a small path through a gap in a pile of stones, a large space appears. The cabin remained on the border of the forest. I immediately opened the door and went inside.
The room was like a living room with a thick carpet. There was a small door behind the table I hadn’t noticed it when I first came to this place because it was hidden by the furniture.
Beyond the door was an old-fashioned kitchen. A piece of charcoal remained in the fireplace. It was a sign of human habitation.
I knew it right away. This is the cabin that Cthugha was talking about.
“…….”
My head was spinning.
Until now, I hadn’t really questioned the identity of this space. A forest shrouded in mist on all sides.. You can’t see beyond the dense forest because there are no paths. So, I just assumed it was a closed space for planting and growing crops.
If the cabin that Cthugha said is really here, where the hell is this space?
Unrefined questions popped out and stirred my head.
No, this is not the time.
There may be another traces of my grandmother left here. Let’s find it. There’s definitely something that could be a hint….
However, the cabin is empty, with no plausible objects in sight.
In the end, I stick my hand into the unlit fireplace, just in case. When I stirred through the crumbled ash, something solid reached my hand.
“……this is it.”
It was a notebook.
I swept the dirty surface with my palm. In the corner, my grandmother’s name ‘Park Heesun’ was written. It looks like a diary.
What could she have written in it?
It was the moment when I sat down on the floor and opened the diary.
“Ugh…!”
A blinding light burst from the blank pages of the diary. My mind was pulled into somewhere. With the sound of a fast rewind, my vision blurred.
Before I knew it, I was in a pitch darkness.
I’ve already experienced this once. I noticed that I was seeing a vision.
The video rewinds quickly in front of my eyes and stops at one scene.
A strange voice is heard.
【Our Foolish King.】【You may repeat the time of eons.】【If you can reach the end of Causality and awaken the King on the Throne of Darkness.】【Yes, even if it transcends eons of time.】
Then, I felt my consciousness being sucked into the video.
The next moment, I was in an unfamiliar space. It looked like a large auditorium.
I inadvertently checked the floor. It was a solid ground, my footprints are imprinted in the dirt. It’s the same as when the Saintess called me. The scene was too realistic to be a mere fantasy.
What is different from then is the fact that there are many people here. Most of them were children who seemed to be in the upper grades of elementary school, and there were one or two adults who looked to be guiding them.
What the hell is going on here? I walked around, trying to get a sense of the situation.
However, these children didn’t respond no matter how much I called them, as if they couldn’t see me.
Then, a familiar face caught my eye.
“Ah, hey, kid!”
I reached out and grabbed the child by the shoulder.
“….Yes?”
Thank goodness. This boy heard my voice properly. The boy turned around, looking slightly annoyed.
“Don’t you remember me? We’ve met before.”
“I don’t think so.”
On the way back from the Garden of Cthugha, this is the boy who led me.
But the boy had a sulky look on his face, as if he didn’t remember me.
“My name is Kwon Rieul. What’s your name, kid?”
“My teacher told me not to tell my name to an adult I didn’t know.”
He was a very smart boy……
“Teacher? Is this a school?”
“You don’t know that? Noona, you’re really suspicious. Are you not a real kidnapper?”
“Huh? No, I’m not! I’m the one who, uh, came to deliver goods! So I don’t know, ahaha.”
“Hmm.”
I think I’ve convinced him. That’s good. It was a vision, but at least I didn’t get accused of being a kidnapper.
“This is the Church.”
“What? What did you just say….”
I wanted to ask more details, but the boy didn’t listen to me and brought up another topic.
“We’re all gathered today because we’re going on a field trip. I wanted to go to Jeju Island, but they say we’re going to Gyeongju. Noona, have you ever been to Jeju Island?”
“Huh? Uh, I’ve been there once.”
“Che, I envy you.”
The boy kicked lightly on the floor.
“Rather than that, what do you mean by what you said earlier? What is ‘Church‘?”
“You don’t know that either? That’s it, of course, The Church of Starry….”
Just then, a chime sounded in the auditorium. The boy stopped talking and turned his head.
An adult was gathering the children. He must be the teacher.
Behind him was a large door. It had an old-fashioned design that didn’t look like it belonged in an auditorium.
For what? Something about that door felt ominous. It’s very ominous and … I have a gut feeling that it shouldn’t be opened.
“Oh! It’s time for the gathering, I have to go.”
“Wa-wait!”
I reached out in a panic, but grabbed nothing but air. Tada, the boy ran three steps and smiled brightly at me. The smile looked so much like someone I knew.
“It was nice meeting you. My name is Ki Yoohyun.”
“……!”
The boy walked away.
It was impossible for me to intervene in what happened next. In an instant, the view became distant and I had no choice but to watch the scene in front of me like a spectator.
The door opened, and something dreadful beyond is about to be summoned.
Only then did I realize what this place was for.
No. All the kids here are going to die. An eerie premonition flashed through my mind.
Soon, my surroundings turned into chaos. The children screamed in pain and fainted. The boy screamed and covered his ears. He looks distressed.
No, what are you doing? You’re going to get killed!
I shouted, but my voice did not reach the other side.
The moment when the slender body collapsed in a heap, unable to bear the pain.
Slowly, the trembling stops. A net of light stretches out from the open doorway, wrapping around the boy’s body and pulling him in.
Ah, I see. This is his ‘Awakening’.
A net of light surrounded and patched up the boy’s once shattered mind. Guided by the web of light, the boy’s soul…..
【Oh my, you were watching something like this.】
“……!”
It was the Saintess’ voice.
【Did you enjoy watching it?】【I’m sorry, but I can’t show you more than this.】【Now, go back, to your world.】
…….
…….
My vision is blacked out.
“Heuk, huuh….!”
My forehead was damp with sweat. My eyes sting in the dim sunlight.
When I came to my senses, I was crouching in front of an unlit fireplace.
“Waeooong! Human, what are you doing there?”
“Kkyuuuu, kkyuu!”
Mieum and Lime, who had followed me belatedly, jumped up and down in front of me.
“…….”
“Kyaoog! Don’t touch me with soot-stained hands!”
First of all, I’m pretty sure that the boy I just saw in my vision is Ki Yoohyun’s childhood self. I know up to that.
But why did the boy I met on the path of the stars have the appearance of a young Ki Yoohyun?
Is it the Time Paradox or something similiar that appears in a lot of movies?
Didn’t he go back in time? Is it actually time travel, not regression?
