SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c91:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

Therefore, in the present.
Ki Yoohyun made an appointment to meet with Rieul in order to reveal his identity. Ironically, even though he was nervous, his heart started to get excited. Perhaps because it is a meeting only for the purpose of meeting her, which is different from the previous loose relationship.
He reserved a restaurant that serves food that she might like. The atmosphere is calm, so it would be perfect to have a quiet conversation after eating.
However, as soon as Rieul greeted him with a bright smile, his head went blank.

Ki Yoohyun can’t imagine how her expression will change as soon as he opens his mouth.
Will she get angry because he lied to her? If so, it’s still fine. He will apologize as much as he can until her anger subsides.
However….
What should he do if she becomes wary of himself? If he’s unable to see her comfortable smile again, if she sees him as a stranger … just imagining it seems to tighten the tension in his chest.
The moment he finally made up his mind and tried to open his mouth….
The staff knocked on the door, it was time for the dessert to be served.
Not far beyond the wall, he could feel the presence of Han Yiseong. Even though he knows that he can’t fool Ki Yoohyun’s senses, he dares to continue to follow him, is it a protest because he asked for his understanding?
Han Yiseong strongly objected his decision to reveal his identity to Rieul. It wasn’t that he didn’t understand why he was against it. He’s probably worried about the loose relationship he has worked hard to build up.
Ki Yoohyun admitted that Han Yiseong’s interference was rather welcome. This is not a good place to talk because of the interruptions.
With that excuse, he drove the car and headed for the dark observatory. He was confident that he would say it this time … until he saw the light of the fireworks shining on Rieul’s white cheeks.
Her chestnut brown hair slowly flutters in the wind. Her large eyes, who were looking at him, blinked slowly. Exhaling a light breath, she rubbed the canned drink with her cold fingers. The whole figure was clearly engraved in his eyes.
A few minutes to urge the lips that were barely moving passed.
Ki Yoohyun neatly admitted defeat. He has never been so indecisive, but he doesn’t have the courage.
Yeah, next time. Let’s talk next time we meet.
He was greedy. He didn’t want to break this soft atmosphere with useless words. He didn’t wish to see those eyes, who were looking at the fireworks embroidering the sky, filled with vigilance.
Let’s do so. He enjoyed an ordinary outing like this.
He swallowed the words he was going to say, but when he was about to say let’s go back because it will be cold soon, Rieul said something all of sudden.
“Are you trying to tell me some secret? For example … is it that Yoohyun-ssi is the No.1 ranker, Muwon?”
Ki Yoohyun stared blankly at the woman in front of him. There was only one word that his spirit managed to utter.
“….yes?”
***
It’s not something to be proud of, but I’m really ignorant.
As such, I didn’t guess Ki Yoohyun’s identity from the beginning.
At first, I thought he was a Hunter on a bad end. In addition, until the fire broke out in the Grandma Kim Deokyi’s workshop, I considered him as a Hunter who was stronger and had more time than I thought.
But soon I realized something strange.
Ki Yoohyun’s ability to freely manipulate space using white light was strong and extremely useful. With that kind of ability, he could be famous, but only few people know about Ki Yoohyun.
The twin hunters of The Cheongna Guild follow Ki Yoohyun well. Han Yiseong also seemed somewhat polite to Ki Yoohyun. It was by no means the attitude toward the Guild’s lowest-position Hunter.
In the first place, can a Hunter at the bottom of the Cheongna Guild, not just any small guild, use his time freely like that? Isn’t Hunter some kind of employment contract?
Crucially, the suspicion was solidified because when Kwon Jiwoon was in crisis in the White Silver Guild, the Director of the Dungeon Management Office took over the case himself.
A Hunter who can move the Director who stayed at the Jeju branch due to some kind of dungeon development problem…..
Let’s think about it. He is a strong member of the Cheongna Guild, but there is only one hunter whose personal information is unknown.
The leader of the secretly powerful trend, the No. 1 ranker, Muwon.
Moreover, meaningful words that can never be thought of something an end-position ranker would say keep passing by. He was changing the subject so clearly.…
Once the hypothesis was established, all the evidence was clear.
The first and best S-class that has maintained his position at the top of the tower all the time. Someone who’s completely like the protagonist of a fantasy novel, Muwon.
However, the images of the two were so different that it took a long time to connect them.
It was clear that Ki Yoohyun was not good at hiding his identity, or had no intention of hiding it from the beginning. Otherwise, how can he go around showing off his power?
When I recited my thoughts, Ki Yoohyun sighed lightly and rubbed his forehead with his fingertips. The thin tension that had been floating around was nowhere to be found. There was a complicated expression on his face; he looked frustrated and relieved at the same time.
“Rieul-ssi.”
After licking his lips a few times, Ki Yoohyun continued.
“If you knew … why didn’t you tell me?”
“That’s because it’s your personal privacy?”
“…….”
A look of disdain reached my cheek.
Why? you can have the worldview where people won’t recognize that you’re the same person just by changing your hairstyle or wearing glasses.
Seeing that no one noticed that Ki Yoohyun was Muwon when it was so obvious, I thought that there was an agreement not to talk about that.
“….I thought you would hate me for deceiving you.”
“Eh, I wouldn’t.”
There are things I didn’t tell him either. It’s weird to reveal your secret to someone you’ve just met.
Besides, it wasn’t that shocking when I found out.
The person who is strong and helps me well, and likes to appear and disappear all of sudden is still the same person. Whatever his identity is, it doesn’t change much.
Well, I thought I’d tell him someday when the situation arises and until then….
“It’s like a social consideration for the poor No. 1 ranker who wants to avoid the world’s attention.”
“You treat people like a mola-mola….”
Ki Yoohyun was confused.
“But why did you suddenly decide to reveal it?”
The night air was quite cold. The warmth of the can of barley tea has long since cooled. As we walked towards his parked car, Ki Yoohyun handed over his gloves. I accepted it without hesitation, but there was space left because it was big. I added, fiddling with the rest of the glove with my fingertips.
“Weren’t you trying to hide it for a reason?” 
“To tell the truth, I went back in time.”
“Eu, cough! Cough, cough!”
This time, I was really surprised.
Ki Yoohyun handed me his own barley tea can and handkerchief when I choked in surprise. I drank it without hesitation. I thought I was going to die.
Ki Yoohyun is also a regressor?
Ki Yoohyun opened the car door for me, who was still out of reality. I got on, but my mind was spinning.
“So … Yoohyun-ssi, do you mean that you’re a regressor?”
“You believe me. I thought you’d think it was ridiculous.”
“That….”
I’m the one who knows best that regression exists.
Rather than the possibility that Ki Yoohyun suddenly became absorbed in a fantasy novel and took the concept of a possessor, it is more likely that he’s a regressor who remembers the past like me.
“I originally didn’t mean to tell you this fact, but….”
When I unexpectedly accepted his true identity as if it was nothing, he made up his mind to tell me that he was a regressor.
The following conversation was a story that gave me goosebumps even though the heater.was turned on. 
Three years later, in the Great Dungeon  Abys, the Demon is resurrected. 
Ki Yoohyun tried to stop the demon, but he returned to the past the moment he reached the last floor, ‘The Ultimate Gate‘.
“That … when was it? The date … when was the date?”
I was surprised to hear the date Ki Yoohyun said.
‘It’s same as me.’
Before the regression, it was the same day I died. 
Did Ki Yoohyun go back to the past because I went back? Or did the saintess use her hand on Ki Yoohyun?
I don’t know….
This made me want to reveal that I am also a regressor.
“…….”
However, as soon as I thought so, my lips didn’t move. I got it right away. The system holds me back. I resented it, and at the same time, I felt wronged.
Why me! Does causality discriminate against Grades? Is it because I’m an F-class?
“I can’t tell you everything about the future because of the restraints of causality….”
Ki Yoohyun’s words continued.
Behind the Demon’s resurrection, there was a crazy religious group called the Church of Starry Wisdom. Even now, they are plotting the resurrection of the Demon God.
Isn’t the worldview suddenly expanding too much?
“Rieul-ssi has already been involved in many incidents. I think the cult is behind it. That’s why I was going to tell you to be careful.”
“I see….”
Three years later, something big will happen. In addition, Ki Yoohyun also said he was trying to prevent the resurrection of the Demon.
Although it still feels far away, a sense of reluctance remains. I nodded.
“And one more thing.”
“Yes?”
“Earlier, you asked me if I have any problems with my sense of taste.”
“It’s … I’m sorry for asking you that nonsense.”
That’s what my cat said. As he hurriedly shook his hand out of embarrassment, Ki Yoohyun added.
“My taste buds are definitely fine, but … when I reached the Demon’s Gate, the Ultimate Gate, I felt that a part of me had flowed through the door.”
“…….”
“I have incomplete memories when I sealed the Demon’s Gate. I have become a different person than I was before awakening, and I feel that no matter what I do, I can’t go back to the way I was. It’s kind of a sense of loss.”
Huh. Listening to Ki Yoohyun’s serious words, I suddenly thought of his satisfaction bar when he drank coffee.
The bar that stopped at 98% without reaching 100% no matter what menu he consumes.
It may be an absurd idea, but … I thought that the unfilled 2% might be the missing part he was talking about.

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c90:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

I found a suitable seat through the gap between the people who played the timing game to catch the best spot. It falls next to the observatory and is not visible to people, but it is a place with a good view because the front is open.
“Yoohyun-ssi, go over there. I think we can see it well over there.”
“Oh, yes, I will.”
Claiming the spot is a race against time. I grabbed Ki Yoohyun’s arm and strode to the right spot. Then, it wasn’t long before the fireworks started.
First, a small yellow flame painted a picture in the sky. The picture drawn by the beautiful fireworks is … huh…?

Someone’s face?
It was Oh Seoho’s face, who winked with a lively and bright smile. The phrase that appeared at the bottom with the autograph was ‘Made by Oh Seoho‘.
“He … he’s a strong narcissist.”
“He’s not a bad person … in some way.”
“Oh, have you met him?”
“Somehow, yes.”
Ki Yoohyun answered briefly as if it’s not a topic he wanted to talk about.
Although the first one was embarrassing, the following fireworks were colorful and beautiful. The dazzling light constantly changes shape and paints pictures in the sky.
Oh Seoho is truly an illusionist. Although he is now more widely known as a celebrity, his abilities were enormous. When a huge castle appeared in the sky of Seoul and then turned into butterflies and disappeared, it seemed to lead people into a fantasy world, not mere fireworks.
It was a moment when I admired the fireworks in the cool breeze.
“……?”
I suddenly felt uncomfortable.
What is it?
“Yoohyun-ssi, one moment.”
“What’s the matter?”
“So, umh, ah, I’ll get something to drink from the vending machine.”
“I will go.”
“No. It’s right over there, okay. Stay where you are.”
There was a beverage vending machine not far away. I bought two warm barley teas and pretended to return to my original place, then I glanced over the bushes.
“…….”
“……Ah.”
He tried to press his hat on in a hurry, but it was already too late.
There’s no way I can’t recognize the silver hair that glitters subtly even in the dark night. 
“..…Kwon Jiwoon, what are you doing there?”
Kwon Jiwoon was crouching behind the bushes, and next to him was a good-looking man, Hunter Han Yiseong.
“Haha, ha. Rieul-ah, it’s a coincidence to meet you here.”
“……Hello, long time no see.”
“Dont tell me, oppa, you’re not following your younger sister or something like that … right?”
Right? No matter what, Kwon Jiwoon isn’t free enough to do such things, right? I stared at him with those words in my eyes.
“Ah, no, no, of course not! That’s impossible. This is a coincidence, a coincidence.”
“But why are you two here?”
“It’s just to watch the fireworks. It’s a long-awaited opportunity.”
All this time, who hasn’t been interested in exciting events in their lifetime? I looked at Kwon Jiwoon with suspicious eyes.
“This is behind the observatory, so you won’t be able to see it here….”
“Oh! Over there, over there! There’s just a seat over there, let’s go!”
Just as I was about to investigate further with doubt, Hunter Han Yiseong got up with Kwon Jiwoon.  Seeing them rush toward the front of the observatory to get a good seat in a hurry, they looked quite close.
A while ago, Ki Yoohyun said that the two were friends, so it was true….
How close would they be to see the fireworks together?
After watching their backs for a while, I went back to where Ki Yoohyun was. While watching the remaining fireworks, I talked about this and that with Ki Yoohyun. Unexpectedly, he was a pretty good talker. I talked about the new menu I made yesterday, and Ki Yoohyun said that the main office of the Dungeon Management Office was busy dealing with the last case.
“Wow, that’s cool.”
The final highlight, fireworks with the motif of a winter forest, decorated the grand ending. The fantastic forest, which seemed to have a refreshing smell, turned into snowflakes and disappeared one by one. 
Soon after, even the last snowflake turned into darkness, and the fireworks ended.
It’s indeed a nation with ‘hurry up‘ culture. People who filled the observatory began to leave, saying they had to go home quickly before the traffic jams.
He said he had something to say, but Ki Yoohyun didn’t talk much until the fireworks were over.
Is he going to talk about it after the number of people decreases? While drinking still warm canned barley tea, I looked at Ki Yoohyun quietly.
More than two months have already passed since I first encountered this man in the front yard of the store. Ki Yoohyun helped me several times, and he was generally kind. Sometimes he says  strange things, but I think he’s a good person.
However, there were times when I felt a strange feeling that was hard to express from him.
How should I describe it … he has a well-shaped face that can’t be covered with long hair or glasses, but he doesn’t have a presence for that.
His presence suddenly appears here and there, but it also would disappear again and again all of sudden.
As we talked from time to time, he knew a lot of things, but he seemed not to be interested in anything.
I felt like he’s here and not here at the same time. It seems that some part of the person named Ki Yoohyun is somewhere else, not here.
That’s still the case. That’s why I believed Mieum’s words that he barely felt any sense of taste without any doubt. Somehow I thought this person might be like that.
After the fireworks, darkness fell again. The street lamp lights don’t reach here. Those black eyes gleamed as if they contained light even in the dark.
Looking at his face, I suddenly remembered when he appeared at the shopping mall in Yongsan. He appeared with particles of sparkling light, and it felt as if he would disappear soon.
I unintentionally stretched out my hand, but I didn’t know where and what to catch, so I took it back.
“…….”
“…….”
In complete silence, I couldn’t stand the silence and opened my mouth first.
“It’s getting cold. I guess it’s really winter now.”
“Yes. It’s quite cold.”
“Yoohyun-ssi, what do you want to tell me today?”
He has a clear expression of hesitation. Ki Yoohyun took a light breath and slowly opened his mouth.
“That’s … I’m sorry. I wasn’t ready to speak, so I kept you waiting, Rieul-ssi. There was a disturbance.”
“It’s okay. It was fun to watch the fireworks, and as Yoohyun-ssi said, it seems that Kwon Jiwoon and Hunter Han Yiseong are friends.”
Since they came all the way here together.
Ki Yoohyun smiled bitterly at my words. He must have known that.
“You may be surprised, but I….”
However, the latter words did not continue straight away, and he went silent again. In the distance where the sound of his breathing could be clearly heard, I could feel his tension.
Ah. I can’t stand this tense atmosphere.
“Hey, what’s is it? I won’t be surprised, so tell me.”
At the same time, even I became nervous. Unable to bear the atmosphere, I opened my mouth again.
“Are you trying to tell me some secret? For example … is it that Yoohyun-ssi is the No.1 ranker, Muwon?”
“….yes?”
Flinch.
Ki Yoohyun was visibly surprised. His black eyes trembled greatly.
Huh, was that really it?
What am I supposed to say….
***
Ki Yoohyun decided to reveal his identity to Rieul.
He couldn’t lie to her any more.
His reason for hiding his identity from before the regression to the present is simple.
When it comes to the first ranker of the current Korean Hunter World, he’s already a kind of strategic resource that has already surpassed individuals. It was natural for his actions to be limited as much as his strong abilities. There was a practical reason to avoid unnecessary friction and move freely.
In the end, he did not trust others; Hunter Han Yiseong, who was always by his side, or even the party where they had the final decisive battle together.
In addition, Ki Yoohyun soon realized that there was a missing part of his memory.
In particular, the past memories before his awakening were unclear. Information such as date of birth, age, and where he was born remained, but he doesn’t think it’s him. He felt like he was looking into other people’s memories, as if he was reading a book.
Each cell that makes up his body felt unfamiliar. Can he simply call the collection of recorded information himself?
‘It’s finally over.’‘Thank you so much, Hunter-nim…!’
When the Awakening Center was destroyed, there were people cheering that the Hunter World could finally be normalized.
The person they have been waiting for is Muwon.
At that moment, Ki Yoohyun was unfamiliar with himself and could not stand it. He felt terribly reluctant to respond to their jubilation. It seemed as if the shadow had been erased and became a solitary existence.
The Power of White Light. It is a skill that manipulates space using the dense web of light created by The Spider Goddess, the being who makes threads in the dark.
However, whenever Ki Yoohyun uses this power, he gets the feeling that he is flowing into ‘the other side’ through the net of light.
One day, the moment this web was completed, he felt a fear that he would disappear beyond the “Ultimate Gate” and that this place would be taken over by someone other than himself.
Who on earth can he share this feeling with?
Then, he went back to three years in the past; now.
At first, he had no intention of revealing his identity to Kwon Rieul.
Many things have already changed from the original pre-regression past. The person at the center of all the changes is Kwon Rieul, which must not be a coincidence.
However, she’s an ordinary person by all accounts. Far from being related to the cult or the Demons, she also got injured by the tactics aimed at Kim Deokyi’s workshop.
It would be best to maintain a loose relationship as it is. He would help when she’s in danger, sometimes go for coffee, never reveal who he is. A loose relationship that only shows a well-made human figure.
That’s what he thought.
“Awakening doesn’t mean you become a different being, right?”
Those words somehow stuck in his mind.
It’s not meant for him. She must have said it out of concern for the twins who were still young. The words may be so plain and trivial that she won’t even remember it. Still, the more he thinks about it, the more it feels like she said that for him.
When he drank the coffee she made, he felt the empty space of his worn-out soul was filling up. Every time he tasted that warmth, he wanted to ask.
Even now, do you still think awakening does not make you a different being?
However, the day when he was unable to keep his decision to not reveal his identity and maintain a loose relationship came.
The city is thrown into chaos as black mucus appeared.
“Oh, you were just here. Guild leader?!”
As soon as Rieul pressed the security bell, Ki Yoohyun jumped over the space without hesitation towards her. It took some time to figure out where it was, as the action was faster than the accident.
The net of light knocked down the monster.
She embraced the child who was made as the incarnation of the Abyss. He saw her standing there, her face filled with determination to save such a child.
“….Yoohyun-ssi!”
The moment he heard the clear voice.
Ki Yoohyun felt the urge to let her know who he was.

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c89:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

It’s cute, it’s incredibly cute, but I’m flustered.
“I’m scared to sleep alone … I hope Noona comes early.”
Ash wiggled his fingers and avoided my gaze. 
Indeed, only a few days has passed after the attack of the mass of black mucus. Even though Ash is something that is not human, even if he’s the (self-proclaimed) Demon King of Twilight, he’s still such a young kid, so it must be scary.

I eventually promised to come back early and set out on the road.
“Nyaaaah (Isn’t that too much)…..”
“Kkyuu, kkyuuuu…..”
“Waeooogh (Little guy, your acting is terrible).”
The audience’s strict criticism was heard behind my back. They’re cold.
***
Ki Yoohyun looked nervous when there’s only two of us after we left the cafe. 
As usual, he smiled brightly. However, he led me to a large, expensive-looking car parked in front of the store with a stiff attitude somehow. The car was driven by Ki Yohyun himself.
“Rieul-ssi, what’s wrong?”
“Ah. I think you are good at driving.”
It felt strange to see him at the wheel like this because he always randomly appeared and disappeared as he wanted.
“I wanted to move quietly today, so I paid some attention.”
Umh.
I can see the reason why reverse parking with parking ticket in the driver’s mouth has been talked about for a long time. 
The side profile of Ki Yoohyun, who is driving the car smoothly while holding the steering wheel, looks cool even at first glance. His slightly long hair was neatly brushed to reveal his straight forehead, and his clothes also matched his tall height.
What is he trying to say that makes him pay this much attention? No matter how hard I thought, I couldn’t think of the reason why he would need to tell me separately.
What did we talk about the last time we met? I’m sure that’s….
…..Ah.
I swallowed a sigh. I remembered the memory of a big hand that covered mine, and a voice that touched my ears.
“Just, there’s no need for Rieul-ssi to be in pain because of people like this.”
It felt like the warmth of his hand was spreading throughout my body. His soft voice, the concern contained in it, touched my heart greatly.
It is too destructive to hear such words from such a person. It seems that not enough time has passed for the handsome immunity to develop yet.
….that’s why I deliberately tried not to think about it!
My heart thumped loudly. At this rate, it will be difficult to face Ki Yoohyun.
I creaked, desperately trying to think of something else.
Thoughts, other thoughts … hmm, so….
Come to think of it, I have a closet license. I got my license, but I didn’t have time to practice because I used public transportation for work anyway.
Wait, when did I get my license? Obviously that’s….
“……Ah.”
“Rieul-ssi, what’s the matter?”
“Nothing … it’s just….”
“Yes?”
That’s right, I’m back.
I got my driver’s license before I returned to the past. In other words, I have to get my license again.
“……I was thinking that I should get a driver’s license.”
It was a bit saddening.
While I was sad that I had to get my driver’s license again, the car ran smoothly down the road. Since it was the Hunter’s Night, the street was congested from early evening. 
Hunter’s Night, simply put, was a festival-like event for Hunters held once a year. It was held every year without fail even in situations where rifts suddenly broke out because it has a meaning to inform that Korea is safe.
The most popular event is the bargain sale of Hunter Market. People has been waiting in line from the night before to buy a sale item. In addition, a long line was seen outside the car window due to events held by each guild.
It’s a very different street scene from when we were panicked because of the black mucus lumps.
In order to avoid the crowds, the place where Ki Yoohyun drove the car was a restaurant located on the outskirts. It seemed that he already made a reservation in advance because the staff immediately guided us to our seats.
The restaurant has a flashy atmosphere as if it’s a place where people would never visit unless something special happened, so my shoulders became stiff with tension.
A completely separate room for a quiet conversation.
The food came out shortly after we sat down at the designated seats. Everything looked delicious, and I especially liked the fresh seafood dish.
Well, we’d better talk after we eat. As soon as the cafe was closed, I came straight here, and I’m getting hungry.
All the food was delicious. I tasted the dishes that come out one by one in the order of the course, then Ki Yoohyun suddenly spoke.
“Hunter Han Yiseong asked me to thank Rieul-ssi.”
“Yes? Why?”
I remembered the good-looking Hunter Han Yiseong. However, no matter how much I thought about it, I didn’t remember doing anything that would make him feel grateful to me.
“Hunter Han Yiseong is on good terms with Hunter Kwon Jiwoon.”
Well, they looked pretty close when I saw them before.
“I see … then the two are friends?”
“Rather than a friend…….”
Ki Yoohyun, who was choosing his words for a while, continued.
“As a Hunter, if you work in the guild for a long time, you will naturally find out that there aren’t many people you can trust. For Hunter Han Yiseong, Hunter Kwon Jiwoon is a rare opponent.”
Even so, I don’t think it’s something I should be thanked for.
I was embarrassed by the unexpected words, but Ki Yoohyun, who moistened his throat with water, opened his mouth again.
“Rieul-ssi, what happened within the barrier that day?”
“Ah, that’s…….”
That annoying meaningful experience … no, can I say that I met the saintess?
It’s not that I don’t trust Ki Yoohyun, but I was reluctant to say it as I couldn’t understand the exact meaning of what the saintess had said.
“No, I’m sorry. You don’t have to answer.”
“.…why?”
“Asking Rieul-ssi about this first feels a bit … cowardly. Let’s have this conversation again after I say what I have to say.”
“Yes, go ahead.”
“…….”
“…….”
For a moment, silence fell.
As if to finally bring up the main point, the black eyes filled with light turned straight to me. The extremely serious expression on his face made me nervous as well.
It was the moment when Ki Yoohyun licked his lips and was about to say something.
Knock, knock. The staff opened the door, came in, served the dessert, and went out again.
Perfect timing as if you were aiming for it! I don’t think it would be possible to intentionally enter at such an exquisite timing.
The conversation was cut off naturally. Ki Yoohyun swallowed what he was about to say and pushed the plate in front of him instead.
“Try this. It’s savory and delicious.”
I suddenly felt a sense of incompatibility.
What is it? I think I forgot something.
“Yoohyun-ssi, how about this? What does this taste like?”
Ki Yoohyun tasted the dessert on the plate without any doubt.
“It’s sour. I think there’s citron in the sauce.”
“…….”
“…what’s the matter?”
“Yoohyun-ssi, it may sound strange, but … have you ever had problems with your taste buds like being unable to taste something?”
However, even without hearing the answer, Ki Yoohyun in front of me seemed to have no problem tasting the taste.
“No. I’ve never had a problem like that … why?”
At that moment, the words of a certain cat came to mind.
“This man, you hardly notice the taste.”“His sense of taste seems to have weakened considerably.”
Yes, it’s Mieum who told this story.
In other words, it is not a confirmed story, but it’s just Mieum’s wild talk.
“…….”
“Rieul-ssi?”
I poured out my resentment towards a certain beast that was not here.
Kwon Mieum, we’ll see. You’re dead when I get home!
***
“I’m against it. Please reconsider.”
It was Han Yiseong who shook his head at Ki Yoohyun’s words.
“No. I know Hunter Han Yiseong’s concern, but my thoughts remain the same. I’m going to tell Rieul-ssi today.”“If that’s what the guild leader’s will … I understand.”
Ki Yoohyun recalled this conversation and touched his forehead.
Understand be damned. He should have said it more clearly.
Don’t disturb me.
***
“It would be easier to talk in a place where there are no people.”
After finishing the meal, Ki Yoohyun, who said so, drove the car again.
Huh? Wasn’t the restaurant quiet and empty just now?
Ki Yoohyun, noticing the question in my eyes, smiled bitterly.
“It looks like there’s a mouse.”
As soon as he finished his words, the car made a big U-turn.
Huh? I think our genre has just changed. Is it just me?
The car sped down the road into the city. Then, with his exquisite driving skills, he circled the road and went uphill at an unexpected timing.
The buildings gradually decreased and soon became a mountain road. The car stopped in front of an observatory after running for a while. It was a place where you could look down at the city from the top of the mountain.
An observatory where darkness began to fall. There were quite a few people around the observatory.
“That’s right. I heard there’s a fireworks display today.”
Hunter’s Night Fireworks Festival was today. The fireworks don’t detonate real gunpowder, but they are created with mana by the wizard-class Hunters. This is also a traditional event that has been going on for several years because it also means showing off that there are many high-grade Hunters in Korea.
The scene where the colorful fireworks created by ether embroidered the night sky is quite spectacular, so it is understandable that there are so many people. It’s especially true today.
If I remember correctly, the person in charge of the fireworks display this time is Hunter Oh Seoho, ranked 17th, who is famous for his handsomeness.
It was rare for a ranker to directly take charge of such entertainment, so it became a hot topic. When I looked around, I saw many people holding objects with Oh Seoho’s picture.
It wasn’t a good atmosphere to talk quietly, but everyone was excited anyway, so they were not interested in others.
Rather, it might be easier to talk in this atmosphere. Since I’m not immune to that face, it’s very nerve-racking to face Ki Yoohyun in a quiet place.
Moreover, I had never seen this fireworks properly before the regression. 
Ah. I’ve only seen it once. It was late night at the company, it looked small through the gap in the building outside the window.
‘It’s a sad memory….’
As such, I was a little excited.

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c88:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

Although the barrier problem was resolved, the situation of the White Silver Guild was still complicated.
As a considerable number of hunters have left the guild, it is impossible for the guild to raid the dungeon. The guild’s capability to solo-attack a dungeon is an important criterion for dividing the so-called “Grade” of the guild.
Moreover, Hunter Park Heeyoung, who was always next to Kwon Jiwoon, hit the back of his head like that….
No wonder Kwon Jiwoon’s mind is complicated.

Ah, I should have ripped off all of Park Heeyoung’s hair. I ripped it off that day, but I still can’t get rid of all my anger.
She is detained and being investigated by the Dungeon Management Office. There must be several charges at stake, so we won’t meet again.
“I should recruit new hunters now.”
Kwon Jiwoon added. In order to maintain the White Silver Guild, which was founded and raised by my uncle, Kwon Jiwoon said that he had rarely recruited new hunters.
However, Kwon Jiwoon, who said that they could not stay in this state forever, seemed relieved.
I suddenly remembered Choi Cedric. 
The hunters who belonged to the White Silver Guild moved to the guild under the C&L Corporation. It would be natural for a person to suspect C&L is behind the incident of the White Silver Guild.
However, there is no clear evidence due to their cunning actions.
Is Choi Cedric also involved in this? When we met in person, he didn’t feel so insidious, but….
Hmm, it’s hard to tell right now, so let’s think about it later.
In such a bad situation, there is only one reason why he asked me to join the White Silver Guild.
To protect me.
In the past, he purposely kept his distance to protect me, but this time, he’s just trying to keep me close to his watch. As a cafe owner, I don’t have anything to do in the White Silver Guild right now.
That’s why I refused. I’m happy to confirm my relationship with Kwon Jiwoon and the affection of my family, but I didn’t want to be a burden for him.
When I said so, Kwon Jiwoon was bitter. Still, he quickly accepted my decision.
“But you’ve never been a burden.”
He didn’t forget to add this.
And….

“Waeooong (Human, what is this)!”
At Mieum’s cry, I cut off the thoughts that were expanding.
As the bag fell sideways, the award certificate that I had put inside came out. It was the moment when Mieum and Lime, who happily ate the cake, were about to touch the award certificate case.
“Wait! Kwon Mieum, Kwon Lime, stop! Stop!”
“Kyagyakyaong?!”
“Kkyuuuuu!”
Mieum, who was startled, puffed out her tail. In the meantime, I grabbed a wet tissue and approached the two animals.
“I told you not to touch a piece of paper when you have something on you!”
Whew, I’m glad. I was able to stop Mieum and Lime, who were almost becoming creamy lumps, from stamping their milk fat footprints on paper. I freed the animals only after thoroughly wiping their bodies, the soles of their feet, and the corners of the mouth.
“Kkyuuuu! Kkyuuu!”
“Nyaaaah (Is this the thing called the award certificate)!”
There’s a brief moment for them to look into the letters of the award certificate. Soon, the two began to play, bouncing the award certificate case. They really like unexpected things.
“Please be quiet … eh, well done.”
I tossed the award certificate case to dry the animals that were bouncing the award certificate case to hit each other’s foreheads and left them alone.
I wanted to stop at that….
Instead, I looked at the award certificate placed alone.
I was very embarrassed, and the thought of receiving an undeserved award remains the same.
‘Still….’
It feels nice.
***
Midnight.
Ash felt thirsty and opened his eyes. The light sleep had already receded. He put down the red slime cushion he was hugging and stood up.
He was going to take water out of the refrigerator and drink it for a while, but an unexpected scene grabbed Ash’s feet.
“Um…..”
A hall on the first floor where yellow lights glow softly A woman with a foolish face was lying flat on her stomach at the table.
What is she doing here until this hour?
Ash’s question was solved before he even approached her. It’s because he heard a sound of steady breathing.
On the table, there is a book with ‘Dungeon Ecology Encyclopedia‘ written on its cover. It seems that she fell asleep while trying to read that book.
‘If I leave her alone, she will wake up on her own. ‘
Ash ignored her and tried to head toward the refrigerator. However, this time, he heard a voice.
“Ash…..”
“Why?”
He waited for a while, but the words didn’t continue. It seemed that it was just a sleep-talking.
Ash became curious about the latter words of the sleep talks that was swallowed by the drowsy breathing, and he was annoyed at himself who was curious about such things.
The woman tossed and turned her body, but there was no sign of waking up.
The weather is already in early winter. The first floor, where the heating was turned off, was quite chilly, so if she continued to sleep like this, she would definitely catch a cold.
“Haa….”
She was a woman who could only be described as really stupid. It would make him feel bad to see her sniffling with a cold. He thought that he had no choice but to hug her and take her to the room on the second floor.
……and then, he hesitated.
He remembered the time when she hugged him in the space beneath the huge tree.
Her eyes were swollen and she looked like a mess, yet she patted him on the back, saying she was worried about him. He doesn’t know how she is so insensitive.
Ash felt his earlobes burning hot.
He has been feeling strange since that day. Every time this woman approached him without hesitation or swept his hair, his breath became short and his cheeks became hot.
That’s why Ash was trying not to encounter Kwon Rieul as much as possible, even though there was no success today.
“…….Sh.”
No, this is not it. Unlike this woman who hugs people everywhere, he is just trying to move her to her room.
That’s really all it is….
Nevertheless, touching her while she was asleep felt a bit cowardly.
In the end, Ash took a step back without embracing Kwon Rieul. Instead, he used his magic to levitate her body.
[The connection is not smooth. Reconnection requires reconstitution of existence.]
The warning window flashed in front of him. Ash frowned slightly and then deleted the warning window.
As the Otherworld Gate was closed, in the aftermath, Ash became a ‘separated link’. In other words, the connection with the main body was completely disconnected and it became an independent entity.
The ego of an individual incarnation is meaningless to oneself. Originally, he would not be able to withstand the instability and chose extinction, but….
Ash made his way to the second floor with Kwon Rieul’s floating body. She didn’t wake up even when he, without shaking, put her down on the bed.
Ash thought, looking at her quietly.
It’s a weak human body, so it can’t be helped.
‘I should protect you.’
***
Page Eight: Holstein, Jersey, and … Golden Triangular Rhino

It happened when I talked to Ki Yoohyun on the phone for the commendation.
Before I hung up, he blurted out some words.
— Rieul-ssi, I have something to tell you … when do you have time?“Then, come to the cafe when it’s convenient for you, Yoohyun-ssi.”— No, it’s not that … I’d like to see you outside separately.
Ah. He helped me many times, but I always asked him to come to the cafe.
Even so, I thought I should express my gratitude properly, this is great.
That’s how I made an appointment today. As soon as the cafe was cleaned up, Ki Yoohyun arrived just in time. As the weather was quite chilly, I put on a thick coat and prepared to go out.
“Then, Ash, I’ll be back.”
However, Ash ran forward and blocked Ki Yoohyun.
……what?
Even at first glance, the sullen expression looked dissatisfied with something.
“Ash, what’s wrong?”
“…….”
Shashashak, shashak.
When Ki Yoohyun stepped to the left, Ash went to the left, and when he went to the right, he also went to the right.
Left, oh, left, left, oh, left, right again. He blocked the view with the perfect timing.
All Perfect Combo!
I didn’t know that our Ash had a talent for rhythm games. With his agile and swift movement, he can show off his brilliant skills without being intimidated by any arcade.
No, no, not this.
“Yoohyun-ssi, why are you matching the rhythm with the kid again?”
When I turned around, Ki Yoohyun turned his head with a shy expression.
“It’s fun, that’s enough….”
I approached Ash, who actually had not been able to hide Ki Yoohyun at all because of his short height, and asked.
“Ash, what’s wrong?”
“When are you coming home today?”
“Well … I think it’s going to be a little late.”
It is early evening now. Considering the time it takes to eat and move, it might be late at night.
Anguish crossed Ash’s face. He has something to say, but he looked like he was hurting his pride.
I sat knee-to-knee on the floor, made eye contact, and waited for Ash’s inner conflict to come to an end.
It seems that it was the speaking side that won after a fierce battle. He closed his eyes tightly before opened his lips.
“Noona….!”
“Uh, huh?”
It was the first time Ash called me noona. No matter how much I asked before, he didn’t listen.
In the meantime, the voice saying noona with a face that looks better because he ate and rested well was so cute. Ash’s cheeks flushed red.
“Waeoong (good job, good job)!”
“Kkyuuu!”
Ash continued, leaving behind the audience who did not clear whether they were teasing or cheering him.
“Noona, can you come home early today?”
“Uh … huh?”
Why is he suddenly doing something he usually didn’t do?

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c87:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

“Is that so? You look very close with them.”
“Huh? Ah, yes. They’re regulars at my cafe.”
The twins stared at each other in surprise before they looked at me again.
“Re … am I a reguler?”
“Yeah, are you not?”

“I am a regular, Eonni! I will become a regular.”
“Me … me too!”
They nodded their heads eagerly. If you look at them in this way, they are really ordinary kids.
“Kids, and this is Kwon Jiwoon, the deputy guild leader of the White Silver Guild. He’s my cousin.”
“……!”
“Are you cousins?”
The twins stared at each other again, then they looked at Kwon Jiwoon. Then, a bright smile appeared on their round cheeks.
“Hello!”
“Hello!”
Their eyes are sparkling. The signs of being strangely wary suddenly disappeared and the lively expression returned to their faces.
I also offered lunch to the twins, but they promised to join me next time because they had something to do. 
However, before leaving, Joo Shinwoo was wriggling his fingers for a long time. It’s obvious that he has something to say.
“What’s wrong?”
“Hey … noona, is he okay?”
“He? Ah, you mean Ash?”
The last time they met was when we ran away from the black mucus mass in front of the Dungeon Gate. I guess that’s why he was worried about him.
“Yeah, he’s fine. Come and see him next time.”
“……! Yes.”
Swiftly, the twins ran away with a relieved expression. I looked at their backs and thought.
‘He’s fine, but … he’s kind of weird.’
***
“Guys, I’m home.”
After having lunch with Kwon Jiwoon, and packing desserts for Ash and the animals, more time passed than I expected.
“Waeeoong! You’re here now, human! Why are you so late?”
“Kkyuuuuuu!”
As soon as I opened the door and walked in, I was greeted by Mieum’s meow punch and Lime’s body bump.
It hurts quite a bit when they hit me with all their might.
“Don’t be so angry. Look, I bought some snacks.”
I took out the Earl Grey cake, made by a famous dessert shop, from the box I had in my hand. Since I received an award today, I’m glad I chose the biggest size. Mieum put her paws down when she saw the big cake.
“Mieum, you are a cat, but you really like snacks.”
“Waeooogh?! Cat discrimination! Is there a law that says cats shouldn’t eat snacks!”
Well, there isn’t, but…….
I suddenly remembered what the saintess had said in my vision.
“Your cat will guide you.”
Really? This one?
“Hmm….”
“….woogyaag?! Why are you suddenly looking at me with such suspicious eyes! It wasn’t me, it was this guy who ate it, meoow!”
“Kkyu! Kkyuuu!”
“Mieum, I can see the cream around your mouth.”
“Mrrrrrrrrrrawr.”
After avoiding the heavy meow punch that quickly flew in, I sliced ​​the cake according to the number of people. However, one person is missing.
“By the way, where is Ash?”
“He’s stuck in there alone, meow!”
“……?”
As Mieum said, I found Ash when I went to the next room. He was sitting with his knees up and watching TV.
The movie on the screen is The Priests. As the main character ran with the black pig, Ash shed tears.
Huh … was that a sad story…?
Anyway.
I tapped lightly on the already opened door and started talking.
“Kim Ash! I bought a cake. Come out and let’s eat together.”
“…….”
“It’s a very delicious cake. Come quickly.”
“….Eung.”
Reluctantly, Ash got up, but he didn’t make eye contact with me. All I could see was Ash’s red neck and earlobes.
“Ash, do you have a fever?”
When the fever rises, the tear glands become loose. Maybe that’s why he sniffled as the movie was running toward a happy ending.
I sat with my knees on the floor and made eye contact with Ash. Then, I reached out and tried to measure the heat on his forehead.
“Euh….!”
As soon as my fingers tried to sweep his bangs lightly, Ash violently removed my hand. Then, with an even hotter face, he rushed out and sat down in front of the table.
When he first came here, he had an unfriendly attitude, but something seems different this time.
It’s hard to say exactly what it is, but it’s different.
The reason … is it because of that day?

After confirming that Kwon Jiwoon was safe, I returned to the store once. The purpose was to get Ash out of the space.
How anxious he must be to be alone in that place. It must be boring because there is nothing else but a big coffee tree and sugarcanes. I’ll meet him quickly and tell him everything is okay now.
My eyes were swollen from all the crying that I did while hugging Kwon Jiwoon tightly. Mieum and Lime, who were sitting on the floor, were surprised to see my face. I went straight into the space.
Ash was sitting under the tree trunk, hugging his knees. The dull expression on his face made me realize that it was really over now, so I hugged Ash.
“Ash, you’ve waited for a long time. It’s okay now.”
Rush. Ash’s small, skinny body came into my arms. He was startled, his shoulders and back stiffened.
I slowly patted Ash’s back. Little by little, I could see his shoulders relaxed and his earlobes were burning.
It was only after he was completely drained that Ash slowly opened his mouth.
“Why aren’t you asking?”“Huh? What?”“Now you know. I….”
The latter words did not continue for a long time. Then, he added in a barely audible voice, “I’m not human“.
When he thought I didn’t hear it, Ash opened his lips again, and eventually let out only a thin breath.
Yes, as Ash said, I know that Ash’s identity is not an ordinary human being.
Now that I think about it, I should have noticed it when he was lying down in front of this store. I just thought he was a kid in his sensitive age with a situation.….
However, it didn’t mean that I didn’t want to investigate Ash’s identity just because I felt sorry for him. I wasn’t someone with such a nice personality.
The system no longer tells me to deal with Ash.
I don’t know what that means, but keeping Ash doesn’t pose a threat to me.
The black eyes tried to look calm, but the anxiety inside them was clearly visible. 
The guilty conscience that I would feel if I interrogate and drive out Ash, who makes such a sad expression. The uncertain safety that might be gained from doing that. I weighed Ash and the uncertain safety, and I chose the former.
Besides, he’s a genius part-timer….
Just imagining running the cafe by myself without Ash makes my eyes turn dark.
I continued speaking, hugging Ash tighter.
“Are you the being called the incarnation of Asmodeus?”“……!”
His eyes shook greatly. He looked as if he was saying, ‘Why are you doing this when you know it?’.
“Come to think of it, you said it when we first met. I thought you were just babbling.”“…….”“You don’t like being here?”
Flinch. Ash, who was surprised, slowly shook his head.
“Okay then. Ash is the part-timer at my house, huh.”“……Yes.”

It was good to bring him out like that, but he has been acting in that way since then.
I think his behavior lately is a bit of a mess; he seems to be shy, and somehow he seems to be restless….
I wonder if it’s because he’s in a difficult age.
That’s what this is all about.
I took out the roasted coffee beans. The event that threw the city into chaos is over. The danger of rifts and dungeons is still lurking, but for now it is peaceful.
However, there was still one problem in Cafe Rieul.
[Fresh Milk: Out of Stock※ We are currently preparing for stock. We’ll send you a notification when it’s in stock.]
It is true that there is no sign of milk coming in. The Dimensional Shop didn’t sell milk even though they ate a few of my rubies.
A cafe without milk … unintentionally, the menu has decreased significantly.
Instead, I found this menu while looking through the list of recipes I’ve gotten so far in the hopes of making a new menu.
Well, this is it. There was no milk in the ingredients, and it seemed perfect to drink in this current situation.
I first picked the fruit of the Purifying Tree, the lemon, from the space. Then, I washed the lemon thoroughly and sliced it finely.
Next, brew the espresso. It was a simple menu that was completed by adding espresso to a coffee cup with sliced lemon.
As I put one more cup down in front of me, a status window appeared.
[Item: Cafe Romano (★★★★☆)Status: Good (Time Remaining: 01:00:00)Effect: Increases enchantment success rate by 200% for 1 time, and prevents item damage in case of enchantment failure.]
Enchantment is another word for granting magic. It refers to applying magic to an item to increase its efficacy semi-permanently.
The problem is that sometimes the item will broke when the enchantment fails. If an expensive item that you’ve worked hard to get is damaged due to the enchantment, you will get an anger disorder.
I thought it would be good to give this menu to Grandma Kim Deokyi next time.
The fresh lemon scent blends well with the flavor of the espresso. After taking a sip of coffee, I spoke to Ash.
“Ash, do you want some sugar?”
“It’s okay. It is delicious as it is.”
Even though he said so, Ash, who took a sip of coffee, had a complicated look. Seeing that the satisfaction bar fills up only after he ate a big piece of cake with a fork, bitter coffee doesn’t seem to suit his taste.
“Ash is good at drinking bitter coffee.”
“Of course.”
……I decided to pretend I didn’t know.
“Unyaaaah (Me too! I’m different too)!”
“Kkyuu! Kkyuu!”
As soon as the cake plate was placed in front of them, Mieum and Lime quickly ate it up and started playing with cream on each other’s bodies.
Hey, how do you guys clean that up…….
Well, it doesn’t matter because there is ‘The Floor is Shiny‘.
Leaving the two creamy lumps alone, I also took a bite of the cake.
It’s delicious.
***
“Are you sure you don’t want to join the White Silver Guild?”
It was when I had lunch with Kwon Jiwoon. He said in a casual tone, but I knew he asked seriously. I quietly shook my head.
“Yeah, I’m sorry.”“Okay, I understand.”
It was an offer that I had already rejected once. As if it was just a confirmation, Kwon Jiwoon did not ask again and only wet his throat with water.

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c86:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

Award, that was quite out of the blue.
“Huh, what … award?”“Just in time, there will be a commendation ceremony for the Hunter’s Night event, so I need to contact the person in charge right away.”“What? Oppa, thank you for your consideration, but isn’t a Hunter responded to rift out of its scope?”
It’s a ‘Hunter’s Night Celebration‘, so it may sound strange, but it actually is.

That’s because, until a decade ago, they had made a lot of rewards in the name of awarding a commendation to a brave Hunter. 
As a Hunter, it is not uncommon to enter the dungeon, so the reason depends on the attachment. There was a wide range of awards that were given out in a rotating manner.
Since then, rewarding Hunters for simple reasons such as ‘they responded well to the rift’, ‘they attacked the dungeon faithfully’ were prohibited. Specific reasons and strict screening have became mandatory.
They say that there is a reason for all the rules…..
“That’s not true. You said that you’re an Awakened, but Rieul, you don’t belong to a guild or a public institution. It’s great enough to step up in a situation where you’re not obligated to.”“That … I was just worried about the part-timer at my store.”“Then it’s even more amazing.”“Eww.”
Now that I look at it, Kwon Jiwoon looks like a dull fellow.
Why didn’t I realise it before? No, I was just trying not to realise it.
My mouth puffed at the embarrassment. Then, the door of the drawing room opened after a knock.
“Yes, Hunter Kwon Jiwoon is right.”“Huh … Jina-ssi? You were here?”“I heard about the circumstances from Hunter Ki Yoohyun earlier, and I think you deserve a commendation. I will pass it on to the person in charge.”“No, it’s okay … Jina-ssi, aren’t you busy with your work?”“Ah, not that much. Leave it to me.”
…….
…….
The screening process went on like flowing water.
In the end, today has come.
It’s nice to receive the award and the prizes (it’s <Dungeon Management Office> cafeteria meal ticket and <Hunter Market> fee discount coupon.…), but it’s more embarrassing than I thought.
“Now that the time has come, how about lunch?”
Kwon Jiwoon asked me.
Well, before I left, I gave the animals plenty of food, and I also prepared a lunch for them, so I’m sure it’ll be fine.
“Okay, that’s great. Where are we going?”
I was about to leave the venue with Kwon Jiwoon, but someone passed by from the opposite side and approached me.
“Rieul-ssi, congratulations.”
“Ahaha, thank you.”
As a matter of course, it is said that Jina’s brother, Jijon, who returned to his original form, was immediately arrested.
It’s not because of the attempted murder charges. When it comes to the case where Grandma Kim Deokyi’s workshop burned down, Jijon is out of the list of suspects and is only an important witness.
However, even if the circumstances are taken into account, there are suspicions that he has been involved in various illegal activities. It will be known only when the results of the investigation come out, but it seems difficult to avoid punishment.
“Well, who can blame that man for his own gain? I’m glad you saved his life. I hope he comes to his senses after being punished.”
That’s what Jina said….
She looks tired, but her expression is more relaxed. I was relieved to see it.
The family of a public official belonging to the main office is an important witness in a large case. Due to this reason, Jina decided to quit the Dungeon Management Office immediately.
She had her thoughts, and there must have been some unspoken pressure around her.
However, it was Kang Hyunwoo, the head of Emergency Dungeon Countermeasures Team, her boss, who unexpectedly stepped up.
“We can’t miss an excellent assistant like Jina-ssi.”“Please stay at the main office. Jina-ssi didn’t do anything wrong.”
She finally decided not to quit thanks to his full support.
I’m very curious about this part of the story. I want to hear it in detail.
“Jina-ssi, I’m going to have lunch now. Do you want to join?”
“I would very much like to do that, but what a pity … it’s the day Rieul-ssi receives the commendation, so I came out for a while. I have to go back soon.”
Oh dear…..
Jina was holding several file folders in one hand and a book in the other hand. The letters on the cover caught my eye.
『 <Dungeon Management Office> FINAL preparation for the non-Awakened person screening promotion test with a complete summary in one book. 』
That’s it. A slow one-hit shot. If she swings it, I think she can send her opponent away in one shot.
It seems that Kang Hyunwoo’s words impressed Jina. With an energetic gait, she left with the deadly weapon, no, the book.
… Next time we meet, I’ll make you a strong cup of coffee.
***
After separating ways with Jina, I was walking side by side with Kwon Jiwoon to go to the restaurant he had reserved.
“……?”
I ran into a little boy in a black suit that fitted him perfectly.
His hair was neatly combed to expose his forehead, and his face was expressionless. His cold eyes, seemingly indifferent to the adults around him, even showing signs of boredom.
He has a cold atmosphere that is hard to approach. I could see a couple of people around him trying to talk to him, but they’re backing away at the cold reaction.
Strangely, he looks familiar. Is it just my feeling?
“Kwon Rieul, what’s wrong?”
“Ah, nothing. I’m coming.”
Five steps ahead, Kwon Jiwoon called me. I quickly tried to follow him.
“……Ah.”
Then, I happened to make eye contact with the child who turned his head in my direction.
His cold face turned bright red in an instant.
“Oh! Hey, hurry up and come here!”
“What’s wrong? I told you not to call me for something that wasn’t a big deal because it’s annoying.”
“You idiot! This is not the time for that!”
Whoops, he snatched a child with the same face in the same outfit that was a little far away. Then, they both started running this way at the same time.
Don’t tell me, those kids…….
“Eonni, hello! What are you doing here? I was surprised!”
“You idiot! Didn’t you know that Noona was getting a commendation today? I knew about it!”
“Who allowed you to call her noona, you idiot!”
“You can call me noona….”
“What did you say, she said I can!”
“I also wanted to see you receiving the commendation, Eonni! I couldn’t go because I had a really annoying job today. Congratulations. You’re so cool.”
“Congratulations!”
The cheerful voices pouring in before I could even finish a word.
They were the twins, Joo Shinwoo and Joo Shinhee. Their atmosphere changed so much when they were wearing a suit, I couldn’t recognize them at once.
No, the clothes aren’t the problem … the cold expression from before was so different.
“Wait! Hunter Joo Shinhee, we have to finish our conversation.”
At that time, the person who was persistently talking to Joo Shinhee earlier got angry and tried to grab her shoulder….
“……go away.”
He caught her gaze and backed away.
That’s right, they used to be like this before the regression.
Hmm. I need to work harder on Dungeon Detox….
There was no appearance of Ki Yoohyun or Hunter Han Yiseong next to the twins. This is in front of the main hall of the Dungeon Management Office. Did these kids come here to do business alone?
“Where are you going now?”
“I’m going to have lunch now.”
“….Rieul-ah.”
When I didn’t come, Kwon Jiwoon came back to find me.
“Ah, I’m meeting my acquaintances for a second.”
“Is that so?”
“……!”
The twins looked very surprised when they saw Kwon Jiwoon.
Their eyes alternately looked at Kwon Jiwoon and me, and somehow they looked nervous. Why? Are these kids wary of fellow Hunter?
They turned around and whispered to each other in a low voice for a moment. Among the twins who came back to face me, Joo Shinhee was the first to exclaim resolutely.
“Lead … Hunter Ki Yoohyun-nim also wanted to come today!”
“Tha-that’s right! He was going to come and congratulate you!”
“Eonni, it’s not that he didn’t come on purpose.”
I know. I already got congratulatory messages on the phone.
I was very embarrassed to receive the commendation by myself, as I did the work of saving the Long-tailed Phoenix and saving Kwon Jiwoon with Ki Yoohyun. Since Ki Yoohyun was a hunter belonging to a guild, he was not eligible for the commendation
He didn’t seem to care, but…….
“Why do you think so? It’s a fair reward for what Rieul-ssi has done, please take it easy. It’s a pity I couldn’t attend in person that day.”“Ah, are you busy that day?”“Yes, I have to deal with a little troublesome work. There are a lot of people in the main office who will feel uncomfortable when they see me.”“What on earth did you do….”“Haha, somehow it just happened … congratulations in advance.”
We had that conversation.
“Yes, I heard. I heard he was busy?”
As if he wanted to defend Ki Yoohyun, Joo Shinwoo quickly nodded.
“Yes! The old raccoon could have just opened his mouth quickly … ouch! Ouch!”
Joo Shinhee pinched Joo Shinwoo mercilessly and lowered her voice.
“You idiot! You can’t talk about that! He said it was a secret.”
“But, I hope that old raccoon doesn’t interrupt. In the meantime, Noona said she’s eating with that white hair.”
“It’s all right. I think lead … Hunter Ki Yoohyun-nim still has an advantage.”
“Really?!”
“Yeah, it’s lunch, not dinner, so there’s still a chance of winning. Dinner is dangerous!”
Guys, I can hear you…….
I understand roughly what the misunderstanding was, but there is no end to this. I swallowed a bitter smile and first introduced the twins to Kwon Jiwoon.
“Oppa, I think you probably know, but these children are Hunter Joo Shinhee and Hunter Joo Shinwoo of Cheongna Guild.”
“…….”
They bowed their heads slightly with a wary look.

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c85:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

The system has clear intentions.
It must not because the saintess is a philanthropist that she prevented the death of Kwon Jiwoon, Jijon, and me.
Then, what is the intention behind it?
【There is no such thing. You just have to live your daily life in this second life.】

“Lies.”
【Yes, it’s a lie.】
Heat surged inside.
Let’s not get angry. I am an adult, an adult … think of this saintess as a superior employee who repeats funny jokes.
She’s A and I’m B. The saintess has Kwon Jiwoon’s life in her hands, so I have to endure it, I have to endure it…….
【You’re too much. I saved his life without any conditions, but such heartless words.】
Heh, do you read my mind?
【Someday, you will reach the Gate. Your cat will guide you.】
“……really?”
Are you sure you’re saying that after looking at Mieum’s daily life? She’s enjoying it after adjusting perfectly to the life of royalties.
【Ahaha, she woke up after a long time, so she got so excited. Please understand. She will fulfill the role of the seventh agent properly.】
“What is the Gate?”
【The Ultimate Gate. The pathway to reach the truth of the universe. The garden where the Great Master sleeps.】
I updated her description in my mind.
Meaningful….
A saintess character who appears at the beginning of a fantasy RPG game and speaks meaningful words to the novice protagonist, but does not explain it in an understandable way.
The white light grew stronger and the darkness trembled. This conversation seemed to have come to an end.
“Who are you?”
【You said I’m a saintess. It’s the first time I’ve been called like this. I really like this character.】
“Is the system you?”
【Rather than that, a tool for contacting this world without defying causality is what you call a system. Well, I made it, though.】
She drifted away. Only the voice can be heard clearly.
【Let me formally introduce myself to you. I……】
【The One-in-All. The All-in-One.】
【The one who observes all three times.】
【The manager who guards the Gate, and…】
An unpronounceable name tickled my ears.
The light was swallowed up by the chaos boiling deep in the darkness.
Not yet. There was something I had to ask.
I cried out in a hurry.
“One last thing! Why does the future change after I returned? Did such a big deal happen because I came back to the past?”
【I’m sorry, I can’t answer that. The law of causality applies strictly to me too. I cannot intervene in the actions of other Gods. However, you don’t have to blame yourself for what happened today because it’s not caused by you.】
“…….”
【And what does that matter now? For now, first of all, please rejoice in the return of your family.】
…….
…….

The first thing I saw when I opened my eyes was the strong waves of ether and … Kwon Jiwoon, who was lying on the floor.
“Deputy guild leader!”
“Rieul-ssi!”
I heard a voice calling me from far away.
Slowly, I reached out and grabbed Kwon Jiwoon in front of me.
At that moment, the etheric waves that wandered around collapsed, and the translucent membrane was broken.
People outside rushed in and stopped walking.
In the suffocating silence, the tightly closed eyelids are slowly lifted.
“……?”
As if he did not immediately understand the situation, Kwon Jiwoon looked at me with a bewildered expression.
Haha, it was an expression that really didn’t suit his cold-looking face.
“Uh … the phantasmagoria….?”
Rush. I hugged the dazed Kwon Jiwoon tightly.
“Uh, Rieul-ah, why are you here….”
“Oppa, I’m glad you’re okay, heuk….”
Yes, what the saintess said is true.
Let’s first be happy that Kwon Jiwoon is alive. Other things are just trivial compared to him.
That Kwon Jiwoon doesn’t have to cry because he’s left alone.
With that being said, it’s … I think going back in time has a meaning.

***
For a while, the Hunter World was in a uproar due to the incident of Kwon Jiwoon’s guild that happened right after the Otherworld Gate.
A few days passed.
It was around the time when the enthusiasm of the special news and expert-invited case analysis broadcasts that were held every evening was also waning.
I was faced with one hardship.
“Kwon Rieul-ssi, please come forward.”
“Ah, yes … yes!”
Ah. My left arm and left leg came forward at the same time.
Click, click, click! As soon as I climbed onto the podium with a creaking step, the camera flash quickly exploded along with the sound of applause.
A middle-aged man with a gentle impression said something, but I couldn’t hear it well because I was nervous. That must have been a good word.
After receiving the square award that was pushed out in front of me, I was baptized again with photos.
“This concludes the 19th Hunter’s Night Commendation Ceremony.”
It’s been a while since I’ve worn a suit, and I felt uncomfortable every time I moved. I came down the podium after greeting the audience with an awkward gesture.
It’s over…
In the front row, Kwon Jiwoon smiled and waved his hand. My eyes naturally turned to him. With a shy expression on my face, I hurriedly took a seat next to Kwon Jiwoon.
As to how this happened….
After Kwon Jiwoon woke up within the barrier that day, I went back to the store once to check Ash’s condition, but soon I headed back to the White Silver Guild.
And I talked a lot with Kwon Jiwoon.
There’s a lot of stories, really.
Kwon Jiwoon explained that in order to protect me, he had no choice but to keep a distance.
When I told him that I thought my brother hated me, he was startled and denied it.
“Every time, you told me not to show interest in Hunters and just be a normal person.”“That’s …  Hunters are ruthless and selfish, and fraudulent methods targeting the family of high-ranking Hunters are rampant.”“I wish you had told me that.”“But … yeah, it must have felt that way to you. I’m sorry.”
I wanted to complain a little more, but when I heard his worrds, all my anger vanished and I had a hard time pretending not to cry.
“Then, Rieul-ah. I’ve heard that you’ve awakened, but … what happened then?”“That’s …. so … first of all, my class is a Cafe Owner.”“Ah, yes. That’s right.”
For a moment, I thought he was going to give me an unexpectedly normal reaction.
“I heard that your business is going well these days. The coffee you make is delicious, so it will continue to do well in the future.”
It’s definitely a good word, but somehow it feels like it’s missing the point. It’s an ambiguous reaction that seems to contain no soul.
I felt like I’m having a deja vu. Specifically, it made me remember the time when I revealed my Hunter Class to Ki Yoohyun
Kwon Jiwoon seems to have taken my words as a job introduction.
No, why would I suddenly bring up my job?
I wish I could get rid of the stereotypes about Hunter Class. Someone in the world might have a class called Cafe Owner besides me, right? If there is no Cafe Owner, at least there is a Restaurant Owner. Maybe.
“It’s not that, my Hunter Class is the owner of cafe. I’m an F-class Cafe Owner.”“Oh? Ah, yes … what?”
I roughly recounted what had happened so far, except for the fact that I had regressed.
I couldn’t tell him the regression part because of the limitations of the system, and even though it had already happened, I didn’t want him to be saddened by the fact that I died once.
Since I omitted the part about the involvement of the saintess and the system, it turned out to be quite a bizarre story.
“Well, roughly … that’s what happened.”
It’s good to have an open conversation with Kwon Jiwoon.
It is difficult to maintain a serious atmosphere with family members for a long time. Should I say that my cheeks are itchy? It feels awkward and embarrassing. I was trying to bring up another topic, but Kwon Jiwoon suddenly opened his mouth.
“If that’s what happened, you should be rewarded.”

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c84:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

After Kwon Jiwoon awakened a long time ago, we have been on a poor relationship, but there has been no more bad feelings.
Although his way of expression was bad, Kwon Jiwoon may also have been concerned about me.
My parents died when I was a child and I couldn’t even remember them. After that, my grandmother passed away, and my uncle disappeared. Kwon Jiwoon is the only family I have left.
What should I do if he’s in danger because of my regression?
Maybe I shouldn’t have come back, I shouldn’t have survived. If it was going to be like this, I should have died the way I was then.

No … It’s too early to think like this.
I looked at the flashing system window once again. Then, I reached for the translucent membrane in front of me.
I felt like my mind was being sucked into something, and darkness enveloped my vision. Soon everything became distant and I didn’t even know where I was.
And….
“Blech, blargh ugh, ugh……!”
I couldn’t stand the disgust and vomited.
***
A black space.
After a while, a whitish light shone, and a different space appeared in front of me.
This is … this is our store? 
No, the interior is a little different. There are no noisy cat and slime in sight, and there are no unusual signs on the outside.
Above all, there’s a voice from a distance.

“Rieul-ah, can you give me one more?”“Eung. I ate it all.”

Ah. When my grandmother was alive, Cafe Rieul was still my grandmother’s cafe.
Inside the counter, my grandmother was knitting, and I, in my school uniform, was sitting crookedly and playing games on my phone. An empty store. There are no other customers.
Judging from the level of the character on the phone screen, it’s when I was about 16 years old.
At this time, I often came to see my grandmother after school. It was before I met Choi Yichan and Shin Mira, and there was no one when I went home anyway.

“Rieul-ah, that must be fun.”“Eung. It’s just so-so.”
I answered with a sullen expression and tapped the draw button on the screen. I frowned at the bad result.
“How is Jiwoon doing these days?”“I don’t know. Don’t even bring up Kwon Jiwoon’s story to me. He’ll do it on his own, you know.”“Are you not on good terms with Jiwoon?”
I pouted my lips with a complicated expression. I was upset, but it was hard to be honest. The ensuing words were hand-made tell-tale fights.
“It’s more like … Kwon Jiwoon has awakened, he told me first…….”
Bang! Before I even finished speaking, the door opened with a loud noise.
“Aaaah! I was surprised. What’s going on all of a sudden … huh?”
Kwon Jiwoon, who still looks like a student, was standing in front of the door.
“Kwon Rieul, have you been here?”“Why? It’s up to me whether I come to Grandma’s house or not. What does Oppa have to do with it?”“Haa….”

Young Kwon Jiwoon was still clumsy in hiding his expressions, so his emotions were revealed on his face.
Rough anxiety, and the relief that came to him the moment he found me.
Why didn’t I notice it back then?
A few scenes flowed in front of me as if they were fast-forwarding.
A man who tried to kidnap me for the purpose of intimidation.
Kwon Jiwoon, who’s deliberately trying to distance himself from me.
He tried to call me several times on that topic, but in the end he could not make the call and put down the phone.
Darkness covered my body again, and then there was silence.
This time, Kwon Jiwoon was in front of me.
It seems to be in the future rather than the present, but I don’t know exactly when. This is because the surrounding landscape was not clearly visible.
Kwon Jiwoon was expressionless. The dry eyes stunningly slanted down and directed toward the floor.
Is there something on the floor? I couldn’t see the floor because my vision was not free.

“The Light of Healing….”
A white light appeared from his fingertips along with the trembling voice. The light that should have been absorbed by the cast target was not absorbed and floated in the air.
Once again.
Again, again, and again…….
However, ‘Light of Healing‘ still doesn’t work properly. Kwon Jiwoon’s hands, which had been repeating his skill for a long time, fell down.
Kwon Jiwoon’s expressionless face cracked. The deep emotion that pours through the gap … ah. It’s despair.
“Why this doesn’t work……?”
“It’s strange. It’s a skill that I’ve used hundreds or thousands of times, so there’s no way it won’t work. Please … again, I need to try again.”
The result is the same.
“Please, wake up … I came here late, are you mad at me for making you wait? Stop being angry and open your eyes, okay?”
“Hunter Kwon Jiwoon, calm … calm down.”
“Wake up. Wake up, please!”
“She was too close to the rift, we didn’t have the time to handle it. By the time we rescued her, she was already … I’m sorry.”

Tears welled up. The tears quickly burst into tears. A violent cry that makes even the listener becomes sorrowful.
Wait, no way this is….
That’s absurd. I went back to three years ago, so this shouldn’t have happened.
My vision shifted slightly downward.
Although the face was invisible, the droopy limbs and the clothes that person wore were strangely familiar.
Kwon Jiwoon bursts into tears with a distorted face and recites.

“I, your brother is here, so please open your eyes. Wake up. Kwon Rieul….!”

It’s dark again.
I could feel my mind being dragged back to somewhere.
“Uhgh….”
I was nauseous.
There is no end to the darkness. Even though I couldn’t even recognize my body, the disgust felt amazingly clear.
It’s painful.
Since I’ve returned, surely this must be a time that doesn’t exist.
It can’t be true. There’s no way that there’s a future where I die and Kwon Jiwoon is left alone.
He was worried about me, so he purposely kept his distance, and I can even count the number of times we’ve talked properly to each other.
To be left alone while I’m being full of joy and happiness here … that’s too cruel.
“Lies…..”
【That’s right, that’s a lie.】
“……!”
Light suddenly poured out of the infinite darkness. The blonde saintess was standing there.
There was a more pressing question than what happened or why she was here. I shouted at her.
“Really? It’s all lies?”
【Sure. This world does not adopt multiverse.】
“…….”
【When you turn back time, everything is a time that does not exist, and it’s a possibility that won’t come true. It’s just a lie I made up.】
“Really?”
【Rest assured. I’m serious.】
I was relieved at first.
Then, I got angry.
If it’s a complete lie, why did you surprise me by showing this?
【I feel like you are regretting your return. By turning back time, you have already saved your family.】
It didn’t comfort me at all.
“Saintess….”
【Saintess?】
It’s long to say that it’s a saintess character who appeared in the beginning of a fantasy RPG game and said meaningful things to the novice protagonist.
【You still say funny things.】
“What happened? Is Kwon Jiwoon safe?”
【Do not worry. When you open your eyes, he will return too. It would be difficult if he died here, so I had to use some rough means since I was in a hurry.】
I was relieved at first, but….
There was something on my mind about what she said.
So far, I’ve met this saintess three times in total.
One time, when I tried to save the corrupted Long-tailed Phoenix today. 
Next, it’s right now.
One last time……
It was before I came back to the past, it was when I faced death in the last life.
***
After being killed by a monster, my vision was all covered in darkness.
Suddenly, a blonde saintess appeared out of nowhere and talked to me.
【This is a big deal. I would be in trouble if you died here.】
“Uh, huh?”
【It would be inconvenient to talk about it in this situation. Now, come here.】
A hazy light poured down and the surroundings changed completely. Blue sky and the gentle wind, the lawn was unrealistic.
I, who just got hit by a monster, mumbled in bewilderment.
“No way, is this heaven?”
Is this the beautiful afterlife, where I died after working every day? Post-labor beautiful post-life life?
【Unfortunately, that is not the case. You are not dead yet.】
“What … really?”
I could see the phantasmagoria along with the pain, and I was convinced that my life was over.
【Accurately, at the moment of death, causality was cut off and this time axis was wound up on an independent loop.】
“Uh, huh … I see!”
I don’t know what that means, but I nodded for now.
【Do you understand?】
“Uhm, no, not at all.”
The saintess with shiny blonde hair burst into a cheerful laugh and spoke again.
【I am trying to save you.】
“Why?”
I looked at the saintess with suspicious eyes.
I knew intuitively that she was a transcendent being. Anyone would notice if they died and suddenly a woman in a white dress with shiny blonde hair pops out.
However, there are not only a couple of people who accidentally get caught up in a rift and die an unfortunate death. Why is this saintess trying to save me?
An iron rule for single-person households in the city. You need to see something that sounds too good with suspicion.
【Because I have to.】
Gently, the saintess smiled. She apparently avoided answering.
【However, due to the limitations of causality, I can only intervene with the Awakeneds. So, I will let you live on the condition that you become an Awakened.】
“…..”
Of course, it’s better to live than to die.
However, I still can’t believe I’m dead, and awakening was too unrealistic.
【I will give you the power you desire. Is there any awakening ability you want?】
I have a very consistent personality. The memory of this day was erased, but my actions were consistent even then.
“Ability? I don’t have any….”
Moreover, I was in a state of mental exhaustion due to long overtime work.
“I just want to sleep a lot.”
【That is not an ability.】
At that time, I suddenly remembered the contents of a game I had worked hard on a long time ago. Yeah, there were times when I thought I wanted to live a life like that game.
“Then … cafe? I want to open a cafe.”
【Cafe. You’re an Eligibe person after a long time …. it’s not a common opportunity. You can be a great hero if you want to.】
“No, I’m not interested in that.”
【Swordsman, wizard, no, any class can give you the ability to aim for the top of the world.】
“The position I want is an innkeeper who sees off the main character in the village for beginners in RPG games.”
【You are telling a very interesting story … Yes, if that’s what your wish is.】
***
…….
…….
The darkness enveloped me again and when I opened my eyes, I came back to three years ago, on my bed.
I had completely forgotten this memory.
How could the memory have been erased so neatly?
I awakened through a psychological test on TV and opened a cafe as promised, but….
‘There have been so many unexpected incidents.’
I looked at the saintess, who was emitting a twinkling light alone in the darkness. She was smiling as lively as that day.
“What do you want from me?”
[Next]
