SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c42:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

Yesterday, after handing me the pendant, Grandma went back to the hospital.
Ki Yoohyun also said he need to go because he has something to do.
“Do you have something to do? Now?”
“Yes, I have an urgent business to take care of.”

The eyes that said that were sharp, without even the slightest smile. ‘Take care of‘ doesn’t seem to be something like going to the post office or bank transfer.
Still, both of us stayed up all night. Are you not tired? People need to sleep on time.
I urged him out of pity.
“Would you like to have some coffee at the store?”
“I really want to, but I can’t. I’ll stop by next time.”
Umh, then there’s nothing I can do about that.
By the time I left Ki Yoohyun and returned to the store, it was almost noon.
I stayed up all night, but I wasn’t tired thanks to the high-quality potion Ki Yoohyun gave me. With the joy of finally getting a dark etheric item, my steps were rather light.
“I’m here.”
First of all, I have to feed Mieum and Lime, then contact Choi Yichan and hand him the pendant.
“Did you take good care of the house?”
However, I couldn’t hear Mieum and Lime’s answers.
… Don’t tell me!
I checked the floor first. However, the floor is still clean. Fortunately, they didn’t make a mess of the store with the footprint stamp like last time.
So … where and what are they doing?
“Mieum-ah? Lime-ah? What’s wrong, are you still sleeping?”
Oh, there she is.
“….meooong.”
Suddenly, Mieum appeared from the corner.
But instead of coming close immediately, she swung her paw strangely from afar.
“Huh? What?”
“Meooong….”
I can’t hear you.
“What is it? Mieum-ah, why don’t you come here and tell me?”
The answer came from someone other than Mieum.
“You’re coming quickly.”
“A-aargh!”
I was startled by the cold voice that suddenly interrupted me.
The person, who was sitting in a chair, got up. The action caused Lime, who was on his lap, cried and bounced to the floor.
The owner of the voice was Kwon Jiwoon.
Whoa, I was surprised. I thought he was a thief. Why the hell is Kwon Jiwoon here at this hour?
“Kiyaoong (Where have you been! That man came all of a sudden this morning)!”
Perhaps a lot of complaints were piled up, Mieum threw her front paws at me.
According to Mieum, Kwon Jiwoon suddenly came this morning. What’s more, he has been waiting all this time knowing I’m not here. Without a word, staying still.
It’s a very worrying situation for Mieum, who wants to run around to her heart’s content.
“Waeoooooong (It’s irresponsible to leave us alone with that human)!”
“I had a reason, too.”
I asked Kwon Jiwoon while patting Mieum’s chin gently.
“What happened all of a sudden? Aren’t you busy?”
No matter how much I thought about it, there was nothing for Kwon Jiwoon to suddenly come to see me.
Why did you wait for me here for hours when you must be busy with guild work?
“…..”
“…..”
Flinch. His eyes shook. Kwon Jiwoon did not answer for a moment with a stiff expression.
I waited patiently for his words. The words that came out after a long time were unexpected.
“I’m just here to give this back.”
Tak.
Kwon Jiwoon put a stainless steel thermos on the table.
Ah. I put Americano in that thermos last time. I completely forgot about it.
But … it’s not something that needs to be delivered directly. We’re cousins, but we don’t see each other often.
“You can ask someone else to do it.”
“Kkyuu…”
Is it because of the mood? Lime’s nonsensical cry sounded like it was reprimanding me.
“Or just leave it there.”
“Waeooong….”
This time, Mieum glared at me.
No, why, what. Why are you looking at me with an expression that I said something senseless? Did I say something weird?
“Meooong (No, you’re screwed up).”
I felt weird being treated like this by a cat.
He’s come all the way here, so I can’t tell him to leave right away. Above all, as if pushed by the silent pressure from Mieum and Lime, I offered him coffee.
“Umh, now that you’re here, would you like to have a cup of coffee?”
I just said it. I asked once out of courtesy.
Of course, I thought Kwon Jiwoon would refuse. Even when I gave him coffee in that thermos before, he didn’t welcome it.
“Yes, shall we?”
“Huh … aren’t you busy with the guild?”
“I’m not always that busy.”
Well, then.
After that, I decided to make the quest menu, vanilla latte and caramel macchiato. I took out the vanilla powder and caramel syrup I bought from the Dimensional Shop.
The vanilla latte was made in a similar way to the cafe latte. First, put vanilla powder in a glass, then pour espresso to dissolve it well. Next, pour the steamed milk with soft foam into the glass and it’s done.
[Item: Vanilla Latte (★★★☆☆)Status: Good (Time Remaining: 00:30:00)Effect: When using a skill, there is a 100% chance of a critical hit for 1 time.]
The caramel macchiato was also not difficult, but the order of putting it into the glass was different. Put the caramel syrup in a glass and pour the steamed milk first. Next, when the espresso is poured, the surface of the drink is marked with brown dots.
Finally, it was completed by sprinkling caramel drizzle in the shape of a honeycomb.
[Item: Caramel Macchiato (★★★☆☆)Status: Good (Time Remaining: 00:30:00)Removes a random status abnormality.]
Both glasses have a pretty good effect.
I left the vanilla latte for myself, and handed the caramel macchiato to Kwon Jiwoon.
“….”
“….”
Gulp.
The moment the other person takes a sip of my coffee….
This moment is always tense. Especially, it’s Kwon Jiwoon. Maybe it’s because we feel distant even though we’re cousin.
Kwon Jiwoon, who drank the caramel macchiato, was quiet for a while. He just gently stroked the cup with his fingertips. His expression is also cold, his usual expressionless face, so I have no idea what he is thinking.
“….Strange.”
“Uh, wh-what?”
Unknowingly, I was nervous at the low voice.
“It seems that every time I drink the coffee you give me, I feel better. My potion addiction is finally gone.”
“Ahaha, it must be a coincidence.”
I laughed without realizing it. I was happy to know that the coffee I made was working properly.
The bar of light that appeared above his head slowly fills up. There was no ‘you made a deep connection with coffee‘ notification, but I was happy nonetheless.
“….Kwon Rieul.”
“Uh, huh?”
“I told you to move the cafe to the first floor of our guild before.”
… Gulp.
“Let’s forget about it.”
“I don’t want to move … uh? Really?”
“You followed our grandmother well, so it may be natural that this happened.”
Was it an illusion that those small muffled words sounded bitter?
“Good luck.”
After leaving those words, Kwon Jiwoon went back after drinking all the caramel macchiato.
Admit it … did you get it? Like in a cooking cartoon, you drink a cup of coffee and feel touched, “If it’s you, you can do well here!“, is this that kind of situation?
While I was bewildered, a system notification popped up.
[Congratulations! You have completed ‘Main Quest: The Path of The Barista (2)’.Please collect the reward.]
[Main Quest: The Path of The Barista (2)You’re a confident barista now.Increase the sales menu by completing the cafe’s five basic menus (café latte, cappuccino, cafe mocha, vanilla latte, and caramel macchiato).Complete the 5 basic cafe menus: 5/5]
[Rewards: Experience (200 EXP), Random Recipe, ???]
Among the quest completion rewards, ‘???’ was the only item other than experience and recipes. So please, I hope it’s a good thing.
With a pounding heart, I chose to collect the rewards.
[Experience: 200 EXP have been acquired.][You have reached Level 6.][You have acquired the new recipes: ice menus.]
Thud!
Then, a heavy sound pounded the floor.
[The volume of the reward is too large to be received in the inventory.][The reward is automatically generated outside your inventory.]
“Oh….”
In this case, I have no choice but to have expectations.
It doesn’t necessarily mean that something big is always good, but how big is it that it doesn’t even fit in the inventory?
Is it furniture?
Why not, Cafe Management games always have interior decoration elements. I thought it would be nice to put a piece of furniture in the empty space over there.
I checked the reward with excitement….
Hence, this signboard appeared.
“…..earthworm?”
“Waeooong (Earthworm)…..”
“Kkyuuu…..”
The cries of Mieum and Lime felt sad.
A squiggly line was drawn on the signboard. To put it bluntly, I would call it an avant-garde design.
No way, I don’t want to believe it, but …. the name of the cafe is ‘Cafe Rieul‘, so did the shape of the letter ‘ㄹ‘ symbolize it?
…………………………………..
…………………………………..
Well, let’s just put it in the warehouse. There’s no way I have to hang this on the wall.
I was trying to drag the signboard and move it to the warehouse, but the system notification popped up again.
[Special effects are applied when signboard is installed.][Item: Signboard of Cafe Rieul (★★☆☆☆)]Type: SignThe signboard of <Cafe Rieul>. The name of the cafe was completed with a simple yet glamorous, familiar yet unique, classic, and modern touch.Note: It has the effect of attracting customers’ attention when installed. More customers pay attention to the cafe.]
…………………………………..
Is it a crossroads between performance and appearance? It seems that they forced me to choose between an ugly item that performs well or a pretty trash.
I wanted the eye-catching effect of the customer, but I didn’t want to hang a sign like this on the wall.
“When you have a dilemma, there is only one solution.”
“Kyuu?”
“What is it!”
“I’ll put it off for now.”
I put the sign right in the corner. I was going to leave it as it is for a while.
And I checked one more remaining system notification.
[Achievement: ‘Avoiding the Second Death Crisis‘ has been achieved. Please collect the reward.]
When Grandma Kim Deokyi’s workshop caught fire, this notification popped up.
This is the second crisis after the last time, how many times are there? Why do I have to go through a death crisis when I’m just running a cafe?
Aside from this uncomfortable feeling, the reward was ‘Random Skill Point 1‘. In other words, it would mean that it randomly raises a skill level by one. 
I don’t have a good memory with the word random. Before collecting the reward, I checked the skill list. In the meantime, there were also new skills, so there were a total of six skills.
Cafe in My Hand (C)Details: (Lv. 1) When making drinks in the store, the level of perfection is increased.The Floor is Shiny (E)Details: (Lv. 1) You can quickly clean the toilets.Smile (C)Details: (Lv. 1) Smiling makes you feel better.[The Barista’s Extraction (D)Details: (Lv.2) Extract only the desired substance from the mixed substances.][The Barista’s Eyes (D)Details: (Lv.1) You can find the ingredients.][The Bond of a Cup of Coffee (B)Details: (Lv.1) You can copy the skill of the person who drank the Ultimate Coffee.
Well, among these, the level goes up randomly.
It’s fine as long as it’s not ‘Smile‘ and ‘The Floor is Shiny‘. The other four skills seemed to be useful if they were leveled up.
Four out of six. The probability is about 66%. That’s a pretty high probability.
‘Collect reward.’
Was it a problem to have such expectations?
The result, which appeared with the sound of ‘Tiling‘, was far beyond expectations.
[You have acquired 1 Random Skill Point.][The Floor is Shiny (E) level has risen to 2.]
The Floor is Shiny (E)Details: (Lv. 2) You can quickly clean the floor.]
………………………………………………..
Ugh, you’re a terrible desire sensor….
[Next]

and I changed the wording of The Floor is Shiny’s skill details, I’ll edit the details in the previous chapters when I’m not lazy.

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c41:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

“Grandma, are you awake?”
“Uh.….”
It was at dawn when Grandma, Kim Deokyi, opened her eyes.
It was fortunate that Ki Yoohyun had a potion and we were able to treat the wound in the abdomen immediately. After that, she was admitted to the hospital where the rest of the wounds were treated.

The doctor said it would have been dangerous if it was a little late because she was old and the cut was not good.
“Sir, why can’t Grandma wake up? Don’t tell me … are there any other abnormalities?”
Even though all the trauma was treated, Grandma was still unconscious.
The explanation given by the tired doctor as he rummaged through the charts was not very reassuring.
“Because she’s old … she had a lot of shocks on her body. I think we have to wait a little longer.”
“Yes….”
Before moving to the hospital, we immediately reported the incident to the police, but neither the assailant who stabbed Grandma nor the arsonist could be caught.
I remembered the man I ran into at the entrance to the workshop. I remembered the strangely hurried footsteps of a man who wore his hat tightly. It was clear that he was the culprit.
‘I think I’ve seen that person somewhere….’
His face was covered by the hat, but his body shape and jawline were somehow familiar.
It would have been helpful if I looked more closely. I felt sorry for it was regrettable.
There was nothing I could do now. Still, didn’t want to go back, leaving Grandma alone, so I decided to stay at the hospital.
Ki Yoohyun also remained in the hospital room.
Oh, come to think of it, I couldn’t even say thank you due to the hecticness.. If he hadn’t come on time, I would have been really in danger.
“Yoohyun-ssi, you saved my life. Thank you.”
“Rieul-ssi.”
“Yes?”
He, who was standing next to me, came closer to me.
Without realizing it, I took a step back.
One more step forward.
I took another step back, too.
Ki Yoohyun asked as I continued to step back with a gap of two steps.
“What’s wrong?”
“That … it’s just….”
I know it looks weird, but I couldn’t bear to see his face up close. This is because I have not yet developed immunity to that sparkling face.
Especially when he ran into the entrance of the burning workshop, he almost looked like a savior.
Ugh, it’s blinding.
“So … anyway, just go ahead.”
“…..Ha.”
Ki Yoohyun gave up on approaching me and pointed to my hand instead.
“I hope you get treatment.”
“……Ah.”
I looked into my palm. I was injured while trying to escape with Grandma. It’s a little bit hurt, but not severe.
“This is okay, I can apply medicine later.”
Ki Yoohyun frowned slightly as if he didn’t like my answer.
“……I’m sorry.”
“Yes? What?”
No matter how much I thought about it, I couldn’t think of anything for him to apologize to me. However, Ki Yoohyun looked very distressed.
“I was complacent. I shouldn’t have let Rieul-ssi go alone … I was careless because I thought there was still time left. The future can change as much as it wants.”
I’m not sure what he’s talking about….
He said he’s sorry for putting me in danger alone … but how can Ki Yoohyun predict that an arsonist would appear in Grandma Kim Deokyi’s workshop today? Yeah, even as a regressor, I didn’t know that.
Ki Yoohyun, who was looking at me with an apologetic expression, took a bottle from his inventory and sprinkled what was inside on my hand.
“Uwah, it’s cold …. Oh?”
“Don’t be surprised. It’s a potion.”
As soon as the transparent liquid was sprayed on the palm, the wound began to heal. The palm of the hand quickly returned to a state without a scratch. Not only that, but somehow I felt energized and relieved from fatigue.
At that moment, a notification sounded.
[The status has been restored to the maximum by the effect of the Advanced Potion (★★★★☆).]
Just by looking at the name, it looked too expensive to be used for scratches on the palm.
“….Thank you.”
After thanking him awkwardly, there was silence again.
The police came for a while, but they returned after saying that the case would be transferred to to the Dungeon Management Ofice. It’s because the culprit who stabbed Grandma is most likely a Hunter.
Trying to kill such a good person….
They have to be caught and thrown in jail. I swallowed my anger inwardly.
Ki Yoohyun must have felt the same way as me.
“The culprit … will be caught, right?
“They’ll be caught.”
Given that he answered the question with a sense of urgency.
Then, I suddenly remembered Ki Yoohyun’s skill.
If it wasn’t for Ki Yoohyun’s skill, it would have been a very dangerous moment. This is because the fire spread too quickly in the barrel where the arsonist sprayed gasoline.
However, the skill was really mysterious. As soon as the delicate particles of light became dense nets and covered the surroundings, the texture of the air changed.
Is it a magic skill? No, it’s a little more….
“Yoohyun-ssi, the skill you used earlier…..”
The moment I was about to ask what the skill is….
The nurse called us to inform that Grandma woke up. I forgot what I was going to say and rushed to Grandma.
“Grandma, how are you?”
Grandma, who only blinked for a while, opened her lips. A faint trembling voice came out.
“….What happened?”
“I went to the workshop today and you collapsed, so I took you to the hospital.”
“The workshop … Ah!”
Grandma jumped to her feet.
It was such a strong force that it was hard to believe that she’s an injured person. In her eyes, a fiery spark flashed. She seems to have remembered what had happened.
“Lie down more. You still need to rest.”
“What happened to the workshop?”
“It’s …. there was a fire, but it is now extinguished … Grandma?!”
Before I could finish speaking, Grandma got up from the bed and left the hospital room.
There was no time to stop her because she was so fast.
“Wait, Grandma, let’s go together!”
Ki Yoohyun and I chased after her in a hurry.
***
The eastern sky is bright in the twilight.
Arriving at the entrance of the workshop, Grandma collapsed.
“Ah, unbelievable….!”
The workshop building was a mess. Numerous items were broken or burned. The black soot showed how terrible the fire that hit this place was.
Ki Yoohyun approached the grieving old lady quietly.
“I’m sorry. I put out the fire, but I couldn’t save the workshop.”
“….No, that’s enough. I wouldn’t have survived without you.”
“Is there anyone you think is the culprit?”
“The culprit … well, he’s … oh, no way!”
Grandma, who jumped up again, headed inside the burned workshop. She opened the soot-blackened door and entered the small room next to it.
There was no sign of fire, but the inside was a mess.
The shelf collapsed and items were spilling onto the floor. Grandma picked up one of the broken glass bottles and let out a sigh.
“Oh my god….”
The broken glass bottle was empty.
“Grandma, what’s wrong?”
“This is a bottle of dark ether that I kept.”
“What?”
The same was true of other glass bottles. I looked at the floor, but nothing was intact.
“Now there is no dark ether left. To get a new one … I don’t know how long it will take … I’m sorry.”
It was a heavy voice.
“……”
On the day of the first snow, a dungeon that killed Choi Yichan will occur.
Even if I tried to save the dark ether from now on, there was a high possibility that I would not be able to make it in time.
Then again, just like in the past….
My eyes darkened.
As I stepped on the floor with a sigh, I suddenly remembered the hand mirror I found in the space.
Come to think of it, I haven’t been able to return it yet. It’s a pity it’s broken, but wouldn’t she feel a bit better if she received this?
I rummaged through my inventory, pulled out a hand mirror, and held it out to Grandma.
“I found the mirror that Grandma described. I’m sorry. It’s broken, but please take this.”
“……broken?”
“Yes, I touched it and it cracked.”
“……!”
Grandma took the hand mirror with a surprised expression. She then looked carefully at the broken marks.
“This mirror is an artifact modeled after The Mirror of Nitocris. Unless its effectiveness is exhausted, it is something that cannot be broken by human power.”
“…..Huh?”
It just broke…..? It cracked the moment I touched it, really lightly.
Maybe I have a hidden power too? Am I the one who is secretly strong?
I was drowning in vain thoughts.
“Wait, since it’s broken….!”
At that moment, Grandma, who remembered something, turned the broken piece of the mirror upside down.
Slurp.
An amorphous black lump came out from the back of the mirror.
What on earth is this?
The lump was the size of a little fingernail, and the texture was like a sticky liquid or a gas. When she put it in the bottle, it gave off a strange blinking light.
As I stared with curious mind, Grandma said.
“This is dark ether.”
It’s the dark ether.
It was my first time seeing it in person, so I couldn’t realize it well.
“I’d rather be glad it was broken. It took a small amount of dark ether to process this mirror. It’s a small amount, but if I reprocess this, I think I can make one item.”
“Yes? However … this is the mirror Grandma was looking for.”
“It’s all right. After all, it’s something that has been used. It would be more meaningful to help Miss Rieul.”
Having said that, Grandma got up. She started looking for tools to craft items in the messy workshop. Unlike before, Grandma’s face was full of vitality.
“Wait a minute.”
I told her to go back to the hospital, but she didn’t listen at all. Reluctantly, I left Grandma, who engrossed in her work, and came out into the workshop’s front yard.
It’s been about an hour.
“Take this.”
Grandma came out of the door and handed me something.
It was a pendant made by reprocessing the broken hand mirror. At the end of the thin chain was a small water drop-shaped stone. A strange light seemed to twinkle within the black stone.
Immediately, the status window of the item appeared.
[Black Pendant (★★☆☆☆)A common design, but used as a token of friendship.Type: AccessoriesNote: Dark etheric attributed.]
There was no special effect, but it was clearly written as ‘dark‘.
“…..Thank you!”
I finally found it.
With this…..
“You said you needed it to save a friend.”
“Yes.”
Grandma said with a soft smile.
“I hope I can be of help.”
Her smile, as if reminiscent of someone who was not here, seemed somewhat affectionate.
***
The day after I got the pendant.
“Haa….”
“Rieul-ah, how about putting it on like this?”
“Is it horizontal? Umh, I think it’s a little crooked … If I do this, this side is tilted. I will try again.”
Choi Yichan was looking at the store sign on the wall.
It was a weight that was difficult for me to lift with both hands, but Choi Yichan held it lightly with one hand. He looked around and positioned it carefully.
“Is this okay? … Uh, what’s with your expression?”
“Huh? Oh, no. Nothing.”
Choi Yichan looked at me worriedly.
“What’s the matter?”
“No … Yichan-ah, do you think about the sign? Does it look okay?”
“Eh? Yes! It’s very cool and sophisticated.”
“….really?”
“I don’t know much about this, but …. it’s so pretty!”
There is no lie on his beaming face. Choi Yichan’s positive response was a bit tempting.
“It’s a picture of a worm, right? It’s unique.”
“….”
“Uh, wrong? Then … is it a snake?”
“….”
“Mieum, can’t you change this sign?”
Mieum answered my whisper in a conceited tone.
“Kiyaooong (That’s why you should have put my name on it)!”
“Mieum knows all the difficult words.”
“Waeoong (Ahem)!”
“Ha…..”
On this sunny day, the reason I sighed when I saw a signboard that isn’t clear whether it was an earthworm or a snake, goes back to yesterday.

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c40:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

She also had torn cuts and bruises on her head.
My heart was pounding. It’s not just a fall or an accidental wound. Someone attacked Grandma. The moment I saw the wounds, I intuitively noticed it.
‘Don’t tell me, that guy before….’

Drip, drip, drip. The blood soaked the floor.
First, I had to take Grandma to the hospital. I didn’t have much time.
“Grandma, I’m calling an ambulance now….”
“Hurry … run away….”
“Yes?”
Grandma licked her dry lips. I couldn’t hear her well because her voice was so thin and she’s trembling.
“Please don’t speak more. The wound could open. Hold on to me!”
After raising Grandma up, I was about to go outside, but all of sudden, an acrid smell spread.
“….Uh?”
Tap.
A lit paper flew in from the outside.
Unbeknownst to me, gasoline was sprinkled on the floor. The embers quickly grew, and the fire burned objects in the workshop, blocking the exit in an instant.
Someone set the fire.
My heart was pounding even harder. In an instant, The fire blazed high so quickly and smoke began to come inside.
If we didn’t get out quickly, we could suffocate like this.
“……Ugh!”
I tried to get close to put out the fire, but I had no choice but to retreat from the scorching heat.
This time, I took water from a bucket and poured it on the fire. It seemed to die down for a moment, but then it started to burn more intensely.
What should I do?
There is no time to spare. I thought it would be better for me to take the water on my back and carry Grandma out.
“Grandma, wait a minute!”
I took the tap water from the bucket again and poured it over my head. Even the cold sensation is soon wiped out by the heat.
“….”
The fire grew stronger.
It was the moment when I felt my head dizzy from the heat and the acrid smell…..
The texture of the air seemed to have descended heavily.
I’m definitely standing in the same place, but it feels like a completely different space from before.
Then, a wide net of light spread over my head.
I’ve seen this kind of net somewhere. Where was it….
Right, it was when I went to the tutorial dungeon with Ki Yoohyun.
The scene that followed was incredibly mysterious. It was unbelievable even though I witnessed it with naked eyes. Fine particles of light from the air formed a net and landed on the flames, and the fire disappeared in an instant.
It could only be described as completely gone.
The red flames, the acrid smoke, and the heat that heated my cheeks. After the net was lifted, they ceased to exist as if they had not been there from the beginning. Only the remaining soot reminded me of the existence of the fire.
[Achievement: Avoiding the Second Death CrisisCongratulations.You safely escaped the danger of death.Let’s value life.Reward: Random Skill Point 1]
Almost at the same time as the annoying system notification pops up.
“Rieul-ssi!”
It was Ki Yoohyun who ran into the blackened and collapsed entrance.
He slumped down after his black eyes found me, gave off a light of relief.
I’m alive now.
The moment I saw him, I was so happy that I felt like crying.
“What happened? Are you okay?”
The fire was extinguished, but Grandma was still unconscious. I held back my tears and spoke.
“Yoohyun-ssi, Grandma…..”
***
He failed.
He failed again.
Jijon forced his trembling legs to move.
He could see a workshop engulfed in flames from a distance. His fear grew bigger, and now his whole body began to tremble like an aspen. It seemed as if the flames behind his back were chasing him.
Jijon, who ran to a place where the fire was hidden by the darkness, collapsed. He recited as he touched the ground with his weak hands.
“It’s not me….”
He didn’t do it.
He didn’t kill the old lady.
But who will believe him? The old lady is already….
“Ri-right! Report … report….”
Jijon tried to take his phone out of his pocket. However, his fingertips trembled and did not move properly.
“I didn’t do it….”
No one hears the low murmur.
In return for letting him join C&L Corporation, CEO Lee Sein put forward one condition. It was to get a ring with a red stone from a certain Hunter.
She said it would be okay to spend any amount of money. Not only that, she even said that illegal means can be used if necessary.
At first, Jijon thought it was an easy job. The Hunter World is a world of the law of the jungle. Even if Jijon forcibly takes the ring away from the opponent, the weaker side is at fault.
However, when he found out that the opponent was an old lady, he was greatly perplexed.
She was a small, skinny grandmother who would collapse at the stroke of his fist.
He was a supreme man who would do anything to succeed as a hunter, but he wasn’t vicious enough to threaten an old lady with force.
“I know who sent you.”
The old lady was not surprised to see Jijon holding a sword. Rather, she served hot barley tea and said in a calm voice.
“The ring you’re looking for has already been delivered to the right owner.”
“Ugh … the right owner is none of my business! Give me the ring!”
“That is impossible. Instead, I’ll give you one of the items here, so can you step down?”
“Who do you think came to get these junk items?”
“All of them are made by me, Kim Deokyi.”
“Hmmm, hmm! Then show me … well, if it’s a decent item, I can accept it!”
He couldn’t scare the old lady, so he tried to step down after getting a suitable item.
Whoosh!
Then, suddenly, a mysterious man appeared from behind and swung a knife.
An unpleasant sound was heard. The knife stabbed the old lady’s stomach in an instant, and the assailant ran away immediately. Jijon was startled, unable to breathe.
“Grandma, are you okay? Wa-wait, hold on a second. I … damn, you bastard!”
Thinking that he had to catch the criminal, Jijon hurriedly ran out the door.
The assailant had already disappeared, but as a C-class Hunter, he should be able to catch up. Such a vicious bastard could not be forgiven.
However, as he left the main gate of the workshop and chased after the mysterious assailant, the fire that flew from somewhere lit up.
“O-oh, no…..”
The fire spread quickly and blocked the entrance to the workshop.
The moment he saw that sight, he was filled with fear.
The assailant had already disappeared, and he was the only one left.
At this rate, he will be accused of being the culprit. It can’t happen. This time he succeeded in trying to become a successful hunter. He cannot be framed for murder.
Jijon was driven by fear and fled from the workshop.
Still, in the end, his conscience caught his feet. Every time he thought of the old lady’s palce face, his steps became heavy, and he eventually collapsed on the ground.
Jijon gasped for his breath and murmured.
He’s the supreme. In order to become the supreme leader of the Hunter World, he gave up his common real name and took this name.
However, it is impossible to run away just because he’s afraid of being framed.
He could barely hold the phone in his hand. Jijon struggled to suppress his shaking and entered the number on the screen. The sweat drips down like rain, and his fingers slide.
“Ugh, 1, 1, 9….”
It was just then.
Pukh!
“Aaargh!”
A person on the other side of the alley stepped on Jijon’s hand, who was holding the phone, with his foot. He was so strong, even with the power status of a C-class Hunter, Jijon couldn’t shake his hand.
Krak!
The phone screen shattered on the heel. His face, terrified and in pain, was reflected on the black screen. The bones of his right hand appear to have been broken. Jijon carefully raised his head, wrapping his right hand that had been trampled on the heel of his shoe.
In front of him, an unexpected figure was looking down at him.
“You’re….”
It was the secretary who guided him when he met Lee Sein, the CEO of C&L Corporation. A very beautiful secretary, but with an atmosphere of ambiguous age and gender.
His name is Aeon.
Wait, did he have a face like this? Was he this creepy?
Jijon met the secretary’s eyes and was frightened. The eyes with a strange light seemed not to be human eyes. It was strange, as if it had been embedded with bluish imitation jewels.
Before he knew it, goosebumps appeared on the back of his neck.
Then, the secretary smiled slightly and moved his lips. The tone was soft, but the cold, subdued voice felt intimidating.
“It’s disappointing.”
“Y-Yes….?”
“The CEO will be very disappointed, too. We can’t believe you can’t do such a simple thing right. How would the CEO, who believed in Hunter Jijon, feel about this failure?”
“Don’t tell me … no way, you ki-killed the old la-lady.”
The hardened tongue did not move straight.
“Don’t worry. Even if Hunter Jijon didn’t do his job properly, I handled it well. I’m glad the weather is sunny. The news said that even a small fire can easily become a big fire because it is dry.”
“But the old lady …. such an old lady, how can you?”
“We explained everything to you. The current No. 1 ranker will betray humanity, and we need that ring to stop him.”
The secretary bent his knees and sat on the ground.
Jijon was startled and tried to step back, but it was quicker for the secretary to step on his hand.
“Argh! Argh!”
The back of his hand, crushed by the heel of his shoe, hurt.
Irrespective of Jijon’s screams, the secretary slowly took out his phone and held it out.
Jijon didn’t know what it meant, so he blinked blankly, and the secretary smiled. It was a creepy smile.
“If Hunter Jijon feels remorse, it’s okay to report it. Yes, because you can’t do anything bad to an old lady.”
… Gulp.
“But do you know this? The knife that stabbed the old woman at the crime scene would be found.”
“That, what….”
“Not long ago, the CEO gifted a weapon to Hunter Jijon. Where’s the knife that Hunter Jijon used to use now?”
Jijon, who understood the secretary’s words, turned pale.
The knife he originally used was disposed of by the Hunter Market, so he entrusted it to this secretary in front of him. His name was written on it.
He clearly saw a strange man who suddenly appeared attacking the old lady. But what if that person was ordered by C&L? What if he used his old weapon as the crime weapon?
Even if he reports it, it means that he is the one who will be accused of being the culprit.
“Ugh, if I say that I was ordered by C&L, it’ll blow it up.….”
“Do you have any evidence?”
“Evidence … there are plenty of them!”
“You didn’t even sign a contract with us.”
“What, what……?”
The secretary continued as if reading a book.
“Hunter Jijon is a person who has nothing to do with our company. However, it is regrettable that we, as a leader in the Hunter industry, did not realize that such a vicious hunter exists. We will do our best to be more careful in recruiting talent for the development of the Hunter industry in the future.”
“…….”
“…..If we do it, it will be over.”
The secretary said abruptly, putting him on the last wedge.
“The Hunter Jijon’s family are all ordinary people.”
“…….”
“You must be very worried. Rifts, monsters, and every other things. It’s a dangerous world. We don’t know where or what’s going to happen.”
“….Hik.”
Tuk. Eventually, Jijon dropped his phone from his hand.
“Don’t worry. The CEO still believes in Hunter Jijon. You’ll do well next time.”
Coldly, the secretary laughed.

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c39:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

“It’s not here.”
“Here, too….”
Returning to the store, I began to search the warehouse for a hand mirror.
As I checked the pile of junk for a long time, Ki Yoohyun’s voice suddenly came to mind.

“Lucky.”
“Aaargh!”
“What’s the matter! Kyaooooo!”
“Kyuuuu!”
“How many times already!”
Next to me, Mieum and Lime criticized me. But the more they did that, the clearer my memory became.
Long eyelashes that created shadows in his face, gently curved lips, white cheeks, and a pair of lively clear eyes. Ki Yoohyun’s face from up close was so destructive. I thought I got a little used to that face because I saw it often, but apparently I wasn’t.
His fingers tickled against my hair….
The time it took to put the hairpin on must have been brief, but it felt like a long time. In the meantime, I couldn’t move my body because I was nervous.
As soon as the finger fell off, a faint smile crossed his lips.
And a voice that gently touched my ear,
“Lucky.”
“Aaaargh!”
“Waeooong! This human, are you going to surprise me again and again?”
As I screamed again, Mieum threw her front paw and punched me.
But … the more I tried to forget, the more the strange word kept floating around in my mind. It seems that the stimulation was too great for me, who did not have the good-looking-immunity. Anyone who hears that kind of voice right in front of their eyes won’t be able to snap out of it.
Besides, what’s lucky? Don’t omit the subject and object!
No, let’s calm down. Perhaps it was a meaningless word. After all, he’s a bit of a weird person.
I struggled to get rid of my thoughts and concentrated on finding the requested item.
The warehouse was very spacious and complex. I cleaned it once last time, but it was impossible to completely organize all these things. It was filled with items from the store that are no longer in use, various miscellaneous items, and my grandmother’s belongings. This was also the place where I found many things I needed, such as the coffee mix and vinyl sheets.
Newspapers and magazines from 10 years ago were also piled up in boxes.
Hmm, there’s news of a famous hunter’s wedding. I used to play this cafe tycoon game … it came out at this time.
Hekh, I almost inadvertently read the magazine. For some reason, If I find a book while cleaning, I always ended up reading it. I put down the magazine and focused on searching again, but I couldn’t even see any hand mirror.
“Cough, cough.”
Furthermore, there was a lot of dust, so I kept coughing.
“Kyaoooo! How long do I have to do this!”
“Kyuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuu!”
Mieum and Lime, who were searching the inside together, protested.
“Until you find it.”
“This is ridiculous! Waeoong!”
“Kyuu!”
I ignored their protest and pointed to a box in the corner.
“There. Take a look inside that box.”
“There is no mirror. Meong…..”
Then, Mieum tried to sneak out of the warehouse.
“Where are you going!”
“Kiyaooo?!”
I grabbed Mieum’s tail. I couldn’t see Lime because it had already escaped. Lime, even you….
I continued to search the warehouse with Mieum, who kept trying to escape, but I couldn’t find a hand mirror.
Meium, who had turned into a ball of gray fur because of the dust, grumbled.
“Those who want to get back things that are years old have no conscience. Just say that the statute of limitations has expired!”
“Umh, but….”
Kim Deokyi said that she would give up if I couldn’t find my grandmother’s hand mirror, but I was concerned about Grandma’s expression.
She had a very sad and lonely expression, like she’s longing for something.
It seems to be a very important item, so I really wanted to find and return it.
But….
“Huk, huu … cough, cough!”
No matter how hard I try to find….
“That slime runs away alone … waeoong!”
The result was zero. I only saw a mountain of junk.
I wonder if it’s not here. When I was exhausted and about to sink to the floor, Lime, who had run away alone, returned and bounced in front of me.
“Kyuuu!”
“Oh, what?”
“Kyu, kyuuu!”
“Wow, did you find the hand mirror?”
“Kyuuu…..”
I have no idea what you mean.
Lime headed out of the warehouse, bouncing up and down as if urging me follow it. There’s no clue left anyway. I quickly followed after Lime.
“Oh, is it here?”
“Kyu!”
The place where Lime took me was the entrance to the space.
Hey, there’s no way it’s here. My grandmother was not an Awakened. Has my grandmother ever been in here?
However, there was no hand mirror in the warehouse or in the other room. The only place left is this space. I thought I should check it out rather than leave a feeling of frustration.
I entered the space. The blue sky, the dazzling sunlight, and the large Yggdrasil tree greeted me. There was a well-grown dungeon sugarcanes on one side and a field of dried coffee fruits on the other.
I looked around, but I couldn’t see anything like a hand mirror. As expected, it’s not her either.
As I was about to hide my discouragement and go out, Lime called me again.
“Kkyu, kkyuu, kkyuuu!”
“Uh, why? What?”
Lime bounced its body, pointing to one corner of this space. The place Lime pointed to was the slope where I rolled last time.
At that time, as I fell off that slope, I got the skill ‘A Bond of a Cup of Coffee‘.
“Are you talking about that place?”
“Kkyuuu!”
It was unlikely that the hand mirror was hidden in the empty ground beneath the slope. Still, as Lime was bouncing its body with a lot of effort, I decided to check the bottom.
I took my steps carefully and went down the slope. Immediately, the animals followed me.
“Slow, human! You’re the reason why I’m walking this slowly!”
“Woah, Mieum is good at coming down slopes. She’s amazing.”
“Ahem!”
“Then you’d be good at climbing up the slope, wouldn’t you?”
“Of course, meow!”
Thud.
Mieum, who ran up the slope again to the end, came to her senses.
“Kiyaoo! Are you teasing me!”
Ah, I got caught.
The bottom of the cliff was empty land, just like the last time when I fell. The ground was covered with grass, and random piles of stones piled up in front of us.
“…..Huh?”
Then I noticed something and was startled.
I didn’t notice it before, but there was a small path in the crevice of the pile of stones. It was a difficult location to find unless you look closely because it was blocked by a stone.
What’s there?
I quickly approached the crevice in the pile of stones.
Inside, there was a bigger space than I expected. There was also a small cabin in a place covered with bushes and not easily visible.
A cabin in a place like this?
Is it a reward from the system? However, even after waiting for a while, the system remained silent.
Fortunately, the door was not locked.
I noticed as soon as I opened the door of the cabin.
This is where my grandmother used to be.
Compared to the old exterior, the inside of the cabin had a cozy atmosphere. There were thick carpets on the floor, curtains on the windows, and even a small table in front of it.
It was all my grandmother’s taste. It was clear that my grandmother had decorated this place.
Still, how did a cabin like this exist in this space? Could it be that my grandmother was an Awakened?
But there was no more time to think about it.
“Human, look at this!”
“Huh? ……Ah.”
Because on the table in the cabin, there was a small hand mirror. From the round shape to the flower-shaped decoration, it looked exactly the same as the mirror that was described by Kim Deokyi.
“This is it!”
I quickly picked up the hand mirror and tried to lift it up. Now….
Crack.
The moment I touched it, the hand mirror cracked.
“Oh, no!”
I hurriedly let go, but it was already too late. The hand mirror was completely shattered then.
“…..”
“…..”
It seemed like a very precious thing, but it broke….
Lime and Mieum approached me, who was in despair.
“Kkyuu….”
“It’s not your fault.”
Somehow the cat comforted me.
“Looks like this item is modeled after The Mirror of Nitocris. It is a tool that reflects the existence of the other world.”
What, and it wasn’t an ordinary hand mirror?
“It was broken because it’s out of effect. Even if you left it as is, it would have broken anyway, meoong!”
“But….”
“It’s a mirror, can’t you just put it back together!”
Yes, even if it’s broken, it’d be better to return it. If you put the pieces together well, you might be able to put them back together.
I gathered up the mirror pieces and came out of the space. I was going to return this hand mirror to Grandma right away.
I hope she is happy.
***
It took quite a while to search through the warehouse. When I found the hand mirror, it was almost evening.
Since it was late, I thought about going to the workshop tomorrow for a while, but I changed my mind. It would be better to deliver it as soon as possible.
“Then, I’ll go. Take care of the house.”
After giving Mieum and Lime plenty of dinner, I headed to Grandma Kim Deokyi’s workshop.
When I came with Ki Yoohyun, it was easy to find, but the road was complicated to find alone.
I wanted to ask Ki Yoohyun to accompany me, but I gave up on the idea. I’m the only one who has business with Grandma, so I felt bad to ask him to come with me every time.
“Lucky.”
“Aaargh!”
I stopped to scream a little. It was fortunate that no one was around.
His burdensome handsome face and strange atmosphere have not yet left my mind. It seems that it still takes more time for the good-looking-immunity to develop.
Instead, since I found the hand mirror for Grandma, I just left a KakaoTalk message informing him of my visit.
“Um, this is probably the right way….”
The ‘Cheonggye 3-ga Workshop Street’, covered with a red sunset, had a more gloomy atmosphere than during the day.
Even the noise of work hours does not come into this alley. The faded signboards and tightly closed shutters looked like the beginning of a horror movie.
Ugh, I’m not good at horror movies.….
At this rate, an unwanted development would suddenly appear.
“Ah, there it is.”
After wandering for a while, I finally found the signboard of Grandma’s workshop.
However, the atmosphere was a little different from when I came before. The arrangement of the junk placed in front of the entrance has been changed. It looked like someone had ripped it apart.
In addition, the floor was damp.
Did it rain? But the weather was sunny today.
There was a strange smell came from somewhere.
‘Can I go in?’
As soon as I pushed the door open, someone jumped out from inside.
‘Are you a guest?’
Bugh!
He looked at me and paused for a moment, then shoved me hard on the shoulder.
“Ouch … Excuse me!”
I called him angrily, but he had already run away.
There are really all sorts of weird people. I sighed inwardly and entered the workshop. 
Then, a sound came from inside.
I quickly turned towards the sound.
“Grandma, I’m here. Are you there?
I shouted loudly, but there was no answer.
The lights were brightly lit in the workshop.
As if Grandma had just been here, there was a teacup left over from drinking on the table. It’s still warm when I touch it. However, Grandma was still nowhere to be seen.
‘Where are you?’
As I headed towards the back room, I heard a low groan.
“Ugh….”
There was an old lady lying on the floor.
“……Grandma!”
I ran quickly and got Grandma up.
“Are you okay?”
It must be difficult for her to speak. As I hurriedly examined her condition, something damp touched my hand.
….. Blood.
[Next]


Translator’s Corner:
This is why you shouldn’t go to any place alone at night.

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c38:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

I was surprised that my grandmother’s name, who died a few years ago, suddenly popped up.
Is it the same person? Park Heesun isn’t such a unique name.
However, Grandma smiled slightly and confirmed my presumption.
“She showed me a picture of her granddaughter only once. You’ve grown up.”

Grandma lightly tapped my shoulder with a delighted look. She then took a picture out of her arms and showed it to me.
Kim Deokyi, who looked a little younger, and my grandmother were in it. The two seemed to be very close.
“Did you know each other?”
“I’ve been helped by her before.”
There was a deep longing in her voice. Her gaze remained on me, but Grandma seemed to be looking at a very far place.
“She had already passed away when I asked about her news in order to repay her.”
“Yes, a few years ago, she was sick….”
“There must be a hand mirror among Park Heesun’s belongings. It’s something I lent her before. I want to get it back, so I hope you can find it.”
Grandma briefly explained the shape of the hand mirror.
However, I didn’t find such a hand mirror while cleaning up the junk left in the store. I didn’t throw away my grandmother’s stuff. No one else could have touched it.
But it was hard to refuse just because I had never seen such a thing.
It wasn’t just because the dark etheric item was absolutely necessary. It was because I felt a deep longing from Grandma.
For me, longing is always a strong emotion.
It seeps out of the cracks in memory and violently scrapes a person’s heart. There comes a moment when that vague yet enormous emotion is exceptionally unbearable. At such a time, I know how powerful memories are.
I answered carefully.
“I don’t know if there’s a hand mirror left. I’ve never seen my grandmother’s things when she was organizing them, but … I’ll look for it in the warehouse.”
“That’s enough. Thank you.”
Grandma smiled softly.
It was a face full of loneliness.
***
Kwon Rieul was looking around to see if the items in the workshop were interesting. Ki Yoohyun stood from a distance and looked at her figure.
There’s a big change in her facial expression. After hearing Kim Deokyi’s explanation, she nodded her head enthusiastically and looked at the next item. Kim Deokyi also continued to explain as if she found her reaction interesting.
It’s not that the suspicious part has completely disappeared. However, she did not appear to have a direct relationship with the Church of Starry Wisdom.
That’s a relief.
‘Because I don’t have to kill her.’
That thought was sincere.
At that moment, Kim Deokyi, who came closer, tapped Ki Yoohyun on the shoulder and talked to him.
“There’s too much power in your shoulders.”
“Yes?”
“It must be so powerful. Why don’t you relax a little bit?”
Ki Yoohyun opened his mouth to Kim Deokyi in a cold voice. His tone was polite, but there’s sharp edges on his words.
“What do you know?”
“I don’t know anything.”
“You’re joking too much. I know you can’t afford to pass that unique item in vain.”
“….”
“Why did you give her Cthugha’s Ring? Who the hell is that person?”
“You don’t seem to know either.”
“….”
Instead of answering, Ki Yoohyun looked at Kim Deokyi with a frozen expression. It was an expression that there was no time for puns, but the craftsman in hiding was still relaxed.
“Don’t make that face. I just heard a voice one day.”
“A voice … you say.”
“It said that my role is to complete the Cthugha’s Ring and hand it over to the right owner. I followed that voice. I don’t know anything else.”
“You’re saying that she is the right owner to own the Cthugha’s Ring.”
“That’s right.”
Ki Yoohyun frowned. At the end of the field of his vision, he could see Kwon Rieul, who was still happily sightseeing the workshop.
“Then who is that person? What power does she have….”
“Didn’t you hear a voice too?”
“…..”
Ki Yoohyun distorted his face. He knew what Kim Deokyi was talking about.
The atmosphere changed greatly depending on the man’s well-formed facial expression. When he removes the polite smile that he has barely maintained so far, what remains is the cold-hearted figure of the absolutist. The black eyes were as hot as a fire.
If Kwon Rieul had seen him right now, she would have been more suspicious of his identity, but she kept her eyes away from Ki Yoohyun.
“I think I’ve treated the craftsman master with enough courtesy.”
It was a warning that if she said the same thing one more time, he wouldn’t put up with it. Even so, Kim Deokyi was standing still.
Ki Yoohyun awakened as a Hunter at the age of 13.
However, unlike any other Hunter’s awakening, it was neither a coincidence nor a miracle, and there was no celebration or cheer.
His awakening was artificially prepared.
The Awakening Center.
It is known to the public as the predecessor of the Dungeon Management Office, which disappeared due to corruption, but the reality is even more terrifying.
First, those who named themselves the ‘Church of Starry Wisdom‘ occupied the upper floors of the Awakening Center. It was a pseudo-religious group that raved about searching for the truth of the universe.
Under the direction of the denomination, the ‘Center’ gathered young children to artificially create Awakeners.
Ki Yoohyun was one of those children. Without even knowing the purpose of the ‘Center‘, he thought that they were good people who took care of him who lost his family.
And that day, the ‘Center‘ opened the ‘Gate’. It was a gate that could summon demons from another world.
All the children who met the demon beyond the gate went crazy and eventually died.
A lot of time has passed, but Ki Yoohyun still remembers that day vividly.
The screams, cries, bloods, pains, …. and the voice.
[Completing The Demon Summon. Implements a demon at the specified coordinates.][……Failure. Intervention in reality is limited by Causality.][Great Demon: ████ looks at you from beyond The Ultimate Gate.]
【I’ve been waiting for you, child.  ██.】
A terrifying murmur that he heard directly in his head. He couldn’t reject the voice even if he covered his ears.
The one beyond the door was smiling.
He doesn’t know how to explain it.
An overwhelming fear that transcends human cognitive abilities. The emptiness that just exists. An amorphous chaos that drives humans crazy just by looking at them.
At the same time as the creepy sensation, a translucent window appeared in front of him.
[Great Old One: ███ ██ wants a contract with you.]
[We’ve confirmed that you’re eligible.][The Eligible: The ability is granted according to Ki Yoohyun’s will.]
[Class: Awakened as a Righteous Ruler (S).][Skill: The Power of White Light (S) has been acquired.]
………………………………
[Causality has reached its limit. Any further intervention beyond this may cause a reality collapse.][Connection is forcibly terminated … 30 seconds until the connection ends]
【I am asleep at the edge of the Abyss. Find me.】
[Connection has been terminated.]
When he woke up, there was a sea of ​​blood all around him. All the children who were with him died, and the only survivor was Ki Yoohyun.
And he awakened as the first and best S-class Hunter in Korea.
“Oh, we finally succeeded! It’s an S-class!”
“O ████, Great Demon, you finally gave us an answer!”
The Awakening Center cheered that the experiment was finally successful. Like the crazies, they didn’t seem to care about the deaths of other children.
It was disgusting.
Ki Yoohyun, who was awakened, immediately decided to destroy the Awakening Center. At that time, the only person with him was Hunter Han Yiseong.
15 years old, the end of a long fight. He succeeded in destroying the Awakening Center and driving out the Church of Starry Wisdom.
However, the denomination did not give up and moved into the shadows, and they eventually resurrected the Demon.
While climbing the dungeon to prevent the Demon’s resurrection, Ki Yoohyun thought about this.
He wants to ask the Demon who sits beyond the Ultimate Gate.Why did that happen? Why only he survived?…. why did the ‘voice’ call him that day?
But regardless of his will, time rewinded to the past.
Time that repeats again. This time, he is trying to save the world from the Demon.
The question of that day remains unanswered.
Some people say that the voice they hear when they awakened is the voice of God, and some gave it aa wonderful name like ‘The voice of The Star‘. Some even called it ‘The Holy See’.
It is known as a cosmic deity who speaks to very few Awakeneds and grants them special powers.
However, its essence is not only good for humans.
From that day on, Ki Yoohyun felt that a part of him had worn away. No matter how much he tried to recall, he can’t remember what he was like before his awakening. If he let his guard down even a little bit, he felt like the ‘voice‘ in him would devour the rest of him.
But Kim Deokyi mentioned a voice.
Ki Yoohyun frowned with displeasure.
“I heard a voice, too.”
“….!”
He was startled.
Did Kim Deokyi also sign a contract with the Divine God of the universe?
“It told me what to do and what my role was.”
“….”
“I’ve been waiting for that day since the moment I’ve awakened, and it’s only finally come true.”
Kim Deokyi’s face looked very comfortable while saying that. Ki Yoohyun slowly opened his lips.
“I don’t believe in fate.”
“Hm?”
“No matter who you hand over your unique item to … If I determine that she is interfering with my goal, I will remove her.”
“Hohoho….”
The retired craftsman, who put everything down, burst into laughter.
“As expected, there’s too much power in your shoulders. If you relax a little, you will see something.”
That’s what the craftsman said.
The enemy is still breathing in the shadows.
With a bitter smile, Kim Deokyi left.
“What are you doing there?”
“……Ah.”
At some point, Kwon Rieul approached him. Ki Yoohyun looked back with a soft smile as if he had set his blade aside.
“Grandma said I could take this. It’s pretty, right?”
She had a small flower-shaped hairpin in her hand. A white stone embedded in the center of the flower stood out.
“That’s….”
“What’s wrong?”
He tried to say that it’s a four-star rare item that reduces mental damage, but he stopped himself. It seems that she knows it as an ordinary hairpin, so it would be more comfortable not to know the truth.
She’s an ordinary person.
At least, on the surface.
Although she had awakened, let alone the denomination, she was an ordinary person who didn’t know much about hunters or dungeons.
Nevertheless, Ki Yoohyun felt a strange feeling every time he met her. Especially when he drank her coffee.
Not only her coffee’s ability to recover, but also a warm feeling that is difficult to define in a word seemed to fill him up.
Why does he feel this way … he still doesn’t know the answer right now.
“Give it to me.”
“Yes?”
Ki Yoohyun picked up the hairpin from Kwon Rieul’s hand. Then, he ran through her chestnut brown hair with his fingers, and pinned the hairpin.
Kwon Rieul stood still, motionless, until he let go of his hand. Looking at her wavy chestnut brown hair and red cheeks, Ki Yoohyun muttered lowly. Before he knew it, a faint smile appeared on his lips.
“Lucky.”
Because I don’t have to doubt you yet.
Ki Yoohyun thought so from the bottom of his heart.
[Next]

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c37:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

Page Four: I Don’t Know That Coffee Jelly is Scary

What image comes to mind when you hear the word ‘hiding’?
In the mountains with good air and water, living quietly in a deep place where no one visits? Or living a leisurely life in the countryside, teaching children or farming, and turn your back on the glamorous past? Or it’s a free-spirited life that is likely to be cast in ‘I’m a Natural Person‘?
Maybe it’s a life where you live in a well-managed Hanok and enjoy the atmosphere.
“Then where should we go?”

What if I have to go too far? Mieum and Lime need me to feed them. Should I book a train ticket? It’s better to take KTX even if it’s a little expensive, right?
Still, it wasn’t all.
The place where Ki Yoohyun called me was completely unexpected.
“Ah, Rieul-ssi, you’re here.”
“….”
“What’s wrong?”
“Wait, I’m fighting my own prejudice.”
“….?”
***
The next day, the place where Ki Yu-hyeon called me was in front of Cheonggyecheon, Cheonggye 3-ga.
When I went there at the appointed time, Ki Yoohyun was already waiting.
The black coat covering the long stretched body looked good on him. The large eyes beyond the thick-rimmed glasses found me and he smiled.
Whenever his slightly long black hair swayed gently in the wind, people passing by glanced at him.
As expected, he has a very striking appearance.
‘Why are you wearing those glasses?’
I don’t think his eyesight is bad. In the first place, Hunter’s physical ability improves upon awakening, so there is no one with poor eyesight.
Is he using it to cover his face?
Eh, that’s not possible.
It’s not a worldview where people can’t recognize your face by putting dots under your eyes or wearing glasses, and the glasses did not even cover his bright face in the slightest.
Behind Ki Yoohyun, there was a beverage advertisement shot by the 17th ranker, Hunter Oh Seoho, who is famous for his handsome looks, but honestly, he stood out more than the billboard.
Is he just wearing the glasses because he likes them?
Hmm, yes, let’s respect his taste.
“Is she here?”
I glanced around and parted my lips.
Cheonggyecheon Stream … is too urban for a reclusive master.
This street is also close to the store. I only need to take the subway, get off at Euljiro 3-ga Station, and walk a little to arrive.
The surrounding area was crowded with shops that were just opening, trucks carrying goods, and office workers who were busy walking.
“Please step aside for a moment.”
“Ah, yes.”
The man who was unloading a large box from the truck called me. I hurriedly moved sideways to avoid it.
It’s complex. The shopping district’s unique hustle and bustle was filling the surroundings. It was very different from the image of hiding that I had vaguely imagined. I thought it would be a nicer place with better air and good water….
Ki Yoohyun talked to me, who was reflecting on my own prejudice for a while.
“Come here, please.”
“Oh, let’s go!”
Ki Yoohyun made his way through the complex Cheonggyecheon shopping district. He walks fast, perhaps because of his long legs.
I hurried after him and he waited for me in front of the entrance of a narrow alley. A sign that read ‘Cheonggye 3-ga Workshop Street‘ was seen right next to it.
In the Cheonggyecheon area, there were originally small workshops of hunters of the item-making industry. There were also street vendors that handled rare items, so it was quite crowded until a few years ago. There was even a saying, ‘If it’s not in the Hunter Market, go to Cheonggyecheon’.
By the way….
“Are many places closed?”
Unlike the lively surroundings, ‘Cheonggye 3-ga Workshop Street’ had a lonely atmosphere. Although it was a weekday morning, there were more closed places than open places, and there was hardly any sign of human’s activities.
“As the hunters in the crafting industry gradually moved to large workshops, they declined a lot. It must have been a difficult environment for small workshops to survive.”
“I see….”
As I went into that old-fashioned alley for a long time, I saw a certain commercial building.
It was difficult to find the entrance because miscellaneous etheric ore and crafted items were laid out in front of it.
“Here it is.”
Ki Yoohyun opened the door that had been hidden in all sorts of things. There was a squeaking noise, noting how long no one had come and gone.
‘Is it okay to come in?’
I went to get an item and fell into a different world, this scenario is not going to happen, right?
“….Gulp.”
I carefully shoved myself into the door.
Compared to the narrow entrance, the inside was unexpectedly wide. There was even a courtyard attached to the renovated old Hanok building. If it wasn’t for this courtyard, it would have been a pretty quiet atmosphere.
After a long walk in the long courtyard, we faced a door again. The signboard covered in dust had the words ‘Kim Deokyi’s Workshop’ written on it.
Screech. I opened the creaking glass door and went inside. Soon, a harsh voice was heard from inside the dusty grass.
“I must have locked the door, how did you get in?”
“It was open….”
“I already said that I don’t sell items anymore. Hurry up and go home.”
It was a small, skinny old lady who came out from the inside.
“….It’s you.”
Her face was wrinkled, but her posture was straight and her voice was clear.
The old lady, who was not easily approachable, frowned when she looked at Ki Yoohyun and tried to kick him out as if she had nothing more to say.
I immediately remembered where I had seen this old lady. She’s the old lady from the consignment shop in the Hunter Market at that time! Someone who sold me a set of miscellaneous items and a ring for 50 rubies.
“Oh, Grandma! Hello!
I bowed my head in delight.
The Grandma, who was about to kick us out the door right away, was happy to see me.
“You are … we met at the Hunter Market back then.”
“Yes, that’s right. Ah, please call me Kwon Rieul.”
“I am Kim Deokyi. Come on in. I know you have come to see me.”
“…. Didn’t you tell me not to cross the threshold here?”
Ki Yoohyun smiled bitterly.
“Even if I say that, you still come as you please.”
Ki Yoohyun and Grandma knew each other, the world is small.
Wait, so this old lady is the reclusive master?
Come to think of it, thanks to the ring the Grandma gave me, I was able to roast coffee beans without going into the dungeon. No wonder it was good, it was an item made by a reclusive master. My respect flared up.
I immediately held out the ring with a red stone and said, “Grandma, I really enjoy using this ring you gave me before. Thank you!”
“Really? What did it work for?”
“Huh? Didn’t Grandma make it?”
“I made it, but it was luck that I completed it. All I did was pass it on to the right person.”
I think you’re being overly humble. What do you mean it was luck? A genius needs 99% skill and 1% luck.
Anyway, I answered Grandma’s question.
“This ring, it produces fire! I’m using it well for roasting coffee.”
“….”
“….”
Silence.
The calm conversation was cut off and a cold silence filled the place.
The old lady looked at me with a mysterious expression that was hard to describe. She seemed astonished, and she also seemed to be devastated.
Next to me, Ki Yoohyun was holding back his laughter. I poked his ribs as a sign of asking why he was laughing, but there was no sign of him stopping laughing.
Don’t tell me … is it not supposed to be used to light fire?
However, Grandma soon said with a soft smile.
“I’m glad you’re using it well.”
Huh, that means it’s okay, right?
Grandma took us to the room inside the workshop. There were mountains of items piled up inside the workshop, and they all looked amazing. I asked, pointing to one of the strange-looking bottles.
“Woah, there’s a lot of interesting things here. What is this?”
“It’s a potion that temporarily erases your presence.”
“What about this?”
“A neutralizer used to control the effectiveness of an item.”
“That stick over there….”
“It’s an item with only the last deadline left.”
“This brush … woah, grandma. How did you draw on such a small place?”
“Ehem, that’s about….”
While looking at the items inside, I chatted with Grandma for a while.
There were many strange items in the workshop. As I reacted enthusiastically, I could see the corners of Grandma’s mouth slowly loosened. As expected, there is no one who dislikes compliments.
The inside of the workshop, which looked like a mess at first glance, was well organized by its own laws. All of the neutralizers and etheric potions were labeled, and the item crafting tools were shiny as if they had just been cleaned.
Without attachment, someone wouldn’t have managed it this carefully.
It seems that she still like crafting items, so why is she hiding?
After a moment’s hesitation, I asked cautiously.
“Are you not making items anymore?”
“That’s right.”
“May I ask why?”
“Not for any particular reason. I just did my mission.”
“Mission…..”
Grandma didn’t say much more, she only smiled and changed the subject.
“So, why are you here today?”
E-eh. I almost forgot my point.
As I looked around, I realized that a lot of time had passed.
“I’m actually here to ask you a favor. I’m looking for a dark etheric item. I was wondering if you knew how to get it.”
“That….”
The surprised old lady soon said with a stiff expression.
“Why are you looking for it? Dark ethers can seriously harm people depending on how they are refined. If that’s the case, I can’t tell you.”
“No, not like that!”
I hurriedly waved my hand. Ki Yoohyun and everyone else’s reaction was bad, so I guess it’s a really dangerous thing.
“You can’t tell me the reason?”
“It’s not like that … I’m just not sure if you’ll believe me.”
“Let me listen and judge it for myself.”
“I need it to save my friend. For my friend … I need it.”
In order to avoid the interference of causality, there is not much that can be said, such as the story that a dark-attribute dungeon will appear soon or that Choi Yichan is going to die there.
I just said that it was a necessary item to acquire the skill to protect my friend’s body.
It must have been an insufficient explanation, but Grandma did not ask any further questions.
“It’s a small amount, but I still have an unrefined dark ether. It will be enough to make one small accessory.”
At last.
It was as if a halo was shining behind Grandma.
“Thank you! Thank you so much!”
“But instead of just giving it you, there is something I want Miss Rieul to do for me.”
“Yes? What is it? Please feel free to ask me anything!”
“I am looking for something left by someone. Her name is … Park Heesun.”
Park Heesun?
Uh, this name is….
“Is it my grandmother…..?”
[Next]

SSS-Grade Cafe in Front of The Dungeon_t.c36:
Translated by cabinfourtranslations.

No matter what I feed him, the reaction is exactly the same, is he a machine?
The truth is the man in front of me isn’t the Hunter Ki Yoohyun, but a humanoid robot, isn’t it? If he wasn’t a robot, how could he gave the same satisfaction every time?
“….What’s wrong?”
“Nothing…..”

I can’t help it. Let’s step down today and try again next time. The reason that the same result came out no matter what drink is given may be due to a different cause.
Above all, I wanted to taste the cafe mocha that smells sweet.
I put my disappointment aside and took my share of cafe mocha. The chocolate sauce, which is said to be made with the fruit of hell, was thick and delicious.
Then, suddenly, I thought about the dark etheric item.
Ki Yoohyun is also a hunter, so maybe he knows something.
The item is still unobtainable. I spoke to Ki Yoohyun, who was drinking cafe mocha, with the feeling of grasping at straws.
“Yoohyun-ssi, umh, there is something I want to ask you.”
“Yes? Please tell me.”
“Do you know about dark etheric items? I’m looking for a place to get it.”
Heck. Ki Yoohyun was surprised.
Click. He put down the cafe mocha that he hasn’t finished drinking yet.
When he raised his head, he had a cold expression on his face, as if he had become a different person in an instant. It reminded me of his appearance when he detonated the concrete bricks earlier.
Ki Yoohyun spoke with a ferociousness that seemed to be able to break my head, no, the cafe mocha cup.
“Why are you looking for it?”
“I … I need it for something.”
I’d like to explain why I need it and ask for help, but I couldn’t do that because my mouth was blocked by the system. I couldn’t talk about things that happened before the regression, just like the dungeon in Suwon.
“Come to think of it, I haven’t asked about your Hunter Class, Rieul-ssi.”
The sharp eyes stared at me. A little bit pressured by the sudden change of atmosphere, I answered the truth.
“Yes? I’m a Cafe Owner.”
“No, not that.”
“But I’m a Cafe Owner?”
“Ha …. I didn’t ask about your job, Rieul-ssi.”
“That’s why I said I’m a Cafe Owner.”
“…Fine. You don’t seem to want to answer.”
It was extremely unfair. I only told the 100% pure truth!
I looked at Ki Yoohyun with an angry heart.
I was determined not to tell anyone about my skills as much as possible. This is because the ‘Cafe in My Hand‘, a skill that can give special effects to coffee, was a better skill than I thought.
Name: Kwon RieulClass: Cafe Owner (F) (Lv. 5)Stamina 100/100, Energy 100/100Strength: 20 (+10), Intelligence: 13, Agility: 11, Luck: 12※ Strength increases by 10 with the effect of the achievement ‘Guardian of the World Tree’.
I have reached level 5, but my status as an F-class is still at rock bottom.
It is said that the sum of strength, intelligence, agility, and luck must be at least 400 to enter the dungeon. The cutline for a slightly usable Hunter is 500.
But if I add it all up….
‘Hm…..’
It’s saddening, so let’s not count.
A hunter with the ability to make buffs and recovery coffee even though she’s an F-class … it’s a perfect combination to be exploited.
In reality, when I watched the news, there have been several cases of the exploitation of hunters in the production world by binding them to messy contracts. It was not difficult to imagine signing the wrong contract and becoming a coffee-making slave. Such a thing is absolutely dreadful.
However, Ki Yoohyun did not appear to be a person to chat around. I want to ask for help if he knows about dark etheric items.
No, this is just an excuse. It was unfair to be suspected even though I revealed my Hunter Class. What’s wrong with a Cafe Owner!
“So, my Hunter Class is a Cafe Owner!”
“…..What?”
Ki Yoohyun asked with a blank expression. It was the first time I’ve ever seen this man with such a stupid expression on his face.
“I made that coffee with my skills, too. Making coffee is my skill.”
“Your skill is making coffee?”
Ki Yoohyun lifted the coffee cup in front of him and examined it. The cafe mocha, which he had only drank a couple of sips, was lightly rippling.
I extracted the espresso again in front of him and quickly made a cup of Americano. Ki Yoohyun’s staring gaze was burdensome, but fortunately, my hand moved perfectly with the power of the skill.
“Yeah, like this.”
Tak. I put down the coffee and continued to explain.
“This coffee has a special effect. If you drink it, it will give you various buffs and recovery effects.”
“….”
“Hey, Yoohyun-ssi?”
“….”
Ki Yoohyun still had a blank expression on his face. Then, without saying a word, he lifted the cup and emptied the remaining cafe mocha.
The status of the cafe mocha I just checked is like this.
[Cafe Mocha (★★★☆☆)Status: Good (Remaining Time: 00:30:00)Effect: Increases recovery speed by 200%.]
So, even if you drank the cafe mocha, it would be difficult to immediately realize the effect in a place other than a dungeon.
However, Ki Yoohyun stared briefly into the air and hardened his face. Judging from the direction of his gaze, he seemed to be checking his status window or the coffee’s description.
Then, he slowly let out a low sigh.
“No way … this is nonsense.”
“It’s real.”
“It’s the first time I’ve seen a coffee with a healing effect.”
“That’s because it’s a skill that only me can use.”
“It’s amazing that such skill exists.”
Ki Yoohyun looked genuinely shocked.
I’m glad he believes me, but … that much? I thought it was a good skill, but is it that surprising?
The following words were also far beyond my expectations.
“How can you judge this kind of coffee so cheaply?”
“…what?”
For reference, the price of Cafe Mocha is 3 rubies. I’ve just decided between 2 rubies and 3 rubies. To be honest, I don’t think it’s that cheap….
Ki Yoohyun shook his head.
“No, it’s groundbreaking to be able to recover without the risk of potion poisoning. The price is not suitable for its worth.”
“If you drink too much of this coffee, you’ll get caffeine addiction, too.”
“….Caffeine addiction?”
He gave me a look of ‘what’s wrong with that?’.
“Caffeine addiction is harder than you think.”
You can’t sleep and your head is pounding. It was never an experience I would want to go through twice.
“But the same is true. You can double-recover.”
“Hee….”
According to Ki Yoohyun, this was the case. If it is possible to recover by drinking coffee, it is twice as efficient as using potion with simple calculations. It was a huge effect when you consider how many items were consumed to increase even a little efficiency when attacking the dungeon.
In addition, the efficient recovery potions were expensive. Compared to that, this coffee price is not burdensome at all.
Hmm, that’s right.
“Meoooooooooooooong (Now you understand, human)!”
I don’t know why this cat looks so proud. It was a better skill than I thought.
“Why are you here?”
“Yes?”
It was out of the blue.
Can’t I stay here? This is my house as well as my store.
“If you promote coffee with a healing effect in a more prosperous place, not in this remote place, you can make a lot of money.”
“But … I don’t intend to work so hard.”
“Ah.”
Ki Yoohyun let out a short exclamation. The distance between our way of thinking has widened slightly after the reaction of not understanding my words at all.
“If I promote the effect of this coffee and set up a store in a busy downtown area, I have to keep working.”
I have to use my skills to the make coffee, so even if I hire a part-time worker, the coffee making is still my responsibility.
An act that goes directly against the goals of this ‘working less and resting more‘ life. I had no intention of doing such a thing.
If a customer who accidentally discovered this cafe is satisfied with the coffee, that’s already enough for me.
A store that only people who know, know. There’s something like that.
“Waeoong (Isn’t it a store that no one knows right now)….”
“It’s not the time for cats to cut in.”
“Waeoong…..”
While touching Mieum’s thick belly for a moment, Ki Yoohyun’s voice was heard.
“Certainly. It would be better to hide that skill.”
A voice without even a slight laughter was enough to stimulate my anxiety.
Umh, I will continue to live quietly from now on. Ki Yoohyun asked me, who made such a resolution anew.
“But it’s the first time I’ve heard of such a class. How did you awaken?”
“That….”
It was very embarrassing to say that I was consistent in answering that I want to take a break in a psychological test. I glossed over in vague terms.
“It just happened.”
“Just … happened?”
“Ju-just by accident! The class was decided by the system notification.”
“Waeooong (You’re so bad at lying)…..”
Mieum’s pitiful gaze was felt from the back of my head.
Wait, why am I answering this man like making an excuse? I immediately switched the positions and asked him a question.
“Then what is your class, Yoohyun-ssi? How did you awaken?”
“….”
“….”
“Are you looking for dark etheric items because you need them to make this coffee?”
I think he just changed the subject.
Well, there we go. I’ll let it slide.
“It’s similar.”
I was frustrated because I couldn’t say that I needed it to save my friend, but I want him to believe me.
“I can’t go into detail, but … I really need it for something.”
“….I understand for now.”
Ki Yoohyun, who had been pondering for a while, sighed and continued talking.
“I don’t know where dark etheric items are. It’s been a long time since the last dark-attribute dungeon occurred. However, there are some people who play tricks in the middle.”
Ah, I know this story.
Recalling what I had heard from Jina, I quickly responded.
“Are they the Neo-Crown people?”
“Yeah, they’ve been involved in smuggling for a while now. They’re stupid bastards who’s up to what they’re doing. They will be dealt with soon.”
The twinkling black eyes gleamed coldly.
But it was only for a moment. He softened his expression.
“Other than that, some people who have a lot of knowledge about items seem to know. I think she knows about it.”
“Really?”
Ki Yoohyun mentioned an item maker Hunter.
She used to be a hunter who led a famous item crafting workshop, but now she is in hiding. Since she dealt with various items, he said she must have some information.
I got a feeling. If you look at it as a game, [Let’s gather information about dark ether items 3/3 ☞ Done] seems to have popped up.
Being a hidden item maker, she seems to have a lot of information. If you watch a movie, don’t you think that a master, who has always turned their back on the world, always helps the main character? A reclusive master whom one has only heard of.
I finally found a clue.
“I can introduce you if you want.”
“Please do me a favor.”
I nodded in hope.
[Next]
